1: अ I. The letter ă, the first of the alphabet and the short vowel inherent in every consonant. See अकार. II. The pronominal theme which occurs in the declension of इदम् and is considered as a substitute for इदम् and एतत् qq. vv. III. ind. (निपात) A particle, a shorter form of न (see also अन and अना); it is used 	1 In composition with nouns, when it implies 	a. Negation. 	b. Privation or prohibition. 	c. Diminu-tion (i. e. a little). 	d. Deterioration. 	e. Similarity or comparison; in a few instances it has apparently become an expletive; cf. e. g. कुप्य and अकुप्य, उदार and अनुदार, एडमूक and अनेडमूक. If the noun begins with a vowel, it assumes the form of अन्, as अ and अन्त form अनन्त; this rule is neglected sometimes, if the vowel following the अ happen to be a ऋ; e. g. अ and ऋणिन् form अनृणिन् and sometimes अऋणिन्. 	2 In con-junction with an inflected verb, when it implies blame or re-proach; e. g. अ करोषि वै त्वं जाल्म ‘how badly thou dost (it), fool’. Accord. to an artificial E. from अत्, kṛt aff. ड. IV. ind. (निपात) An interjection of pity. V. 1. m. (अः) 	1 Vaiśvānara (in an Upan.). 	2 Brahman (m.). 	3 Viṣṇu. 	4 Siva. 2. n. (अम्) A name of the (neuter) Brahman.
2: अऋणिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णी-णिनी-णि) Free from debt or obligation; also अनृणिन्. E. अ neg. and ऋणिन्.
3: अंश् (अंश-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अंशयति or अंशापयति- p. p. अंशित) To divide, to distribute.
4: अंश I. m. (-शः) 	1 Dividing, distributing. 	2 A part. 	3 A share or portion. 	4 A fraction. 	5 The numerator of a fraction. 	6 A degree (of latitude or longitude, &c.). 	7 The name of an Āditya. 	8 (In music.) See अंशस्वर. Also confounded with अंस q. v. E. अंश्, kṛt aff. घञ्, or perhaps more correctly, अम्, uṇ(?) aff. श. II. m. n. (-शः-शम्) The shoulder, the shoulder blade. (In this sense the word is more correctly written अंस q. v.)
5: अंशक I. m. (-कः) 	1 A part. 	2 An heir, a kinsman, a relation. E. अंश, taddh. aff. कन्. II. n. (-कम्) A day. E. अंश्, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्(?).
6: अंशकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) The dividing into shares. E. अंश and करण.
7: अंशभाज् Tatpur. m. (भाक्) An heir, a coheir, one who has a share or portion. E. अंश् and भाज्.
8: अंशल m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Strong, stout, lusty. See अंसल.
9: अंशवत् m. (-वान्) A species of the Soma plant. E. अंश, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
10: अंशसवर्णन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Assimilation of fractions, ren-dering fractions homogeneous, reduction of them to uni-formity. E. अंश and सवर्णन.
11: अंशस्वर Karmadh. m. (-रः) (In music.) The tonic or modal note. It is defined as ‘the note which displays the pecu-liar melody and to which all the others are subordinate’. Also written अंसस्वर. E. अंश and स्वर.
12: अंशहर Tatpur. m. (-रः) A sharer, a divider, a coheir. E. अंश and हर.
13: अंशहारिन् Tatpur. m. (-री) A sharer, a coheir. E. अंश and हारिन्.
14: अंशांशि Bahuvr. or Avyayībh. ind. Share by share. E. अंश repeated, samāsānta aff. इच्.
15: अंशिन् m. (-शी) A sharer, a coheir. E. अंश, taddh. aff. इनि.
16: अंशु m. (-शुः) 	1 A ray of light, a sun- or moon-beam. 	2 The sun. 	3 Light, splendour, effulgence. 	4 Any thing minute or pointed (as a sun-beam). 	5 A small end of thread, a small filament &c. 	6 Dress, decoration. 	7 The name of one of the Grahas (q. v.) which serve for making libations with the juice of the Soma plant. 	8 The name of a Rishi. 	9 The name of a prince, son of Puruhotra. E. अंश्, uṇ. aff. कु, or अम्, uṇ. aff. कु, āgama शुक्.
17: अंशुक n. (-कम्) 	1 Fine cloth, muslin. 	2 Cloth in general. 	3 A mantle, a wrapper, a linen garment worn round the upper part of the body. 	4 White cloth. 	5 The leaf of the Laurus Cassia. E. अंशु, taddh. aff. क. Acc. to another E. a Tatpur. composed of अंशु and क (काश्, kṛt aff. ड).
18: अंशुजाल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) 	1 A collection or blaze of light. 	2 A parcel or pencil of rays. E. अंशु and जाल.
19: अंशुधर Tatpur. m. (-रः) The sun. E. अंशु and धर.
20: अंशुपट्ट Tatpur. n. (-ट्टम्) A peculiar kind of fine cloth made of bark. E. अंशु and पट्ट.
21: अंशुपति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) The sun. E. अंशु and पति.
22: अंशुभर्तृ Tatpur. m. (-र्ता) The sun. E. अंशु and भर्तृ.
23: अंशुमत् I. m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्) 	1 Radiant, luminous. 	2 Having small filaments. 	3 Acuminated, pointed. II. m. (-मान्) 	1 The sun. 	2 A species of the Soma plant. 	3 A prince of the solar race, son of Asamanjas, grandson of Sāgara and father of Dilīpa. 	4 A descendant of Kratha. 	5 A Ṛṣi.--f. (-मती) 	1 A name of the celestial river Yamunā. 	2 A plant (Hedysarum Gangeticum). E. अंशु, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
24: अंशुमत्फला Bahuvr. f. (-ला) The plantain (Musa paradisiaca). E. अंशुमत् and फल.
25: अंशुमाला Tatpur. f. (-ला) A garland of light, a halo. E. अंशु and माला.
26: अंशुमालिन् m. (-ली) The sun. E. अंशुमाला, taddh. aff. इनि.
27: अंशुल m. (-लः) A name of the sage Chāṇakya. E. अंशु, taddh. aff. लच्(?); properly meaning, radiant, splendid.
28: अंशुवाण Bahuvr. m. (-णः) The sun. E. अंशु and वाण.
29: अंशुहस्त Bahuvr. m. (-स्तः) The sun. E. अंशु and हस्त.
30: अंस् (अंस-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अंसयति or अंसा-पयति- p. p. अंसित) 	1 To divide, to distribute. With वि, 	1 To divide. 	2 To make powerless, to ward off (as the force of a blow). See अंश्.
31: अंस I. m. n. (-सः-सम्) 1. The shoulder, the scapula; it is mentioned in medic. amongst those मर्मन् (q. v.) the wounding of which produces lameness or palsy. 2. (m.) One of the angles of the वेदि (q. v.), compared to a shoulder. E. अम्, uṇ. aff. सन्. II. m. (-सः) 1. A part, a portion &c. See अंश. (In this mean-ing the word is more correctly written अंश.) 2. The name of a king, acc. to some, a son of Anu. E.(?).
32: अंसकूट Tatpur. m. (-टः) A bull's hump, the protuberance between the shoulders of the Indian ox. E. अंस and कूट.
33: अंसत्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) (ved.) 	1 Armour, mail. 	2 A bow. E. अंस and त्र; also derived, though without probability, from अंहस् (changed to अंस) and त्र, as preserving from evil.
34: अंसफलक Tatpur. m. (-कः) (In medic.) The upper part of the spinal column; it is mentioned amongst those मर्मन् (q. v.) the wound-ing of which produces lameness or palsy. E. अंस and फलक.
35: अंसभार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A yoke on the shoulder for car-rying burthens with. Also अंसेभार q. v. E. अंस and भार.
36: अंसभारिक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) One who carries burthens with a yoke on the shoulder. Also अंसोभारिक. E. अंसभार, taddh. aff. ष्ठन्.
37: अंसल m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Strong, stout, lusty. E. अंस, taddh. aff. लच्, also written अंशल.
38: अंसवत् m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Feeble, weak. E. अंस, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
39: अंसेभार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A yoke on the shoulder for carry-ing burthens with. Also अंसभार q. v. E. अंस (loc.) and भार.
40: अंसेभारिक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) One who carries burthens with a yoke on the shoulder. Also अंसभारिक. E. अंसेभार, taddh. aff. ष्ठन्.
41: अंस्य m. f. n. (-स्यः-स्या-स्यम्) Belonging or referring to the shoulder. E. अंस, taddh. aff. यत्.
42: अंह् I. (अहि-भ्वादि-उदात्त-अनुदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. ātm. (अंहते-आनंहे-अंहिता-अंहिष्यते-आंहिष्ट.--Caus. अंहयति-आञ्जिहत्. --Des. अञ्जिहिषते). To go. See अङ्घ्. II. (अहि-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अंहय-ति p. p. अंहित) To shine, or according to some, to speak. The radical अंह् is considered in some derivations as a substitute for हन्; see अंहति, अंहस्, अंहु &c.
43: अंहति f. I. (-तिः) 	1 Pain, distress. 	2 Sickness, disease. II. (-तिः and -ती) A gift, a donation. E. अंह्, uṇ. aff. अति; अंह् being considered here as a substitute for हन् . अंहती with fem. aff. ङीष्.
44: अंहस् n. (-हः) Sin, evil. E. अम्, uṇ. aff. असुन् and āgama हुक् or according to others from अंह् considered as a substitute for हन्. See अङ्घस्.
45: अंहसस्पति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) The intercalary month of the Hindu year. E. अंहस् (gen.) and पति.
46: अंहस्वत् m. f. n. (-स्वान्-स्वती-स्वत्) Sinful, wicked. E. अंहस्, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
47: अंहिति f. (-तिः) A gift or donation. E. See अंहति, इट् being inserted.
48: अंहु (ved.) I. m. (-हुः) 	1 Wicked, sinful, distressed. 	2 The name of an Asura. II. n. (-हु) Distress. III. n. f. (-हु-हुः) Puden-dum muliebre. E. (-अंह्,) uṇ. aff. उ.
49: अंहुभेदी Bahuvr. f. (-दी) (ved.) Whose female parts are broken (in coition; an ep. of a mare). E. अंहु and भेदी inst. of भेद्या.
50: अंहुर m. (-रः) (ved.) Wicked, sinful. E. अंह्, uṇ. aff. उरच्.
51: अंहूरण (ved.) I. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Sinful. II. n. (-णम्) Sin, evil. E. अंहूर (अंह्, uṇ. aff. ऊर), taddh. aff. न.
52: अंहोमुच् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्) (ved.) Freeing from sin, evil. E. अंहस् and मुच्.
53: अंहोयु Tatpur. f. (-युः) (ved.) Freed from sin or evil; an ep. of तनू ‘body’. E. अंहस् and यु.
54: अंह्रि m. (according to some also n.) (-ह्रिः-ह्रि) 	1 The foot. 	2 The root of a tree. See अङ्घ्रि. E. अंह्, uṇ. aff. क्रिन्.
55: अंह्रिप Tatpur. m. (-पः) A tree. E. अंह्रि and प. See अङ्घ्रिप.
56: अंह्रिस्कन्ध Tatpur. m. (-न्धः) (In medic.) The same as कूर्चशिरस् i. e. the part under the ancle joint on either side of the foot; it is mentioned amongst those मर्मन् (q. v.) the wounding of which produces swelling and pain. Also अङ्घ्रिस्कन्ध. E. अंह्रि and स्कन्ध.
57: अक् (अक-भ्वादि-घटादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्-मित्) r. 1st cl. par. (अकति-आक-अकिता-आकीत्.--Caus. अकयति) To wind or move tortuously. See also अग्.
58: अक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) 	1 Pain, affliction. 	2 Sin. E. अ neg. and क.
59: अकच Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-चः-चा-चम्) Bald, destitute of hair. II. m. (-चः) A name of Ketu, the dragon's tail, or descending node. E. अ priv. and कच: this applies to Ketu, as the symbol of the asterism is a headless trunk.
60: अकण्टक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Free from thorns, literally or metaphorically (as from enemies). E. अ priv. and कण्टक.
61: अकनिष्ठ Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ष्ठः-ष्ठा-ष्ठम्) Not the youngest. II. m. (-ष्ठः) A deified saint according to the Bauddhas. E. अ neg. and कनिष्ठ.
62: अकनिष्ठग Tatpur. m. (-गः) A deified saint according to the Bauddhas. E. अकनिष्ठ and ग.
63: अकपीवत् Tatpur. m. (-वान्) The name of one of the seven Ṛṣis or Sages during the reign of Tāmasa or the fourth Manu. E. अ neg. and कपीवत.
64: अकम्पित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unshaken, firm, not agitated or trembling. II. m. (-तः) The name of a Jaina saint, one of the pupils of the last Tīrthakara and one of the eleven chiefs of the Gaṇas or companies of the Jaina Ṛṣis. E. अ neg. and कम्पित.
65: अकर I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) One who does not act, inactive. E. अ neg. and कर. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Handless, maimed. 	2 Exempt from tax or duty, privileged. f. (-रा) Emblic myrobalan (Phyllanthus emblica). E. अ priv. and कर.
66: अकरणि Tatpur. f. (-णिः) Failure, disappointment. (It is used only as an imprecation, as तस्याकरणिरेवास्तु ‘may he fail’.) E. अ neg. and करणि.
67: अकरुण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Unfeeling, void of compassion or tenderness. E. अ neg. and करुणा.
68: अकर्कश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Soft, not hard. E. अ neg. and कर्कश.
69: अकर्ण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) 	1 Earless. 	2 Deaf. E. अ priv. and कर्ण.
70: अकर्ण्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्ण्यः-र्ण्या-र्ण्यम्) 	1 Not being in the ears. 	2 Not fit for the ears. 	3 Different from what is in or fit for the ears. E. अ neg. and कर्ण्य.
71: अकर्तन Tatpur.(?) m. (-नः) A dwarf. E.(?). This word seems doubtful and may be perhaps a misreading of वर्तन q. v.
72: अकर्मक Bahuvr. m. (-कः) (In grammar.) Having no direct object, intransitive (as a verb). See अकर्मन्. E. अकर्मन्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
73: अकर्मकृत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कृत्) I. Free from action, neces-sary as vital or essential as religious. E. अ neg. and कर्मकृत्. II. Committing improper acts. E. अकर्मन् and कृत्.
74: अकर्मण्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्यः-ण्या-ण्यम्) Not to be done, improper. E. अ neg. and कर्मण्य.
75: अकर्मन् I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्मा-र्मा-र्म) 	1 Without work, idle, unoccupied. 	2 Unfit to work, inefficient. 	3 Degraded, no longer performing essential rites. 	4 (In grammar.) Having no direct object, intransitive (as a verb). See अकर्मक, E. अ priv. and कर्मन्. II. Tatpur. n. (-र्म) 	1 Absence of occupation. 	2 Loss or neglect of essential observances. 	3 Improper act, crime, offence. E. अ neg. and कर्मन्.
76: अकर्मभोग Tatpur. m. (-गः) The renunciation of reward for virtuous actions, the liberation of the soul from the fruits of action, that is, its absorption into the divine essence which releases it from future transmigration and from the trammels of matter, bestowing the highest state of future bliss. E. अ neg. and कर्मभोग.
77: अकर्मान्वित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) I. 	1 Without work, idle, unoccupied. 	2 No longer performing essential rites, degraded. E. अ neg. and कर्मान्वित. II. Committing improper acts. E. अकर्मन् and अन्वित.
78: अकल Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Being without parts, whole, entire. E. अ priv. and कला.
79: अकल्क Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-ल्कः-ल्का-ल्कम्) 	1 Clear, clean. 	2 Free from sediment. 	3 Pure, sinless. II. f. (-ल्का) Moonlight. E. अ priv. and कल्क.
80: अकल्कता f. (-ता) Purity, honesty. E. अकल्क, taddh. aff. तल्.
81: अकल्कन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Humble, not proud. (This word is sometimes written अकल्कल.) E. अ priv. and कल्कन.
82: अकल्प Bahuvr. m. (-ल्पः) Uncontrolled (lit. not subject to rules or precepts; a vaidik epithet of Indra). E. अ priv. and कल्प.
83: अकल्माष Tatpur. m. (-षः) Name of a son of Tāmasa or the fourth Manu. E. अ priv. and कल्माष.
84: अकल्याण Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-णः-णी-णम्) Unlucky, inauspicious. II. n. (-णम्) Bad luck. E. अ neg. and कल्याण.
85: अकव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) (ved.) Not contemptible. not to be despised, superior. E. अ neg. and कव.
86: अकवारि m. f. (-रि-री) (ved.) Explained either as I. Tatpur. 1. Not having contemptible enemies--or--2. Having obtained superiority. E. 1. अ neg. and कव-अरि (enemy). 2. अकव and अरि (going to, obtaining); or as II. Bahuvr. Having enemies who are not to be despised. E. अकव and अरि (enemy).
87: अकशाय Tatpur.(?) m. (-यः) A proper name; cf. आक-शायेय. E. unknown.
88: अकस्मात् Tatpur. ind. 	1 Without a cause, without a where-fore. 	2 Immediately, instantly, presently. 	3 Suddenly, at once. E. अ neg. and कस्मात्, the fifth case of किम्.
89: अकाण्ड Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ण्डः-ण्डा-ण्डम्) Sudden, un-expected. अकाण्डे suddenly. E. अ neg. and काण्ड.
90: अकाण्डपातजात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Perishing suddenly after birth, dying as soon as born. E. अकाण्ड, and पात-जात.
91: अकाम I. Tatpur. m. (-मः) Want of desire, love, intention &c. (See काम.) E. अ neg. and काम. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) 	1 One who has no desire, no love. (See काम.) 	2 Unwilling, reluctant. 	3 Un-intentional. 	4 (In vaid. grammar; m. sc. सन्धि) The Sandhi which causes the विसर्जनीय (q. v.) to be dropped, after it has become र् before a following र्. E. अ priv. and काम.
92: अकामकर्शन Tatpur. m. (-नः) (ved.) Not disappointing de-sires. E. अ neg. and काम-कर्शन.
93: अकामतस् Tatpur. ind. 	1 Unwillingly, reluctantly. 	2 Unin-tentionally. E. अ neg. and कामतस्.
94: अकाय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Having no body. E. अ priv. and काय.
95: अकार m. (-रः) The letter अ. E. Acc. to the native etym. अ, kṛt aff. कार (v. s. v.).
96: अकारण I. Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Absence or non-existence of a cause. E. अ neg. and कारण. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Causeless. (Used also adverb. -णम् (Causelessly.) E. अ priv. and कारण.
97: अकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Not doing. (Only to be used of beings devoid of intellect.) E. अ neg. and कारिन्.
98: अकार्णवेष्टकिक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Not fit for earrings (as a face, which would not look well with earrings). E. अ neg. and कार्णवेष्टकिक.
99: अकार्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Not to be done, improper. II. n. (-र्यम्) An improper, wicked act. E. अ neg. and कार्य.
100: अकार्यकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) I. One who does not what ought to be done. E. अ neg. and कार्यकारिन्. II. One who does what ought not to be done, one who acts improperly. E. अकार्य and कारिन्.
101: अकार्ष्ण्य Tatpur. n. (-र्ष्ण्यम्) Absence of blackness. E. अ neg. and कार्ष्ण्य.
102: अकाल Tatpur. m. (-लः) 	1 Unseasonableness. 	2 Unfavourable time. 	3 Impure time or certain days considered as unfit for the performance of religious rites. E. अ neg. and काल.
103: अकालकुष्माण्ड Karmadh. m. (-ण्डः) 	1 A pumpkin born out of season. 	2 (Fig.) A useless birth. E. अकाल and कुष्माण्ड.
104: अकालज Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Unseasonable, pro-duced out of time or season; also अकालजात, अकालोत्पन्न and similar compounds. E. अकाल with ज or जात &c.
105: अकालजलदोदय Tatpur. m. (-यः) 	1 Unseasonable gathering of clouds. 	2 A fog or mist. E. अकाल and जलदोदय.
106: अकालमेघोदय Tatpur. m. (-यः) 	1 Unseasonable cloudiness. 	2 A fog or mist. E. अकाल and मेघोदय.
107: अकालसह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Impatient, prema-ture, not waiting for the proper season. E. अ neg. and कालसह.
108: अकाल्य m. f. n. (-ल्यः-ल्या-ल्यम्) Unseasonable, produced out of time or season. E. अकाल, taddh. aff. यत्.
109: अकिञ्चन I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A useless or good for nothing object, a nothing. E. अ neg. and किञ्चन. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Destitute, poor, in-digent. E. अ priv. and किञ्चन.
110: अकिञ्चनता f. (-ता) Voluntary poverty, one of the duties of a Jaina ascetic. Also अकिञ्चनत्व n. (-त्वम्). E. अकिञ्चन II, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
111: अकिञ्चनिमन् m. (-मा) Destitution, poverty, want of pro-perty. E. अकिञ्चन II, taddh. aff. इमनिच्.
112: अकितव Tatpur. m. (-वः) One who does not play or gamble. E. अ neg. and कितव.
113: अकिल्विष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Faultless, free from sin. E. अ priv. and किल्विष.
114: अकीर्ति Tatpur. f. (-र्तिः) Infamy, disgrace. E. अ neg. and कीर्ति.
115: अकुतश्चल Tatpur. m. (-लः) A name of Śiva (lit. not moving any-where, firm). E. अ neg. and कुतस्-चल.
116: अकुतोभय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Free from any danger or dread, secure. E. अ and कुतस्-भय.
117: अकुत्र ind. (ved.) To any place out of reach, astray. It occurs in the protracted form अकुत्रा. E. अकु (अ and कु), taddh. aff. त्रल्.
118: अकुप्य Tatpur. n. (-प्यम्) 	1 Gold or silver. 	2 Any metal ex-cept gold or silver. See कुप्य. E. 	1 अ neg. and कुप्य. 	2 अ compar. and कुप्य.
119: अकुमार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Not a boy, not small, not little; a vaidik epithet of Viṣṇu. E. अ neg. and कुमार.
120: अकुल Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Of no or low family, low. II. m. (-लः) A name of Śiva. f. (-ला) A name of Pārvatī, the wife of Śiva. See नकुल. E. अ 	1 deter. 	2 priv. and कुल.
121: अकुलता f. (-ता) Lowness. E. अकुल, taddh. aff. तल्.
122: अकुलीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Low, mean, of low origin or race. E. अ neg. and कुलीन.
123: अकुशल Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) 	1 Unlucky, inau-spicious. 	2 Clumsy, not clever. II. n. (-लम्) Misfortune, bad luck. E. अ neg. and कुशल.
124: अकुसीद Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) Not desirous of gain, indifferent. Also written अकुशीद. E. अ priv. and कुसीद.
125: अकूपार I. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) (ved.) Of excellent end or effect (as food). E. अ priv. -कू (inst. of कु) and पार (= अन्तः). 2. m. (-रः) 	1 The sea or ocean. 	2 The sun (ved.). E. अ priv. -कू (inst. of कु) and पार, ‘the shores of the ocean being large and those of the sun being distant’. Also written अकूवार, आकूवार, कूपार, कूवार. II. Tatpur. m. (-रः) 	1 A tortoise. 	2 The king of tur-tles, the tortoise supposed to uphold the world. E. अ neg. and कूपार (कूप and अर) ‘the tortoise not going to wells’ (but preferring morasses or the banks of a river; see कच्छप).
126: अकूर्च Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-र्चः-र्चा-र्चम्) Void of guile. II. m. (-र्चः) A deified saint according to the Bauddhas, a Buddha. E. अ priv. and कूर्च.
128: अकृच्छ्र Tatpur. m. n. (-च्छ्रः-च्छ्रम्) Freedom from difficulty, easiness. E. अ neg. and कृच्छ्र.
129: अकृच्छ्रिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-च्छ्री-च्छ्रिणी-च्छ्रि) Free from difficulty. E. अ neg. and कृच्छ्रिन्.
130: अकृत I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not done, not prepared, not wrought &c. 	2 Not accomplished, incomplete. 	3 Not made, not created, eternal. 2. n. (तम्) Any act not, or not yet, done or performed. 3. f. (-ता) (In law.) A daughter who has not been made पुत्रिका (q. v.), or to share in the privi-leges of a son. E. अ neg. and कृत. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Having performed no deed, not having done any thing. E. अ priv. and कृत.
131: अकृतकारम् Tatpur. ind. In such a way as has not been done before. E. अकृत and कारम् (कृ, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
132: अकृतज्ञ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ज्ञः-ज्ञा-ज्ञम्) Ungrateful, un-mindful of past good or of service done. E. अ neg. and कृतज्ञ.
133: अकृतबुद्धि Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धिः-द्धिः-द्धि) Not having ac-quired knowledge or understanding. E. अ neg. and कृतबुद्धि.
134: अकृतब्रण Tatpur. m. (-णः) The name of an expounder of the Purāṇas, one of the pupils of Sūta and known also under the name of Kāśyapa and Sāvarṇi. E. अ neg. and कृतब्रण.
135: अकृतात्मन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्मा-त्मा-त्म) 	1 One who has not subdued the senses, not governed the mind. 	2 One who has not attained spiritual perfection or union with the su-preme spirit. E. अ neg. and कृतात्मन्.
136: अकृतास्त्र Tatpur. m. (-स्त्रः) One who is unpractised in arms. E. अ neg. and कृतास्त्र.
137: अकृतित्व n. (-त्वम्) Awkwardness, clumsiness, unfitness. E. अकृतिन्, taddh. aff. त्व.
138: अकृतिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) Awkward, stupid, incapable of or unfit for doing any thing. E. अ neg. and कृतिन्.
139: अकृत्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) Improper, not to be done. E. अ neg. and कृत्य.
140: अकृत्यकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) One who does what is wrong or what ought not to be done. E. अकृत्य and कारिन्.
141: अकृत्रिम Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Inartificial, natural, perfect. E. अ neg. and कृत्रिम.
142: अकृत्स्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्स्नः-त्स्ना-स्नम्) Not entire, in-complete. E. अ neg. and कृत्स्न.
143: अकृप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Unmerciful, unkind. E. अ priv. and कृपा.
144: अकृपण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Liberal, not miserly. E. अ neg. and कृपण.
145: अकृश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) 	1 Full, entire. 	2 Strong, fierce. E. अ neg. and कृश.
146: अकृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) 	1 Undrawn. 	2 Untilled, uncultivated. E. अ neg. and कृष्ट.
147: अकृष्टपच्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-च्यः-च्या-च्यम्) Ripening or flowering spontaneously or without cultivation. E. अकृष्ट and पच्य.
148: अकृष्णकर्मन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्म्मा-र्म्मा-र्म्म) 	1 Free from bad actions. 	2 Guiltless, innocent. 	3 Virtuous. E. अ neg. and कृष्णकर्मन्.
149: अकेश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) 	1 Hairless. 	2 Bald. E. अ priv. and केश.
150: अकेशभार्य Bahuvr. m. (-र्यः) The husband of a bald wife. E. अकेशा (the long आ becoming short) and भार्या.
151: अकोट Bahuvr. m. (-टः) The betel-nut tree. (Areca faufel or catechu.) E. अ priv. and कोट, because it grows with a straight stem.
152: अकोविद Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) Stupid, ignorant. E. अ neg. and कोविद.
153: अकौशल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) Inexpertness, want of skill or prac-tice. In the same sense आकौशल q. v. E. अ neg. and कौशल.
154: अक्का f. (-क्का. Voc. अक्क.) A mother.
155: अक्त I. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) 1. Gone &c. E. अञ्च्, kṛt aff. क्त. 2. Anointed, oily, greasy. II. f. (-क्ता) Night. E. अञ्ज्, uṇ. aff. क्त.
156: अक्तु f. (-क्तुः) 	1 Ointment. 	2 Night. E. अञ्ज्, kṛt aff. क्तु.
157: अक्न m. f. n. (-क्नः-क्ना-क्नम्) Bent. E. अञ्च्, kṛt aff. क्त.
158: अक्रम I. Tatpur. m. (-मः) Want of order or arrangement, confusion, irregularity. E. अ neg. and क्रम. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Out of order, irre-gular. E. अ priv. and क्रम.
159: अक्रान्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Unpassed, unsur-passed, unconquered. See क्रान्त. f. (-न्ता) The egg-plant. (Solanum melongena.) E. अ neg. and क्रान्त.
160: अक्रिय I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) 	1 Inactive, dull, torpid. 	2 Abstaining from religious rites. 	3 Wicked, per-verse. E. अ priv. and क्रिया. II. Tatpur. f. (-या) 	1 Inactivity. 	2 Neglect of what ought to be done. E. अ neg. and क्रिया.
161: अक्रूर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Gentle, not cruel. II. m. (-रः) The son of Śvaphalka by Gāndinī, the pa-ternal uncle and friend of Kriṣṇa. E. अ neg. and क्रूर.
162: अक्रोध I. Tatpur. m. (-धः) Dispassionateness, restraint of anger, one of the ten duties of an anchorite. E. अ neg. and क्रोध. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Dispassionate. E. अ priv. and क्रोध.
163: अक्रोधन Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Free from anger, dispassionate. II. m. (-नः) Name of a prince, son of Ayutāyu. E. अ neg. and क्रोधन.
164: अक्लम Tatpur. m. (-मः) Absence of weariness or fatigue. E. अ neg. and क्लम.
165: अक्लिका f. (-का) The indigo plant. (Indigofera tinctoria.) E.(?)
166: अक्लिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) 	1 Unvexed, not distressed or annoyed. 	2 Unwearied, indefatigable. E. अ neg. and क्लिष्ट.
167: अक्लिष्टकर्मन् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्मा-र्मा-र्म) Unwearied in action, indefatigable. E. अक्लिष्ट and कर्मन्.
168: अक्लिष्टकारिन् m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Unwearied in action, indefatigable. E. अक्लिष्टकार, taddh. aff. इनि.
169: अक्लेद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) 	1 Incapable of distress or pain. 	2 Unfit to be pained or distressed. E. अ neg. and क्लेद्य.
170: अक्लेश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Absence of weariness or vexation. E. अ neg. and क्लेश.
171: अक्ष् (अक्षू-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st (and 5th cl.) par. (अक्षति and अक्ष्णोति-आनक्ष-अक्षिता or अष्टा-अक्षिष्यति or अक्ष्यति-आक्षीत्, du. आक्षिष्टाम् or आष्टाम्, pl. आक्षिषु or आक्षुः --अक्षित्वा or अष्ट्वा.--p. p. अष्ट.--Caus. अक्षयति-आचिक्षत्. Des. अचिक्षिषति or अचिक्षति) 	1 To reach or obtain. 	2 To pervade. 	3 To accumulate. With सम्. To pervade.
172: अक्ष I. m. (-क्षः) 	1 A die, cubic or oblong, for playing with. 	2 Beleric myrobalan (Terminalia belerica), a tree bearing a medicinal fruit, which is used also as a die. 	3 A plant (Elaeocarpus Ganitrus). 	4 The seed of this plant of which rosaries are made. In this sense it mostly occurs in com-position, as Rudrākṣa, Indrākṣa qq. vv. 	5 The name of a weight, a Karsha or sixteen māṣas. II. m. (-क्षः) 	1 A wheel. 	2 The axle of a wheel. 	3 A car. 	4 A snake. 	5 A name of Garuḍa. 	6 A proper name, be-longing to several persons, as to the son of Rāvaṇa, to a prince, son of Nara &c. 	7 Terrestrial latitude. 	8 The string that supports the two shafts of the handle of a balance in which the axis of the beam is lodged. 	9 The lower part of the temples. III. n. (-क्षम्) 	1 An eye. 	2 An organ of sense. 	3 Any thing perceptible by the senses. 	4 Sochal salt. 	5 Blue vitriol. IV. Tatpur. m. (-क्षः) 	1 The soul. 	2 Knowledge, especially sacred knowledge. 	3 Law suit, legal procedings. V. m. (-क्षः) A person born blind. VI. (In 	1 Bahuvrīhi and 	2 Avyayībhāva compositions as a substitute for अक्षि, samāsta aff. 	1 षच् and 	2 टच्) An eye. E. अक्ष ‘die’ is stated to be derived from अश्, uṇ. aff. स. For the etymology of this word see the Preface.
173: अक्षक m. (-कः) A tree (Dalbergia Oujeiniensis, Rox.). E. अक्ष Beleric myrobolan, taddh. affix कन्: from its resembling that plant; or the termination being a pleonastic affix, the word may have all the senses of the preceding. Also read अक्षिक.
174: अक्षकर्ण Tatpur. n. (-र्णः) 	1 The hypothenuse, especially of the triangle formed with the gnomon of a dial and its shadow. 	2 (In astronomy.) Argument of the latitude. E. अक्ष and कर्ण.
175: अक्षज Tatpur. m. (-जः) 	1 The thunderbolt. 	2 The diamond. 	3 A name of Viṣṇu. E. अक्ष and ज. This word is also given as अस्थिज, which is probably the better reading of it in the two first meanings.
176: अक्षण्वत् m. f. n. (-ण्वान्-ण्वती-ण्वत्) Having eyes. E. अक्षन् (substit. of अक्षि), taddh. aff. मतुप्.
177: अक्षत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Uninjured, unhurt. 	2 Unbroken, whole. II. 	1 m. (-तः) A name of Śiva. 	2 m. n. (-तः-तम्) A eunuch. III. f. (-ता) 	1 A virgin. 	2 A plant, named also Kar-kaṭaśṛṅgī or Kaṅkaḍaśṛṅgī. IV. n. and m. pl. (-तम् and -ताः) 	1 Fried grain. 	2 Whole grain. m. (-तः) 	1 Rice after thrashing and winnowing dried in the sun. 	2 Barley. E. अ neg. and क्षत.
178: अक्षतयोनि Bahuvr. f. (-निः) A virgin. E. अक्षत and योनि.
179: अक्षदर्शक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A judge. E. अक्ष (law suit) and दर्शक.
180: अक्षदृश् Tatpur. m. (-दृक्) A judge. E. अक्ष (law suit) and दृश्.
181: अक्षदेविन् Tatpur. m. (-वी) A gamester. E. अक्ष (die) and देविन्.
182: अक्षद्यू Tatpur. m. (-द्यूः) A gambler, a dicer. E. अक्ष (die) and द्यू.
183: अक्षद्यूत Tatpur. n. (-तम्) Gambling. E. अक्ष and द्यूत.
184: अक्षधर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा and -री-रम्) One who holds dice &c. See अक्ष. II. m. (-रः) A plant (Trophis aspera). E. अक्ष and धर.
185: अक्षधुर् Tatpur. f. (-धूः) The fore part of a carriage, the pole or the part, where the yoke is fixed. E. अक्ष (car) and धुर्.
186: अक्षधूर्त Tatpur. m. (-र्तः) A gamester, a gambler. E. अक्ष (die) and धूर्त.
187: अक्षधूर्तिल m. (-लः) A bull, an ox. E. अक्षधुर्, aff. तिल.
188: अक्षन्. A substitute of अक्षि, to form in the classical language the instr. dat. abl. gen. and loc. in the sing., the gen. and loc. in the dual and the gen. in the plural of अक्षि q. v.
189: अक्षपटल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) A place for administering justice, a hall of justice. E. अक्ष and पटल.
190: अक्षपरि Avyayībh. ind. In or by playing with dice. E. अक्ष and परि.
192: अक्षपाटक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A judge. E. अक्ष (law suit) and पाटक.
193: अक्षपाटिक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A judge. E. अक्ष (law suit) and पाटिक.
194: अक्षपाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) A follower of the Nyāya system of philosophy. E. अक्ष and पाद; the Nyāya is the logical school; also आक्षपाद.
195: अक्षपीडा Tatpur. f. (-डा) A creeper, named also Yavatiktā. E. अक्ष and पीडा.
196: अक्षभाग Tatpur. m. (-गः) A degree of latitude. E. अक्ष and भाग.
197: अक्षम Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) 	1 Impatient, intoler-ant. 	2 Unable, incompetent, impotent. E. अ neg. and क्षम. II. f. (-मा) 	1 Impatience, intolerance. 	2 Envy, impatience of another's success. 	3 Inability, incapacity. E. अ neg. and क्षमा.
198: अक्षमात्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) A twinkling of the eye, a moment. E. अक्ष and मात्र.
199: अक्षमाला f. (-ला) I. Tatpur. A rosary, a string of beads, especially of the seeds of the Eleocarpus. II. Bahuvr. The name of Arundhati, wife of Vasiṣṭha, (from her wearing a rosary.) E. अक्ष (a kind of seed or bead) and माला.
200: अक्षमालिन् I. m. f. n. (-ली-लिनी-लि) Wearing a rosary. II. m. (-ली) A name of Śiva. E. अक्षमाला, taddh. aff. इनि.
201: अक्षय Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Durable, permanent, imperishable. II. f. (-या) The seventh day of a lunar month, which happens on a Sunday or Monday, and the fourth, which falls on a Wednesday. E. अ priv. and क्षय.
202: अक्षयगुण Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) One who pos-sesses imperishable qualities or virtues. II. m. (-णः) A name of Śiva. E. अक्षय and गुण.
203: अक्षयता f. (-ता) Durability, imperishableness. E. अक्षय, taddh. aff. तल्.
204: अक्षयतृतीया Karmadh. f. (-या) A Hindu festival: the third day of the lunar half of the month Vaiśākha (April-May). E. अक्षय durable, and तृतीया the third day: the conse-quences of meritorious actions performed on this day being permanent, as it is the first day of the Satya Yuga or the anniversary of creation.
205: अक्षयत्व n. (-त्वम्) Imperishableness. E. अक्षय, taddh. aff. त्व.
206: अक्षयपुरुहूत Dvandva. m. (-तः) A name of Śiva. E. अक्षय and पुरुहूत.
207: अक्षयमति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) The name of a Bodhisattva. E. अक्षय and मति.
208: अक्षयलोक Karmadh. m. (-कः) Heaven, the imperishable world or region. E. अक्षय and लोक.
209: अक्षयाललिता Karmadh. f. (-ता) A Hindu festival held by women on the seventh day of the second half of the month Bhādra (August-September). E. अक्षया and ललित.
210: अक्षयिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिणी-यि) Imperishable, eter-nal. E. अ neg. and क्षयिन्.
211: अक्षय्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-य्यः-य्या-य्यम्) Imperishable, eternal. E. अ neg. and क्षय्य.
212: अक्षर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Imperishable, in-decayable. 	2 Inalterable. II. m. (-रः) 	1 A name of Śiva. 	2 A name of Viṣṇu. 	3 A sword. III. n. (-रम्) 	1 Brahma, the supreme being (in this sense it is said to be also mascul.). 	2 Eternal beatitude or ex-emption from further transmigration. 	3 Penance, religious austerity. 	4 Moral merit, law. 	5 Sacrifice. 	6 A letter of the alphabet. 	7 A syllable. 	8 The syllable om. 	9 A vowel. 	10 A plant (Achyranthes aspera). 	11 The sky or atmosphere. 	12 Water (see अक्षित). E. अ neg. and क्षर. (The gramm. author. derive this word from अश् (अशू), uṇ. aff. सर or क्सरन्).
213: अक्षरक n. (-कम्) A vowel. E. अक्षर, taddh. aff. कन्.
214: अक्षरचञ्चु m. (-ञ्चुः) A scribe, a writer. E. अक्षर, taddh. aff. चञ्चु.
215: अक्षरचण m. (-णः) A scribe. E. अक्षर, taddh. aff. चण.
216: अक्षरचन m. (-नः) A scribe. E. See the last word, of which it is given as a various reading.
217: अक्षरचुञ्चु m. (-ञ्चुः) A scribe, a writer. See अक्षरचञ्चु.
218: अक्षरजननी Tatpur. f. (-नी) A reed for writing with. See कलम. E. अक्षर (a letter) and जननी.
219: अक्षरच्छन्दस् Tatpur. n. (-न्दः) Metre regulated by the num-ber and quantity of syllables. See also वर्णवृत्त. E. अक्षर and छन्दस्.
220: अक्षरजीवक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A scribe. E. अक्षर (a letter) and जीवक who lives, i. e. who gets a livelihood by letters; also अक्षरजीविक and अक्षरजीविन्.
221: अक्षरजीविक Bahuvr. m. (-कः) A scribe. See अक्षरजीवक. E. अक्षर and जीविका.
222: अक्षरजीविन् Tatpur. m. (-वी) A scribe. See अक्षरजीवक. E. अक्षर and जीविन्.
223: अक्षरतूलिका Tatpur. f. (-का) A reed for writing with. See कलम. E. अक्षर (a letter) and तूलिका.
224: अक्षरन्यास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Scripture, a writing. See also अक्षरविन्यास. E. अक्षर and न्यास.
225: अक्षरपङ्क्ति Tatpur. f. (-ङ्क्तिः) Name of a verse or metre con-sisting of four lines, each of them containing one Dactylus and one Spondaeus (¯˘˘¯¯), named also पङ्क्ति and हंस. E. अक्षर and पङ्क्ति.
226: अक्षरमुख Bahuvr. m. (-खः) A scholar, a student. E. अक्षर (a letter) and मुख (commencement).
227: अक्षरविन्यास Tatpur. m. (-सः) 	1 Scripture, a writing. 	2 The alphabet. E. अक्षर and विन्यास.
228: अक्षरशस् ind. Syllable by syllable. E. अक्षर, taddh. aff. शस्.
229: अक्षरशून्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्यः-न्या-न्यम्) Devoid of distinct sound, inarticulate. E. अक्षर and शून्य.
230: अक्षरसंस्थान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Scripture, a writing. E. अक्षर (a letter) and संस्थान.
231: अक्षराज Tatpur. m. (-जः) The king of the dice, the die bearing the name of Kali. E. अक्ष and राज.
232: अक्षर्य m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Belonging or referring to a letter &c. See the meanings of अक्षर. E. अक्षर, taddh. aff. यत्.
233: अक्षवत् m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Having a die, &c. f. (-ती) Gaming, playing with dice. E. अक्ष (a die), taddh. aff. मतुप्.
234: अक्षवाट Tatpur. m. (-टः) An amphitheatre for wrestling, the arena of a gymnasium. Also read अक्षपाट. E. अक्ष and वाट.
235: अक्षविद् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वित्) 	1 Versed in law. 	2 Versed in play. E. अक्ष and विद्.
236: अक्षशौण्ड Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्डः-ण्डा-ण्डम्) Fond of dicing. E. अक्ष and शौण्ड.
237: अक्षसूत्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) A rosary, a string of eleocarpus seeds so used. E. अक्ष and सूत्र.
238: अक्षांश Tatpur. m. (-शः) A degree of latitude. E. अक्ष and अंश.
239: अक्षाग्र Tatpur. n. (-ग्रम्) 	1 The fore part of a car. 	2 The axle or bar to which the wheels are attached. E. अक्ष and अग्र.
240: अक्षाग्रकील Tatpur. m. (-लः) The pin of the axle of a car-riage, the linchpin, also one at the extremity of the pole. E. अक्षाग्र and कील. See also the following.
241: अक्षाग्रकीलक m. (-कः) See the preceding. E. अक्षाग्रकील, taddh. aff. कन् or as Tatpur. अक्षाग्र and कीलक.
242: अक्षार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) Natural salt, salt which is not factitious. E. अ neg. and क्षार. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not containing fac-titious salt. See अक्षारलवण and अक्षारालवण. E. अ priv. and क्षार.
243: अक्षारलवण n. (-णम्) I. Tatpur. Natural salt, as river salt &c., which has not been obtained artificially. See क्षार and लवण. E. अक्षार (which is explained as अ neg. and क्षार artificial(?) and लवण, or better: अ neg. and क्षारलवण (Dvandva): neither क्षार nor लवण. II. Bahuvr. Such food as may be eaten during a season considered impure or improper for the performance of re-ligious duties, as a season of mourning &c. (See अशौच.) It is said to consist of cows milk, ghee, rice, kidney-beans, barley, sesamum, and sea or river salt. The word occurs also written अक्षारालवण. E. अ priv. and क्षारलवण (Dvan-dva), sc. अन्न.
244: अक्षारालवण Dvandva. n. (-णम्) See the preceding, under II. E. अक्षार and अलवण.
245: अक्षान्ति Tatpur. f. (-न्तिः) 	1 Impatience, intolerance. 	2 Envy, impatience of another's superiority or success. E. अ neg. and क्षान्ति.
246: अक्षावपन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A dice-board. E. अक्ष and आवपन.
247: अक्षावाप Tatpur. m. (-पः) The keeper of tables at which gambling with dice takes place, or one who has charge of them. E. अक्ष and आवाप.
248: अक्षि n. (-क्षि; for the declension of this word in the classical language see अक्षन्) 	1 The eye. 	2 This word is used some-times to denote the numeral two. See also its synonymes नेत्र, लोचन &c. E. अश् (अशू) (or better अञ्ज्), uṇ. aff. क्सि.
249: अक्षिक m. (-कः) A tree (Dalbergia Oujeinensis). See also अक्षक-अक्षीक-आक्षिक- and रञ्जनद्रु. E. अक्षि, taddh. aff. क.
250: अक्षिकूट Tatpur. n. (-टम्) See the following. E. अक्षि and कूट.
251: अक्षिकूटक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) 	1 The ball of the eye. 	2 The pupil of the eye. See also the preceding. E. अक्षि and कूटक.
252: अक्षिगत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Hateful, hated, dis-liked. E. अक्षि and गत.
253: अक्षिगोल Tatpur. m. (-लः) The ball or globe of the eye. E. अक्षि and गोल.
254: अक्षिजाह n. (-हम्) The base of the eye. E. अक्षि, taddh. aff. जाहच्.--(It seems, however, that अक्षिजाह is a Tatpurusha, the latter part of which is an obsolete word जाह.)
255: अक्षिणी f. (-णी) One of the eight incidents or privileges ascribed by the Hindu law to ownership in the land. See अष्टभोग. E. अक्ष, taddh. aff. इनि.
256: अक्षित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not decayed, eternal. II. n. (-तम्) Water. (See अक्षर.) E. अ neg. and क्षित.
257: अक्षितारा Tatpur. f. (-रा) The pupil of the eye. E. अक्षि and तारा.
258: अक्षिति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Imperishability, eternity. E. अ neg. and क्षिति.
259: अक्षिपक्ष्मन् Tatpur. n. (-क्ष्म) The eye lash. E. अक्षि and पक्ष्मन्.
260: अक्षिपटल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) A coat of the eye. E. अक्षि and पटल.
261: अक्षिभू Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भूः-भूः-भु) Perceptible, present, manifest. E. अक्षि and भू.
262: अक्षिभेषज Tatpur. m. (-जः) A tree. (Red Loḍh.) See पट्टि-कालोध्र. n. (-जम्) Any medicament or collyrium for the eye. E. अक्षि and भेषज.
263: अक्षिभ्रुव Dvandva. n. (-वम्) The eyes and eye-brows col-lectively. E. अक्षि and भ्रू, samāsta aff. अच्.
264: अक्षिलोमन् Tatpur. n. (-म) The eye lash. E. अक्षि and लोमन्.
265: अक्षिव I. m. (-वः) A plant. (Guilandina or Hyperanthera Morunga.) II. n. (-वम्) Sea salt. See also अक्षीव.
266: अक्षिविकूणित Tatpur. n. (-तम्) A glance or side look; one with the eye lids partly closed. E. अक्षि and विकूणित.
268: अक्षीव Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Not intoxicated, sober. II. m. (-वः) A plant. (Guilandina or Hyperanthera Mo-runga.) n. (-वम्) Sea salt. See also अक्षिव. E. अ neg. and क्षीव.
269: अक्षुण्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्णः-ण्णा-ण्णम्) 	1 Unpared, uncut, not comminuted. 	2 Inexpert. 	3 Unconquered. E. अ neg. and क्षुण्ण.
270: अक्षुण्णता f. (-ता) 	1 Entireness, fulness. 	2 Want of practice or conversancy. E. अक्षुण्ण, taddh. aff. तल्.
271: अक्षुद्र Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-द्रः-द्रा-द्रम्) 	1 Not small, not little. 	2 Not mean, not envying the merits of others. II. m. A name of Śiva. E. अ neg. and क्षुद्र.
272: अक्षेत्र I. Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) 	1 A bad or barren field. 	2 (In geometry.) Lines simply combined together, as an angle (opp. to क्षेत्र or the regular figures as a triangle, a square, a cube &c.). E. अ neg. and क्षेत्र. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Having no fields, un-cultivated. E. अ priv. and क्षेत्र.
273: अक्षेत्रज्ञ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ज्ञः-ज्ञा-ज्ञम्) One who does not pos-sess spiritual knowledge &c. See क्षेत्रज्ञ. E. अ neg. and क्षेत्रज्ञ.
274: अक्षेत्रविद् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-विद्). See the preceding. E. अ neg. and क्षेत्रविद्.
275: अक्षेत्रिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्री-त्रिणी-त्रि) Not possessing a field. E. अ neg. and क्षेत्रिन्.
276: अक्षैत्रज्ञ्य Tatpur. n. (-ज्ञ्यम्) Ignorance in spiritual matters, the not knowing the nature of the soul. Also आक्षैत्रज्ञ्य. E. अ neg. and क्षैत्रज्ञ्य.
277: अक्षोट m. (-टः) 	1 A tree. (Described as a Pīlu growing in the hills.) See पीलु. 	2 A walnut. 	3 A tree bearing an oily nut. (Aleurites triloba.) See also आखोट, अक्षोड, अक्षोडक, आक्षोट, आक्षोड. E. unknown.
278: अक्षोड m. (-डः) See the preceding word, also आखोड.
279: अक्षोडक m. (-कः) See अक्षोड. E. अक्षोड, taddh. aff. कन्.
280: अक्षोभ I. Tatpur. m. (-भः) Firmness, absence of agitation. E. अ neg. and क्षोभ. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-भः-भा-भम्) Unshaken, unagitated. 2. m. (-भः) The post to which an elephant is tied. E. अ priv. and क्षोभ.
281: अक्षोभ्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-भ्यः-भ्या-भ्यम्) Unshakeable, un-disturbable. II. m. (-भ्यः) 	1 The name of a Buddha. 	2 An immense number, equal to 100 vivara, according to the Buddhists. E. अ neg. and क्षोभ्य.
282: अक्षौहिणी Tatpur. f. (-णी) A complete army, consisting of 10 anīkinī or 109,350 foot, 65,610 horse, 21,870 chariots, and 21,870 elephants. E. अक्ष and ऊहिनी.
283: अक्ष्ण I. n. (-क्ष्णम्) Time. II. See अक्ष्णया. E. अश्, uṇ. aff. क्स्न.
284: अक्ष्णया ind. 	1 Tortuously. 	2 In a wrong or bad way. E. अक्ष्ण an obsolete adj., in the instrumental case of the feminine.
285: अखट्ट m. The name of a tree (Buchanania latifolia). See प्रियाल. E. unknown.
286: अखट्टि Tatpur. m. (-ट्टिः) Childish fancy, whim, caprice. E. अ neg. and खट्टि(?).
287: अखण्ड Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ण्डः-ण्डा-ण्डम्) All, entire. (अख-ण्डा द्वादशी is the 12th day of the first half of the month Mārgaśīrṣa in the lunar year of the Hindus.) E. अ priv. and खण्ड.
288: अखण्डन Tatpur. I. n. (-नम्) 	1 Leaving entire. 	2 Admitting, non-refutation. II. m. (-नः) Time. E. अ neg. and खण्डन.
289: अखण्डित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unbroken, undi-vided. 	2 Undisturbed, uninterrupted, continuous. 	3 Unre-futed. E. अ neg. and खण्डित.
290: अखण्डितर्त्तु Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्त्तुः-र्त्तुः-र्त्तु) Fruitful, bearing fruit in due season. E. अखण्डित and ऋतु.
291: अखात Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not dug. II. m. n. (-तः-तम्) 	1 A natural pond or lake. 	2 A pool before a temple. Sometimes written आखात. E. अ neg. and खात.
292: अखाद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) Improper to be eaten. E. अ neg. and खाद्य.
293: अखिद्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्रः-द्रा-द्रम्) Unwearied, indefatig-able. E. अ neg. and खिद्र.
294: अखिल Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) All, entire, complete. (अखिलेन instr. used adverbially: entirely, completely.) E. अ priv. and खिल.
295: अखेटिक m. (-कः) A dog trained for the chase. E. This word is a various (and as it would seem erroneous) reading of आखेटिक q. v.
296: अखेदिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Untired, unwearied. E. अ neg. and खेदिन्.
297: अख्यात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unknown, obscure, not famous or notorious. 	2 Disreputable. E. अ neg. and ख्यात.
298: अख्याति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) 	1 Want of fame. 	2 Disrepute, ob-loquy. E. अ neg. and ख्याति.
299: अग् (अग-भ्वादि-घटादि-मित्-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अगति-आग-अगिता.--Caus. अगयति.) To wind or move tortuously. See अक्.
300: अग I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) Not going, not mov-ing. 2. m. (-गः) 	1 A mountain. 	2 A tree. 	3 The sun. 	4 A water jar(?). 	5 (In arithmetic sometimes used to denote) the numeral seven. E. अ neg. and ग. See अगच्छ, अगम and नग. II. m. (-गः) A snake. E. अग्, kṛt aff. अच्.
301: अगच्छ Tatpur. m. (-च्छः) A tree. See also गच्छ and अगम, अग, नग. E. अ neg. and गच्छ.
302: अगज Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) 	1 Produced on a mountain, mountainous. 	2 Produced from a tree, vegetable. II. n. (-जम्) Bitumen. See शिलाजतु. E. अग and ज.
303: अगति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) No other way or refuge, necessity. E. अ and गति.
304: अगतिक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Having no way or recourse, having no other way or recourse. E. अगति, taddh. aff. कन्.
305: अगतिकगति Karmadh. f. (-तिः) A last resource or expedient. E. अगतिक and गति.
306: अगद Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) 	1 Free from disease, healthy. 	2 Wholesome, salubrious. 	3 (In law.) Unafflicted, one free from any calamity inflicted by God or the king. II. m. (-दः) 	1 A medicament, a drug. 	2 Alexipharmacy, one of the eight branches of medicine. E. अ priv. and गद.
307: अगदङ्कार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A physician. E. अगद and कार with āgama मुम् (or better अगद in the acc. and कार).
308: अगद्य् denom. par. (अगद्यति) 	1 To be healthy. 	2 To make heal-thy, to cure. E. अगद, denom. aff. यक्.
309: अगन्तव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) Not to be visited or approached, also अगमनीय, अगम्य. E. अ neg. and गन्तव्य.
310: अगम Tatpur. m. (-मः) 	1 A mountain. 	2 A tree. E. अ neg. and गम. See also अगच्छ, अग and नग.
311: अगम्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्यः-म्या-म्यम्) 	1 Not to be visited or approached. 	2 Difficult of acquirement, unattainable. 	3 Unequalled, unsurpassable. E. अ neg. and गम्य.
312: अगम्यरूप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Of superior or un-equalled form or nature. E. अगम्य and रूप.
313: अगम्यागमन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Approaching a woman who is not to be approached, improper or illicit intercourse, in-cest. E. अगम्या and आगमन.
314: अगम्यागमनीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Referring to illicit or improper intercourse, to incest. E. अगम्यागमन, taddh. aff. छ.
315: अगम्यागामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Having illicit intercourse, incestuous. E. अगम्या and आगामिन्.
316: अगरी Bahuvr. f. (-री) A kind of grass, vulg. Deotāḍ (An-dropogon serratus). See देवताड, also गरी, खरागरी and गरागरी. E. अ prohib. and गर, the plant being an antidote.
317: अगरु Tatpur. m. n. (-रुः-रु) Agallochum (Aquilaria agallocha, Rox.). See अगुरु.
318: अगर्ब Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्बः-र्बा-र्बम्) Modest, humble, void of pride. E. अ neg. and गर्ब.
319: अगस्ति m. (-स्तिः) 	1 The name of a saint and reputed author of several hymns of the Rigveda, celebrated in Hindu my-thology, more usually entitled Agastya, and considered as the son of both Mitra and Varuṇa, by Urvaśī; hence his names Maitrāvaruṇi and Aurvaśīya. He is represented of short stature, and is said by some to have been born in a water jar; hence his names Kumbhasambhava, Ghaṭod-bhava &c. He is famed for having swallowed the ocean, when it had given him offence, wherefore he is called Pī-tābdhi. At his command the Vindhya range of mountains prostrated itself, and so remains; hence his present appel-lation. He is also mentioned as one of the oldest medical authors, considered as the civilisor of the South and as the regent of the star Canopus. 	2 The name of a tree (Sesbana grandiflora). 	3 m. plur. अगस्तयः are the descendants of Agasti. See आगस्त्य. E. अग (mountain) and अस् (to throw), uṇ. aff. ति--: Agastya having ordered the Vindhya mountain to prostrate itself before him; or according to others, a Tatpur. composed of अग (water jar) and स्त्य (from स्त्यै to condense): from his being kept and born in a wa-ter jar. (Both etymologies are apparently artificial and with-out any grammatical evidence.) See also अगस्त्य and अगस्ती.
320: अगस्तिद्रु Tatpur. m. (-द्रुः) A tree (Sesbana grandiflora). See अगस्ति. E. अगस्ति and द्रु.
321: अगस्ती f. (-स्ती) A female descendant of Agastya. q. v. E. अगस्त्य, fem. aff. ङीप्.
322: अगस्तीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Referring to Agastya. E. अगस्त्य, taddh. aff. छ.
323: अगस्त्य m. (-स्त्यः) 	1 The name of a saint. 	2 The star Canopus. 	3 The name of a tree. 	4 A name of Śiva. See अगस्ति and the E. of this word.
324: अगस्त्योदय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The seventh day in the second half of the month Bhādra in the lunar year of the Hindus. E. अगस्त्य and उदय.
325: अगा Tatpur. m. f. (-गाः-गाः) Not going. E. अ neg. and गा (from गम्, kṛt aff. विट्).
326: अगात्मजा Tatpur. f. (-जा) A name of Pārvatī, the daughter of the mountain Himālaya. E. अग and आत्मजा.
327: अगाध Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Bottomless, very deep. II. 1. m. n. (-धः-धम्) A hole, a chasm. 2. m. (-धः) The name of one of the five fires at the Svāhākāra. E. अ priv. and गाध.
328: अगाधजल Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Having very deep waters. II. m. (-लः) A deep lake. E. अगाध and जल.
329: अगार n. (-रम्) A house. See आगार.
330: अगावह Tatpur. m. (-हः) A proper name of 	1 the son of Vasu-deva by Vṛkadevī, and 	2 the son of Kṛṣṇa by Sudevā. E. अग and आवह.
331: अगिर m. (-रः) 	1 The sun. 	2 Fire. 	3 A demon, a Rākṣasa. E. अग्, aff. इर.
332: अगु Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-गुः-गुः-गु) 	1 Having no cows. 	2 Having no beams. II. m. (-गुः) A name of Rāhu or the ascending node q. v. E. अ and गो.
333: अगुण I. Tatpur. m. (-णः) A defect, a fault. E. अ neg. and गुण. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) 	1 Void of attributes. 	2 Void of good qualities, bad. E. अ priv. and गुण.
334: अगुणता (-ता) Absence of all good qualities; also अगुणत्व n. (-त्वम्). E. अगुण, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
335: अगुणवादिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Censorious, pointing out defects. E. अगुण and वादिन्.
336: अगुणशील Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Of a bad dispo-sition, worthless. E. अगुण and शीला.
337: अगुरु Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रुः-रुः or रू or र्वी-रु) 	1 Not heavy, light. 	2 Short (as a syllable). II. m. n. (-रुः-रु) 	1 A fragrant wood, aloe wood, or agallochum (Aquilaria agallocha, Rox.). 	2 The balsam tree from which is produced Bdellium (Amyris agallocha). 	3 A timber tree, commonly Sisū (Dalbergia sisu, Rox.). E. अ neg. and गुरु.
338: अगुप्त m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) I. Tatpur. Unhidden, uncon-cealed. E. अ neg. and गुप्त. II. Bahuvr. One who cannot keep a secret. E. अ priv. and गुप्त.
339: अगुरुशिंशपा Karmadh.(?) f. (-पा) A timber tree (Dalbergia sisu). The best authorities consider this as formed of two distinct words. See अगुरु and शिंशपा.
340: अगूढ m. f. n. (-ढः-ढा-ढम्) I. Tatpur. Unhidden, uncon-cealed, manifest, evident. E. अ neg. and गूढ. II. Bahuvr. One who is not secret. E. अ priv. and गूढ.
341: अगूढगन्ध Bahuvr. n. (-न्धम्) Asafoetida. E. अगूढ and गन्ध.
342: अगूढभाव Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Open, honest, candid; one whose purpose or inclinations are evident. E. अगूढ and भाव.
343: अगृभीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not taken. (In the Vedas.) E. अ neg. and गृभीत (see गृहीत).
344: अगृह Bahuvr. m. (-हः) See अग्रह. E. अ priv. and गृह.
345: अगोचर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not coming under the perception of the senses, covert, unseen, unwitnessed. II. n. (-रम्) 	1 Any act or event not the object of the senses. 	2 The imperceptible, Brahma, or the invisible Supreme. E. अ neg. and गोचर.
346: अगोह्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ह्यः-ह्या-ह्यम्) Not concealable, clear, bright (espec. as attribute of the sun, in the Vedas). E. अ neg. and गोह्य.
347: अगौकस् Bahuvr. m. (-काः) 	1 A bird. 	2 A lion. 	3 The Śarabha, a fabulous animal with eight legs. E. अग (a tree or moun-tain) and ओकस्.
348: अग्नामरुत् Dvandva. m. du. (-तौ) Agni and Marut qq. vv. E. अग्नि (changed to अग्ना) and मरुत्.
349: अग्नायी f. (-यी) 	1 A goddess, the wife of Agni, the deity of fire, and presiding over prayers accompanied with burnt offerings. 	2 The Tretā or second age of the Hindus. E. अग्नि, fem. aff. ङीप्, with ऐ substituted for इ.
350: अग्नाविष्णु Dvandva. m. du. (-ष्णू) Agni and Viṣṇu qq. vv. E. अग्नि (changed to अग्ना) and विष्णु.
351: अग्नि m. (-ग्निः) 	1 Fire; the fire for common use (or लौकिक) as well as the fire for sacrificial purposes (or वैदिक) of which there are three kinds: the Gārhapatya, the Āhava-nīya and the Dakṣiṇāgni (qq. vv.). 	2 The deity of fire, one of the most ancient and most sacred objects of Hindu wor-ship. As such Agni is considered as the mediator between men and gods, as protector of mankind and their home, and as witness of their actions; hence his invocation at all solemn occasions, at the nuptial ceremony &c. He is one of the eight Lokapālas or guardians of the world and especi-ally the Lord of the south-east quarter. He appears in the progress of mythological personification as a son of Angiras, as a king of the Pitṛs or Manes, as a Marut, as a grand-son of Śanḍila, as one of the seven Sages or Ṛṣis during the reign of Tāmasa or the fourth Manu, as a star and as a Ṛṣi or inspired author of several vaidic hymns. 	3 The fire of the stomach, the digestive faculty. 	4 Bile. 	5 Gold. 	6 A plant of which the fruit has escharotic properties (Seme-carpus anacardium). See भल्लातक. 	7 Another plant (Plum-bago zeylanica). See चित्रक. 	8 Another plant (Plumbago rosea). 	9 (In arithmetic sometimes used as) a denomination of the numeral three (because there are three sacred fires; see above). E. अङ्ग्, uṇ. aff. नि, the nasal of the root being dropped.
352: अग्निक m. (-कः) An insect of a scarlet color, the lady-bird. E. अग्नि, taddh. aff. कन् (resembling fire).
353: अग्निकण Tatpur. m. (-णः) A spark. E. अग्नि and कण.
354: अग्निकर्मन् Tatpur. (-र्म) 	1 The action of Agni or fire. 	2 (In medicine.) Application of fire for cure, cauterization. E. अग्नि and कर्मन्.
355: अग्निकारिका Tatpur. (-का) Kindling or exciting the sacri-ficial fire, by throwing clarified butter &c. into it. E. अग्नि and कारिका.
356: अग्निकार्य Tatpur. n. (-र्यम्) The same as अग्निकारिका q. v. E. अग्नि and कार्य.
357: अग्निकाष्ठ Tatp. n. (-ष्ठम्) Agallochum. See अगुरु. E. अग्नि and काष्ठ.
358: अग्निकुक्कुट Tatpur. m. (-टः) A firebrand, a lighted wisp of straw. E. अग्नि and कुक्कुट.
359: अग्निकुण्ड Tatpur. n. (-ण्डम्) A hole in the ground or an enclosed space on the surface for receiving and preserving consecrated fire. E. अग्नि and कुण्ड.
360: अग्निकुमार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A particular preparation of medicaments. E. अग्नि and कुमार.
361: अग्निकेतु Tatpur. m. (-तुः) The name of a Rakshas or demon. E. अग्नि and केतु.
362: अग्निकोण Tatpur. m. (-णः) The south-east, the quarter ruled or protected by Agni. E. अग्नि and कोण.
363: अग्निक्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या) A religious act as obsequies &c. performed by the means of fire, particularly the burning of a corpse. E. अग्नि and क्रिया.
364: अग्निक्रीडा Tatpur. f. (-डा) Illuminations, fireworks, &c. E. अग्नि and क्रीडा.
365: अग्निगर्भ Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-र्भः-र्भा-र्भम्) Being pregnant with fire. II. 1. m. (-र्भः) 	1 The sun-stone, crystal, or a fabulous gem; supposed to contain and impart solar heat. See सूर्यकान्त. 	2 A plant, see अग्निजार. 2. f. (-र्भा) The name of another plant. See महाज्योतिष्मती. E. अग्नि and गर्भ.
366: अग्निचयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Arranging the fire-place, a sa-crificial ceremony, viz. arranging on a piece of ground of merely a fathom's length, which must have been previously ploughed, consecrated bricks (see इष्टका), so as to make them to imitate the shape of a bird. There are five or in some case, six such chitis (q. v.) required for receiving the sacrificial fire. E. अग्नि (in the sense of the dat.) and चयन.
367: अग्निचित् I. Tatpur. m. (चित्) One who has arranged a sa-crificial fire-place. See अग्निचयन. II. ind. (in the Vedas.) Like Agni. E. अग्नि and चित्.
368: अग्निचिति Tatpur. f. (-तिः). The same as अग्निचयन. E. अग्नि and चिति.
369: अग्निचित्या Tatpur. f. (-त्या). The same as अग्निचयन. E. अग्नि and चित्या.
370: अग्निचित्वत् m. f. n. (-त्वान्-त्वती-त्वत्) Having householders who have arranged and consecrated a sacrificial fire-place (as a village, a sacrifice &c.). E. अग्निचित्, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
371: अग्निज Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) 	1 Produced by fire. 	2 Digestive. II. m. (-जः) 	1 A name of Viṣṇu. 	2 A plant used in me-dicine, of stimulant properties. See अग्निजात, अग्निजार, अग्निजाल. E. अग्नि and ज.
372: अग्निजन्मन् Bahuvr. m. (-न्मा) A name of Skanda, the god of war. See also अग्निभू. E. अग्नि and जन्मन्.
373: अग्निजात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) and m. (-तः) The same as अग्निज. E. अग्नि and जात.
374: अग्निजार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A medicinal plant. See अग्निज. E. अग्नि and जार.
375: अग्निजाल Tatpur. m. (-लः) A medicinal plant. See अग्निज. E. अग्नि and जाल.
376: अग्निजिह्वा Tatpur. f. (-ह्वा) 	1 A tongue of Agni, a flame of fire. (There are seven tongues of Agni. See हिरण्या, कनका, रक्ता, कृष्णा, वसुप्रभा, अतिरक्ता, बहुरूपा). 	2 A medicinal plant. See लाङ्गली and लाङ्गलिकी. E. अग्नि and जिह्वा.
377: अग्निज्वाला Tatpur. f. (-ला) 	1 A flame of fire. 	2 A plant bear-ing red blossoms used by dyers (Grislea tomentosa, Rox.). 	3 Another plant, commonly Jalapippalī. E. अग्नि and ज्वाला, from the fiery colour of its blossoms.
378: अग्नितेजस् Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-जाः-जाः-जः) Having the power of Agni or fire. II. m. (-जाः) Name of a son of Pulaha, one of the seven Ṛṣis during the reign of the 11th (a future) Manu. E. अग्नि and तेजस्.
379: अग्नित्रय Tatpur. n. (-यम्) The aggregate of the three fires &c. See अग्नित्रेता. E. अग्नि and त्रय.
380: अग्नित्रेता Tatpur. f. (-ता) The aggregate of the three fires maintained by the Brahman householder, viz. the Gārha-patya, Āhavanīya and Dakṣiṇa, qq. vv. E. अग्नि and त्रेता.
381: अग्निद Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) 	1 Setting on fire, in-cendiary. 	2 Supplying with fire. 	3 Stomachic, tonic, di-gestive. E. अग्नि and द.
382: अग्निदग्ध Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ग्धः-ग्धा-ग्धम्) Burnt with fire. II. m. pl. (-ग्धाः) The name of a particular class of Pitṛs or Manes, of such who when alive, kept up the household flame and presented oblations with fire. E. अग्नि and दग्ध. In the latter sense it would seem that the word has been taken as a Bahuvrīhi.
383: अग्निदत्त Tatpur. m. (-त्तः) The name of a prince. E. अग्नि and दत्त.
384: अग्निदमनी Tatpur. f. (-नी) A medicinal plant of narcotic properties (Solanum jacquini). See कण्ठकारिका. E. अग्नि (bile) and दमनी (what tames).
385: अग्निदिश् Tatpur. f. (-दिक्) The south-east quarter, of which Agni is the regent. E. अग्नि and दिश्.
386: अग्निदीपन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Producing appetite, stomachic. E. अग्नि and दीपन.
387: अग्निदीप्त Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) 	1 Blazing, on fire. 	2 Digestive. II. f. (-प्ता) The name of a plant. See महाज्योतिष्मती. E. अग्नि and दीप्त.
388: अग्निदेव I. Karmadh. m. (-वः) Agni, the god of fire. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. (-वः) A worshipper of fire. 2. f. (-वा) A name of the third lunar mansion, identified with the Ple-iades: Agni being the ruling deity of the constellation. Also अग्निदेवता. E. अग्नि and देव.
389: अग्निदेवत्य m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) Belonging or referring to the divinity of Agni or fire. (This word occurs also, but less correctly, in the form of अग्निदैवत्य). E. अग्निदेवता, taddh. aff. यत्.
390: अग्निदैवत Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Belonging to Agni as divinity, referring to the divinity of Agni. E. अग्नि and दैवत.
391: अग्निदैवत्य m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) See अग्निदेवत्य.
392: अग्निनक्षत्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) The third lunar mansion. E. अग्नि and नक्षत्र.
393: अग्निनयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) See अग्निप्रणयन. E. अग्नि and नयन.
394: अग्निनिर्यास Tatpur. m. (-सः) The name of a plant, also अग्निजार. E. अग्नि and निर्यास.
395: अग्निपक्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्वः-क्वा-क्वम्) Cooked or dressed with fire. E. अग्नि and पक्व.
396: अग्निपद Tatpur. n. (-दम्) The name of a plant. (?) E. अग्नि and पद.
397: अग्निपरिच्छद Tatpur. m. (-दः) The implements and apparatus used in oblations to fire. E. अग्नि and परिच्छद.
398: अग्निपरिधान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Surrounding the sacrificial fire with the paridhis (see परिधि) or wooden frames covered with skin. E. अग्नि and परिधान.
399: अग्निपरीक्षा Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) Ordeal by fire, as formerly practised by walking through it, or as subsequently prac-tised, by dipping the hand into boiling oil, holding a heated iron &c. E. अग्नि and परीक्षा.
400: अग्निपर्वत Tatpur. m. (-तः) A volcano. E. अग्नि and पर्वत.
401: अग्निप्रणयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Carrying forth the sacrificial fire, a ceremony occurring in several sacrifices, as in the Jyotiṣṭoma, the Darśapūrṇamāsa, the Chāturmāsya. It consists in taking the fire from the Prāchīnavanśa (q. v.) Manḍapa, a building erected in the centre of the Dārśikī Vedi (q. v.) and carrying it to the Āgnīdhra (q. v.) Man-ḍapa, which stands in the Saumikī Vedi (q. v.). E. अग्नि and प्रणयन.
402: अग्निप्रवेश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Entering the fire, esp. self im-molation by a widow upon the pyre of her deceased hus-band. E. अग्नि and प्रवेश. Also अग्निप्रवेशन n. (-नम्).
403: अग्निप्रस्तर Tatpur. m. (-रः) Fire-stone, flint, or any stone producing fire. E. अग्नि and प्रस्तर.
405: अग्निभ Bahuvr. n. (-भम्) Gold. E. अग्नि and भा (having the lustre of fire, brilliant as fire).
406: अग्निभु Tatpur. n. (-भु) See the following.
407: अग्निभू Tatpur. I. m. (-भूः) 	1 A name of Skanda, the Hindu deity of war. See कार्त्तिकेय, स्कन्द, अग्निजन्मन्. (Śiva hav-ing cast his seed into flame, for the purpose of generating a warrior, able to subdue Tāraka, a demon, Skanda was produced.) 	2 (In arithmetic sometimes used to denote) the numeral six (Skanda having six faces). II. n. (-भु) Water (rain being generated, according to the Hindu belief from the clouds which are produced by the smoke of fire). E. अग्नि and भू (generating from).
408: अग्निभूति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) A proper name, viz. one of the pupils of the last Tīrthakara, belonging to the family of Gotama and being one of the eleven chiefs of the gaṇas or companies of the Jaina Ṛṣis. E. अग्नि and भूति (super-human power): equal to Agni.
409: अग्निमणि Tatpur. m. (-णिः) The sun-stone. E. अग्नि and मणिः brilliant as fire. See अग्निगर्भ and सूर्यकान्त.
410: अग्निमत् m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्) 	1 Having fire in general. 	2 Having and maintaining a consecrated fire. 	3 Having a good digestion. E. अग्नि taddh. aff. मतुप्.
411: अग्निमन्थ Tatpur. m. (-न्थः) A small tree (Premna integrifolia). See मणिकारिका. E. अग्नि and मन्थ (churning), because fire is produced by friction of two pieces of its wood.
412: अग्निमन्थन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Producing fire by friction of two pieces of wood. See the preceding. E. अग्नि and मन्थन.
413: अग्निमन्थनीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Referring to अग्निमन्थन q. v. E. The preceding, taddh. aff. छ.
414: अग्निमाठर Tatpur. m. (-रः) The name of an expounder of the Rigveda. E. अग्नि and माठर.
415: अग्निमान्द्य Tatpur. n. (-न्द्यम्) Languor of the digestive organs, the want of appetite or digestion. E. अग्नि and मान्द्य.
416: अग्निमारुति Karmadh. m. (-तिः) A name of the saint Agastya. E. अग्नि fire, i. e. the fire of the stomach, the digestive fa-culty, and मारुति a name of Hanumat; because the saint could digest as well as the monkey: the epithet alludes to a story of his devouring and digesting Vātāpi, a demon, who had assumed the form of a sheep.
417: अग्निमित्र Tatpur. m. (-त्रः) The name of a prince of the Sunga dynasty. E. अग्नि and मित्र.
418: अग्निमिन्ध Tatpur. m. (-न्धः) The priest who kindles or at-tends the fire. See अग्नीध्. E. अग्नि and इन्ध, with āgama मुम् (or better अग्नि in the acc. and इन्ध).
419: अग्निमुख Bahuvr. I. m. (-खः) 	1 A deity. 	2 A Brāhmaṇa. 	3 A plant (Plumbago zeylanica). 	4 Marking nut (Semecarpus anacardium). 	5 A particular medicinal preparation promo-tive of digestion and appetite. II. f. (-खी) 	1 Marking nut (Semecarpus anacardium). 	2 Another plant, see लाङ्गलिकी. E. अग्नि and मुख.
420: अग्नियुत Tatpur. m. (-तः) Name of a Ṛṣi or sage, author of a hymn of the Rigveda. E. अग्नि and युत.
421: अग्नियोजन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A sacrificial act, viz. making the fire to join or to light up with a powerful blaze, by throw-ing ājya or clarified butter into it. E. अग्नि and योजन.
422: अग्निरक्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Maintenance of a sacred fire; preserving a fire in a family for perpetuity, which supplies that lighted on occasions of worship. E. अग्नि and रक्षण.
423: अग्निरजस् Bahuvr. m. (-जाः) An insect of a scarlet colour. E. अग्नि and रजस्. Also अग्निरज m. (-जः).
424: अग्निरुहा Tatpur. f. (-हा) The name of a plant, called Mān-sarohiṇī. E. अग्नि and रुह, fem. aff. टाप्.
425: अग्निरोहिणी Tatpur. f. (-णी) Hard, inflammatory swelling in the axilla, one of the minor diseases or क्षुद्ररोग q. v. E. अग्नि and रोहिन्, fem. aff. ङीप्.
426: अग्निलोक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The world of Agni. E. अग्नि and लोक.
427: अग्निवत् I. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्). See अग्निमत्. E. अग्नि, taddh. aff. मतुप्. II. ind. Like Agni or fire. E. अग्नि, taddh. aff. वति.
428: अग्निवर्चस् Bahuvr. m. (-र्चाः) The name of a pupil of Sūta, a teacher of the Purāṇas. E. अग्नि and वर्चस्.
429: अग्निवर्ण Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) 	1 Having the colour of fire. 	2 Having the property of fire, hot, scalding, scorching. II. m. (-र्णः) The name of a prince, the son of Sudarśana. III. f. (-र्णा) A kind of strong liquor. E. अग्नि and वर्ण.
430: अग्निवर्धक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का or -की-कम्) 	1 Tonic, stomachic. 	2 Feeding or exciting fire. E. अग्नि and वर्धक.
431: अग्निवर्धन Tatpur. I. n. (-नम्) 	1 Exciting fire. 	2 Improving the appetite. II. m. (-नः) A stomachic or any thing im-proving the appetite. E. अग्नि and वर्धन.
432: अग्निवल्लभ Tatpur. m. (-भः) 	1 A plant (Shorea robusta). 	2 Resin, pitch, the resinous and fragrant exudation of the Shorea robusta. E. अग्नि and वल्लभ, from its exciting or befriend-ing fire.
433: अग्निवाण Tatpur. m. (-णः) A fiery arrow, a rocket. E. अग्नि and वाण.
434: अग्निवाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Smoke. E. अग्नि and वाह.
435: अग्निवाहु I. Tatpur. m. (-हुः) Smoke. II. Bahuvr. m. (-हुः) A proper name of 	1 the son of Pri-yavrata by Kāmyā, and 	2 one of the ten sons of Svāyam-bhuva or the first Manu. E. अग्नि and वाहु. Also अग्निबाहु.
436: अग्निविमोचन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A sacrificial act, viz. with-drawing the fuel so as to diminish the fire after its having been made to rise in a large blaze. See अग्नियोजन. E. अग्नि and विमोचन.
437: अग्निविसर्प Tatpur. m. (-र्पः) Pain occasioned by the inflam-mation of a tumour. E. अग्नि and विसर्प.
438: अग्निविहरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Removing the sacrificial fire, a ceremony in the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice which consists in taking the fire from the Āgnīdhra Manḍapa (q. v.) and placing it in the Sadas (q. v.), another Manḍapa in the Saumikī Vedi (q. v.). E. अग्नि and विहरण.
439: अग्निवीज Tatpur. n. (-जम्) Gold. E. अग्नि and वीज.
440: अग्निवीर्य Tatpur. n. (-र्यम्) Gold. E. अग्नि and वीर्य.
441: अग्निवृद्धि Tatpur. f. (-द्धिः) 	1 Improved digestion or appetite. 	2 Increase of fire. E. अग्नि and वृद्धि.
442: अग्निवेश Bahuvr. m. (-शः) Name of one of the oldest medi-cal authorities in India. He is called also Hutāśaveśa and Bhadrakāpya. E. अग्नि and वेश.
443: अग्निशरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) The house or place where the sacred fire is kept. E. अग्नि and शरण.
444: अग्निशाल Tatpur. f. n. (-ला-लम्) The house where the sa-cred fire is kept. E. अग्नि and शाला, the latter part of the compound remaining fem. or becoming neuter.
445: अग्निशिख I. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-खः-खा-खम्) Having the splendour or the heat of fire. 2. m. (-खः) 	1 A lamp. 	2 An arrow. 	3 A fiery arrow, a rocket. 	4 The safflower plant (Carthamus tinctorius). 	5 The name of the father of Vararuchi. 3. m. n. (-खः-खम्) Saffron, the plant and die. 4. n. (-खम्) Gold. II. Tatpur. f. (-खा) 	1 Flame. 	2 A plant (Gloriosa su-perba). 	3 A medicinal plant (Menispermum cordifolium). E. अग्नि and शिखा.
446: अग्निशेखर Bahuvr. n. (-रम्) Saffron. E. अग्नि and शेखर.
447: अग्निष्टुत् Tatpur. m. (-ष्टुत्) 	1 The name of the first day of the Agniṣṭoma sacrifice (q. v.). 	2 The name of a day of the Sattra Pañchadaśarātra. E. अग्नि and स्तुत्.
448: अग्निष्टुभ् Tatpur. m. (-ष्टुप्) A proper name, the son of the sixth Manu, Chākṣuṣa, by Naḍvalā, also called Agni-ṣṭoma. E. अग्नि and स्तुभ्.
449: अग्निष्टोम Tatpur. m. (-मः) 	1 The name of a sacrifice or rather a series of offerings to fire for five days, to be celebrated in the spring. It is the first and principal part of the Jyo-tiṣṭoma, one of the great sacrifices in which especially the juice of the Soma plant is offered for the purpose of ob-taining Swarga or heaven. It is nitya or obligatory for the complete performance of the Jyotiṣṭoma and so far considered sometimes identical with it, while the other six parts or Somasansthās of this sacrifice are considered as kāmya and anitya, voluntary and supererogatory. (See अत्यग्निष्टोम, उक्थ्य, षोडशिन्, अतिरात्र, अप्तोर्याम and वाजपेय.) The Agniṣṭoma consists of three distinct parts or savanas, the prātaḥsavana with five, the mādhyandina-savana with five and the tṛtīya-savana with two stotras. 	2 The name of the Sāman or Sāmaveda verse called Yajnā-yajnīya (which begins with the words यज्ञायज्ञा वो अग्नये &c. see Sāmaveda I. 1. 4. 1.), because it closes the ceremonies of the Agniṣṭoma in the tṛtīya-savana. 	3 The name of the first day in the Sattra Pañchadaśarātra. 	5 A proper name, the son of the sixth Manu, Chākṣuṣa, by Naḍvalā, also Agniṣṭubh. 	6 A species of the Soma plant. E. अग्नि and स्तोम.
450: अग्निष्टोमयाजिन् Tatpur. m. (-जी) One who has performed the Agniṣṭoma sacrifice. E. अग्निष्टोम and याजिन्.
451: अग्निष्ठ Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ष्ठः-ष्ठा-ष्ठम्) Placed in, on or by the fire. II. m. (-ष्ठः) 	1 An iron frying pan. 	2 The eleventh yūpa or sacrificial post of the 21 posts in the Aśvamedha sacri-fice, that post to which the seventeen animals are tied. III. f. (-ष्ठा) That corner of the eight corners of the yūpa or sacrificial post which is near the fire. E. अग्नि and स्थ.
452: अग्निष्वात्त Tatpur. m. pl. (-त्ताः) Demigods or manes to whom funeral oblations are presented; a sort of manes who when alive did not maintain their domestic fires nor offer burnt sacrifices. According to some they live in the Somaloka and are sons of Marīchi and progenitors especially of the gods; according to others they are residents of the Virāja-loka, sons of Pulastya, the manes of the demigods and demons, and parents of Pīvarī. Also written अग्निस्वात्त. E. अग्निस्व (अग्नि and स्व) and आत्त (who are obtained by what belongs or is given to Agni) or अग्निषु (in or by obla-tions to fire) and आत्त (obtained viz. invoked).
453: अग्निसंस्कार Tatpur. m. (-रः) 	1 Consecration of fire, making the three fires (see अग्नि) fit for sacrificial purposes by the Agnyādhāna, the Pavamāneṣṭi (q. v.) and other prepara-tory rites which, themselves, are performed with non-con-secrated fire. 	2 The completion of any essential rite by worship with fire, especially the burning of the dead body as an essential rite of the Hindu religion. E. अग्नि and संस्कार.
454: अग्निसञ्चय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The same as अग्निचयन q. v. E. अग्नि and सञ्चय.
455: अग्निसख Tatpur. m. (-खः) The wind. E. अग्नि and सखि, sa-māsta aff. टच्.
456: अग्निसम्भव Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Originating from fire. II. m. (-वः) 	1 Wild safflower. 	2 The juice or essence of the body, lymph. E. अग्नि and सम्भव.
457: अग्निसहाय m. (-यः) 	1 The wind. 	2 A wild pigeon. E. अग्नि and सहाय.
458: अग्निसाक्षिकमर्याद Bahuvr. m. (-दः) One who binds himself with a vow in taking fire as a witness, esp. one who takes the vow of conjugal fidelity. E. अग्निसाक्षिक and मर्यादा.
459: अग्निसात् ind. Completely to fire. Only in composition with अस्, भू or कृ, i. e. to be reduced or to reduce ‘(completely to fire). E. अग्नि, taddh. aff. साति.
460: अग्निसार n. (-रम्) A medicinal application to the eyes, a collyrium from the calx of brass. E. अग्नि and सार.
461: अग्निसावर्णि Tatpur. m. (-र्णिः) A proper name, one of the fourteen Manus who preside successively over the fourteen Manvantaras of the Kalpa. E. अग्नि and सावर्णि.
462: अग्निसिंह Karmadh. m. (-हः) A proper name, the father of the seventh black Vāsudeva (q. v.). E. अग्नि and सिंह.
463: अग्निसिंहनन्दन Tatpur. m. (-नः) A proper name, the son of Agnisinha and the seventh black Vāsudeva (q. v.). E. अग्नि-सिंह and नन्दन.
464: अग्निस्तोक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A spark. E. अग्नि and स्तोक.
466: अग्निहोतृ Tatpur. m. (-ता). See अग्निहोत्रिन्. E. अग्नि and होतृ.
467: अग्निहोत्र I. Bahuvr. n. (-त्रम्) 	1 A sacrificial ceremony which consists in making oblations to fire, of milk (payas), curds (dadhi), sour gruel (yavāgū), clarified butter (ghṛta), boiled rice (odana), grain (tanḍula), the juice of the Soma plant, flesh, sesamum oil (taila) and kidney beans (māṣa), or as is practised at present, merely of milk, sesamum oil and sour gruel. There are two kinds, 1. the nitya, perpetual, ‘during the whole life’ or that Agnihotra which is addressed to Agni every evening at sunset and to Sūrya every morning at sunrise; and 2. the kāmya, voluntary or the Agnihotra which occurs only occasionally and which is performed for the attainment of some specific object, as the Mṛtāgnihotra or the Māsāgnihotra in the beginning of the Sattra Kun-ḍapāyināmayana. 	2 The same as अग्न्याधान q. v. E. अग्नि and होत्र, sc. कर्मन् ‘an act in which oblations are made to Agni’. II. Tatpur. m. (-त्रः) 	1 Fire. 	2 Havis or clarified butter. E. अग्नि and होत्र.
468: अग्निहोत्रहवणी Tatpur. f. (-णी) A wooden vessel used in sa-crifices for making libations with clarified butter. E. अग्नि-होत्र (clarified butter) and हवनी.
469: अग्निहोत्रिन् m. (-त्री) 	1 One who has performed the Agni-hotra q. v. 	2 The same as अग्न्याहित. 	3 The same as अग्नि-चित्. 	4 One who possesses or keeps a sacrificial fire. Some-times read अग्निहोतृ. E. अग्निहोत्र, taddh. aff. इनि.
470: अग्नीध् Tatpur. m. (-ग्नीत्) The priest who kindles the fire; he is one of the three priests who are subordinate to the Brahman or the Ṛtvij performing the ceremonial of the Ṛg-, Yajur- and Sāmaveda, (see ब्रह्मन्, ब्राह्मणाच्छंसिन् and पोतृ) and one of the four priests who receive the third division of the Dakṣiṇā. (See नेष्टृ, प्रतिहर्तृ and अच्छा-वाक.) E. अग्नि and इध् (instead of इन्ध्).
471: अग्नीध्र Tatpur. I. m. (-ध्रः) 	1 A proper name: the son of Priyavrata and Kāmyā, a king of Jambudvīpa; one of the ten sons of the first Manu, Svāyambhuva. 	2 The same as अग्नीध् q. v. In this meaning the word seems to be a misspelling of आग्नीध्र. II. f. (-ध्री) Kindling or exciting the sacrificial fire by throwing clarified butter &c. into it. See आग्नीध्री which seems to be the more correct form of this word. E. अग्नि and इध्र (from इन्ध्, uṇ. aff. क्रन्).
472: अग्नीन्धन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Kindling or exciting a sacrificial fire. E. अग्नि and इन्धन. See अग्निकारिका.
473: अग्नीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Fiery, relating to Agni (in the different meanings of this word). E. अग्नि, taddh. aff. छ.
474: अग्नीषोम Dvandva. m. du. (-मौ) Agni and Soma. E. अग्नि and सोम.
475: अग्नीषोमप्रणयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Carrying forth the fire and the Soma; a ceremony in the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice which takes place after the Vaisarjana homa (q. v.) and consists in taking the fire from the Prāchīnavaṇśa (q. v.) Manḍapa and carrying it to the Āgnīdhra (q. v.) Manḍapa, and in the same time taking the Soma from the Prāchīnavaṇśa and carrying it to the Havirdhāna Manḍapa, a building erected in the Saumikī Vedi (q. v.). See also अग्निप्रणयन. E. अग्नीषोम and प्रणयन.
476: अग्नीषोमीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Belonging or sacred to Agni and Soma. E. अग्नीषोम, taddh. aff. छ.
477: अग्नीषोमीयनिर्वाप Tatpur. m. (-पः) A ceremony in the Dar-śapūrṇamāsa sacrifice which is performed on the day of the full moon and consists in making libations with the Puroḍāśa (q. v.) or cake sacred to Agni and Soma and previously fried in eleven kapālas or bowls. See अग्नी-षोमीयैकादशकपाल. E. अग्नीषोमीय and निर्वाप.
478: अग्नीषोमीयपशु Karmadh. m. (-शुः) One of the three prin-cipal paśus or sacrificial animals in the Jyotiṣṭoma sacri-fice. (See also सवनीयपशु and अनुबन्ध्यपशु.) It is a goat or according to one school, a sheep, sacred to Agni and Soma, the procedings with which take place on the day called Aupavasathya or the fourth of the Agniṣṭoma (q. v.). E. अग्नीषोमीय and पशु.
479: अग्नीषोमीयपश्वनुष्ठान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The procedings with the Agnīṣomīyapaśu. See अग्नीषोमीयपशु. E. अग्नीषोमी-यपशु and अनुष्ठान.
480: अग्नीषोमीयपुरोडाश Karmadh. m. (-शः) The Puroḍāśa (q. v.) with which libations are made during the Agnīṣomīyayāga (q. v.) after having been baked in eleven kapālas or bowls. E. अग्नीषोमीय and पुरोडाश.
481: अग्नीषोमीययाग Karmadh. m. (-गः) One of the three yāgas or sacrificial acts of which consists the Pūrṇamāsa or the latter part of the Darśapūrṇamāsa sacrifice. (See also आग्नेययाग and उपांशुयाजयाग.)
482: अग्नीषोमीयैकादशकपाल Karmadh. m. (-लः) The Puroḍāśa (q. v.) or cake which is offered to Agni and Soma in the Darśapūrṇamāsa sacrifice after having been baked in eleven kapālas or bowls. See also अग्नीषोमीयपुरोडाश. E. अग्नी-षोमीय and एकादशकपाल.
483: अग्नीषोम्य m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्). The same as अग्नीषोमीय. E. अग्नीषोम, taddh. aff. यत्.
484: अग्न्यभाव Tatpur. m. (-वः) 	1 Loss or extinction of the sa-cred fire. 	2 Loss of appetite. E. अग्नि and अभाव.
485: अग्न्यस्त्र Tatpur. n. (-स्त्रम्) Fire-arms; in poetry, it is usually applied to a superhuman power over the element of fire, but occasionally indicates, apparently, a rocket. E. अग्नि and अस्त्र.
486: अग्न्यागार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A fire-temple; a chamber or build-ing where the sacred fire is kept. E. अग्नि and आगार.
487: अग्न्याधान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The placing of the fire on the ground previously prepared for it (see अग्निचयन); a cere-mony which is necessary to make the Āhavanīya and the other sacred fires (see अग्नि) fit for sacrificial use and is fol-lowed by the Pavamāneṣtis (q. v.). See अग्निसंस्कार. The act takes place in the spring, if the person belongs to the cast of the Brāhmaṇas, in the hot season or grīṣma if he is a Kshatriya, in the autumn or śarad if he is a Vaiśya and is performed once for all, to serve all future purposes. E. अग्नि and आधान.
488: अग्न्याधेय Tatpur. n. (-यम्) The same as अग्न्याधान q. v. E. अग्नि and आधेय.
489: अग्न्यालय Tatpur. m. (-यः) 	1 A place in which consecrated fire is kept. 	2 A hole, with compartments of prescribed di-mensions and shape, for the several sacred fires. E. अग्नि and आलय.
490: अग्न्याहित Bahuvr. m. (-तः) A householder who has per-formed the ceremony of the अग्न्याधान q. v. Also आहि-ताग्नि. E. अग्नि and आहित.
491: अग्न्याहिति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) The same as अग्न्याधान q. v. E. अग्नि and आहिति.
492: अग्न्युत्पात Tatpur. m. (-तः) A fiery meteor, a falling star, a comet. E. अग्नि and उत्पात.
493: अग्न्युद्धरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) A sacrificial ceremony; taking the sacred fire out of the place where it is kept, for the purpose of performing a sacrifice, as the Agnihotra, the Darśapūrṇamāsa &c. E. अग्नि and उद्धरण.
494: अग्मन् n. (ग्म) Battle. E. अज्, kṛt aff. मनिन्. See अज्मन्.
495: अग्र I. m. f. n. (-ग्रः-ग्रा-ग्रम्) 	1 Chief, principal. 	2 Prior, first. 	3 Excessive, more, much. II. n. (-ग्रम्) 	1 Top, summit, point, upper part. 	2 Front, fore part. 	3 The beginning, first part. 	4 The best, excellent. 	5 Goal, resting place. 	6 Assemblage, multitude. 	7 A weight equal to one Pala. 	8 A kind of alms give to Brahmans, four mouthfuls or according to others, food given in alms, 48 times the quantity of the alms called भिक्षा. 	9 (In astro-nomy) the sun's amplitude. E. अङ्ग्, uṇ. aff. रन्, the nasal of the radical being dropped.
496: अग्रकर Tatpur. m. (-रः) 	1 The tip of the extended hand. 	2 (Karmadh.) The right or better hand. 	3 The extremity of a ray of light; the focal point. E. अग्र and कर.
497: अग्रकाय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The fore part of the body. E. अग्र and काय.
498: अग्रग Tatpur. m. (-गः) A leader. E. अग्र and ग.
499: अग्रगण्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्यः-ण्या-ण्यम्) To be reckoned or considered as first or best. E. अग्र and गण्य.
500: अग्रगामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Preceding, go-ing before. E. अग्र and गामिन्.
501: अग्रज Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) First-born or produced. II. m. (-जः) 	1 An elder brother; the first-born. 	2 A Brahman. III. f. (-जा) An elder sister. E. अग्र and ज.
502: अग्रजङ्घा Tatpur. f. (-ङ्घा) The fore part of the thigh. E. अग्र and जङ्घा.
503: अग्रजन्मन् Bahuvr. m. (-न्मा) 	1 An elder brother or first-born. 	2 A priest or Brahman; a man of the sacerdotal tribe. 	3 Brahmā, the first-born of the gods. E. अग्र and जन्मन्.
504: अग्रजातक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A Brahman; a man of the first class. E. अग्र and जातक.
505: अग्रजाति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) A Brahman; a man of the first class. E. अग्र and जाति.
506: अग्रजिह्व Tatpur. n. (-ह्वम्) The tip of the tongue. E. अग्र and जिह्वा.
507: अग्रज्या Tatpur. f. (-ज्या) (In astronomy.) Sine of the ampli-tude. E. अग्र and ज्या.
508: अग्रणी Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णीः-णीः-णि) First, principal. E. अग्र and नी.
509: अग्रतःसर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा or -री-रम्) Going before, preceding. II. m. (-रः) A leader. E. अग्रतस् and सर.
510: अग्रतस् ind. 	1 Before, in front of. 	2 Before in rank, first &c. E. अग्र, taddh. aff. तसिल्.
511: अग्रदानिन् m. (-नी) A degraded Brahman, one who receives presents from Śūdras or things first offered to the deceased. E. अग्रदान (a present first given viz. to Śūdras or to de-ceased), taddh. aff. इनि.
