2338: अनपाकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) (In law.) The same as the pre-ceding. E. अ neg. and अपाकर्मन्.
2339: अनपाय I. Tatpur. m. (-यः) Absence of loss or diminution, permanence. E. अ neg. and अपाय. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Undiminished, un-ceasing. 2. m. (-यः) A name or epithet of Śiva. E. अ priv. and अपाय.
2340: अनपायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) 	1 Firm, constant. 	2 Durable, imperishable. E. अ neg. and अपायिन्.
2341: अनपुंसक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) (In grammar.) Not a neuter i. e. the masculine or feminine gender or a noun in these two genders. E. अ neg. and नपुंसक.
2342: अनपूपीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not fit for cakes. E. अ neg. and अपूपीय.
2343: अनपूप्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्यः-प्या-प्यम्). The same as the preceding. E. अ neg. and अपूप्य.
2344: अनपेक्ष I. Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) Carelessness, indifference, dis-regard. E. अ neg. and अपेक्षा. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्) 	1 Disregarding. 	2 Un-heeding, careless. 	3 Not requiring another thing, not referring to another thing or word in a sentence &c., independent or absolute. See निरपेक्ष. E. अ priv. and अपेक्षा.
2345: अनपेक्षत्व n. (-त्वम्) The being अनपेक्ष (II.), but more espe-cially in the sense 3. E. अनपेक्ष, taddh. aff. त्व.
2346: अनपेक्षित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Disregarded. 	2 Unheeded. E. अ neg. and अपेक्षित.
2347: अनपेक्षिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्षी-क्षिणी-क्षि) 	1 Disregarding. 	2 Unheeding, careless. E. अ neg. and अपेक्षिन्.
2348: अनपेत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Present, not passed or gone. 	2 Not devoid of, possessed of. E. अ neg. and अपेत.
2349: अनप्नस् Bahuvr. m. (-प्नाः) (ved.) Devoid of (pious) action, impious or (according to another interpretation) devoid of shape or form. E. अ priv. and अप्नस्.
2350: अनफा f. (-फा) A certain configuration of the planets; a transcription of the greek word ἀναφή.
2351: अनभिज्ञ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ज्ञः-ज्ञा-ज्ञम्) Unacquainted, ignorant, unwise. E. अ neg. and अभिज्ञ.
2352: अनभिद्रुह् Tatpur. m. (-ध्रुक्) (ved.) Not doing injury; an epithet of the Aśvins. E. अ neg. and अभिद्रुह्.
2353: अनभिभूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unsubdued, un-surpassed. 	2 Unobstructed. E. अ neg. and अभिभूत.
2354: अनभिमत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Disliked, disagree-able, unpleasant &c. (The reverse of अभिमत.) E. अ neg. and अभिमत.
2355: अनभिम्लातवर्ण Tatpur. m. (-र्णः) (ved.) Of unwithered co-lour, very bright or splendent; an epithet of Apānnapāt. E. अ neg. and अभिम्लातवर्ण.
2356: अनभिम्लान Tatpur. m. (-नः) The proper name of a gotra-or family-chief. E. अ priv. and अभिम्लान. See आन-भिम्लान.
2357: अनभिरूप Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Not handsome, not pleasing. E. अ neg. and अभिरूप.
2358: अनभिलाष Tatpur. m. (-षः) 	1 Absence of desire, indifference. 	2 Want of appetite, indigestion. E. अ neg. and अभिलाष.
2359: अनभिलक्षित Tatpur. m. (-तः) Not marked, not bearing sings or symbols (e. g. of knowledge, of astrology or of other learned acquirements, as a Vānaprastha when asking for alms). E. अ neg. and अभिलक्षित.
2360: अनभिलाषिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-षी-षिणी-षि) Not desirous, indifferent. E. अ neg. and अभिलाषिन्.
2361: अनभिव्यक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Indistinct, dim. E. अ neg. and अभिव्यक्त.
2362: अनभिशस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) (ved.) Blameless, irreproachable. E. अ neg. and अभिशस्त.
2363: अनभिशस्ति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्तिः-स्तिः-स्ति) (ved.) Blame-less, irreproachable; an epithet of ājya or clarified butter. E. अ priv. and अभिशस्ति.
2364: अनभिशस्तेनी Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नीः-नीः-नि) (ved.) Leading to what is blameless, to heaven &c. (The form अनभि-शस्तेन्यम् which is explained as the acc. masc. singul. with the meaning of the nom. neuter sing. is rather to be con-sidered as an irregular formation of the neuter with the addi-tion of अम् to the terminating नि.) E. अनभिशस्त (loc.) and नी.
2365: अनभिशस्त्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्त्यः-स्त्या-स्त्यम्) (ved.) Blame-less, irreproachable. E. अ neg. and अभिशस्त्य.
2366: अनभिषङ्ग Tatpur. m. (-ङ्गः) Detachment, disconnection, free-dom from affection or attachment. E. अ neg. and अभिषङ्ग.
2367: अनभिसन्धिकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Done unin-tentionally, or by mistake. E. अ neg. and अभिसन्धि-कृत.
2368: अनभिहित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not named, not designated. 	2 (ved.) Not tied with, not fastened with. II. m. (-तः) A proper name of a gotra- or family-chief. His descendants are called अनभिहिताः or आनभिहितयः. Acc. to others the proper name aught to be अभिहित q. v. E. अ neg. and अभिहित.
2369: अनभीशु Bahuvr. m. (-शुः) (ved.) Without reins (more esp. without the rein called अभीशु q. v.), unrefrained; an epithet of the sun. E. अ priv. and अभीशु.
2370: अनभ्यारूढ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ढः-ढा-ढम्) Not ascended, not reached. E. अ neg. and अभ्यारूढ.
2371: अनभ्यास Tatpur. I. m. (-सः) Want of practise, exercise &c.; see अभ्यास. II. m. f. n. (-सः-सा-सम्) Not near, far, far away. Also written अनभ्याश. E. अ neg. and अभ्यास.
2372: अनभ्यासमित्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) What must not be approached, what must be shunned from afar. Also written अनभ्याशमित्य. E. अनभ्यास with āgama मुम् (or taken adverbially) and इत्य.
2373: अनभ्रक Bahuvr. m. pl. (-काः) A class of Bauddha gods who reside in the first or lowest stage of the fourth sphere of the Bauddha heaven. E. अ priv. and अभ्र, samāsānta aff. कप्, literally ‘without clouds’.
2374: अनम Tatpur. m. (-मः) A Brahman, one who does not salute a Brahman, making obeisance to the gods only, and re-turning salutations with his blessing. E. अ neg. and नम who salutes(?).
2375: अनमस्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्यः-स्या-स्यम्) Unworthy of being saluted. E. अ neg. and नमस्य.
2376: अनमितम्पच Tatpur. m. f. n. (-चः-चा-चम्) Miserly, niggardly. E. अ neg. and अ-मितम्पच. Others read instead of this word, where it occurs in the Amarak., मितम्पच.
2377: अनमित्र Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Free from enemies, without enemies. II. n. (-त्रम्) The being free from or without enemies. III. m. (-त्रः) A proper name of 	1 A prince of the solar race, a descendant of Sagara, son of Nighna and brother of Raghu, the fifty-second king of Ayodhyā. 	2 A son of the king Kroṣṭu or Kroṣtṛ by Gāndhāri and father of Śini or, according to others, a grandson of Vṛṣṇi, son of Sumitra by Mādrī and brother to Śini; or, again, a grandson of Dhṛṣṭa, son of Sumitra &c. E. अ priv. and अमित्र.
2378: अनमीव Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) (ved.) 	1 Free from disease, healthy. 	2 Removing diseases, healthy (as food, plants, fire). II. n. (-वम्) Freedom from disease, good health. E. अ priv. and अमीवा.
2379: अनम्बर Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Naked, unclad, unclothed. II. m. (-रः) A Bauddha mendicant, going naked. See दिगम्बर. E. अ priv. and अम्बर.
2380: अनय Tatpur. m. (-यः) I. Bad or improper conduct, as gambling &c. (see व्यसन). E. अ deter. and नय. II. 	1 Ill-luck, bad fortune. 	2 Calamity, distress. E. अ deter. and अय.
2381: अनयङ्गत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Fallen into misfor-tune. E. अनय II., āgama मुम् and गत.
2382: अनरण्य Bahuvr. m. (-ण्यः) The proper name of a king of Ayodhyā, of the solar race; according to one authority, a son of Vāna and father of Pṛthu, according to others, a son of Sambhūta and father of Pṛṣadaśva or, again, a son of Sarwakarman and father of Nighna. Those who make him a son of Sambhūta, relate that he was slain by Rāvaṇa.
2383: अनरुस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रुः-रुः-रु) (ved.) Not sore, not wounded, sound, healed. (As a Tatpur. this word occurs only in the Vedas; it would be a Bahuvr. according to the use of अरुस् in the classic language.) E. अ neg. and अरुस्, sore, wounded; (or as a Bahuvr. अ priv. and अरुस्, sore, wound).
2384: अनर्गल Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Unrestrained, self-willed. E. अ priv. and अर्गल.
2385: अनर्घ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्घः-र्घा-र्घम्) Invaluable, priceless. E. अ priv. and अर्घ.
2386: अनर्घराघव Tatpur. n. (-वम्) The name of a drama of Mu-rāri, the subject of which are the events in the life of Rā-ma, the descendant of Raghu. E. अनर्घ and राघव, sc. नाटक.
2387: अनर्घ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्घ्यः-र्घ्या-र्घ्यम्) 	1 Priceless, invaluable, not to be bought. 	2 Different from what is valuable or re-spectable. (In the first of these meanings the word is an oxytonon, in the latter a proparoxytonon; the first mean-ing, however, is the usual one.) E. अ neg. and अर्घ्य.
2388: अनर्घ्यता f. (-ता) or अनर्घ्यत्व n. (-त्वम्) Absence of price or cost, invaluableness. E. अनर्घ्य, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2389: अनर्थ I. Tatpur. m. (-र्थः) 	1 Want of meaning, nonsense. 	2 A thing that is useless or obnoxious. 	3 Disadvantage, misfortune, calamity. E. अ neg. and अर्थ. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) 	1 Meaningless, un-meaning, nonsensical. 	2 Fruitless, vain, unprofitable. 	3 Un-happy, unlucky. E. अ priv. and अर्थ.
2390: अनर्थक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थकः-र्थका-र्थकम्) 	1 Not having the sense or meaning (of). 	2 Not-significative (as a particle &c.). 	3 Unmeaning, meaningless, nonsensical. 	4 Fruitless, vain, unprofitable. 	5 Unhappy, unlucky. E. अनर्थ II., sa-māsānta aff. कप्.
2391: अनर्थकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) 	1 Following unpro-fitable or idle pursuits. 	2 Doing mischief, causing calami-ties. E. अ neg. and अर्थकर or अनर्थ and कर.
2392: अनर्थनाशिन् Tatpur. m. (-शी) A name or epithet of Śiva. E. अनर्थ and नाशिन् ‘destroying or removing calamity’.
2393: अनर्थ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्थ्यः-र्थ्या-र्थ्यम्) Devoid of substance, useless, fit for no purpose &c.; the reverse of अर्थ्य q. v. E. अ neg. and अर्थ्य.
2394: अनर्व Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्वः-र्वा-र्वम्) (ved.) 	1 Not decaying, not passing away, imperishable, permanent. 	2 Without impediment, not thwarted, unobstructed. See the following. E. अ priv. and अर्व.
2395: अनर्वन् Bahuvr. m. (-र्वा) (ved.) 	1 Not moving, fixed. 	2 Not passing away, permanent. 	3 Without an impediment, not thwarted, unobstructed. 	4 Without an enemy or foe. See the preceding. (The declension of this word differs from that of अर्वन् in so far, as it does not assume the ādeśa तृ (i. e. त्) which is said to be the substitute of the न् in अर्वन् q. v.; e. g. अनर्वाणम्, अनर्वाणौ, अनर्वाणः.) E. अ priv. and अर्वन्.
2396: अनर्विश् Tatpur. m. (-ट्) (ved.) I. A car-man, one going with or on a cart. E. अनस्, with र् instead of स्, and विश्. (Or according to another explanation, which ap-pears, however, to be an artificial one), II. One who does not arrive where he is to go to, one not attaining the end or aim of his journey. E. अ neg. and अर् (from ऋ, kṛt aff. विच्) and विश् II.
2397: अनर्शनि Tatpur. m. (-निः) (ved.) The name of a demon slain by Indra. E. doubtful; probably अ neg. and अर्शनि.
2398: अनर्शराति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) (ved.) One whose gifts are not inauspicious or wicked, whose offerings do not cause pain. A various reading of this word in the Sāmaveda is अलर्षि-राति q. v. E. अ neg. and अर्श-राति (Bahuvr.).
2399: अनर्ह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्हः-र्हा-र्हम्) 	1 Not deserving. 	2 Un-worthy. 	3 Not fit, unsuitable. E. अ neg. and अर्ह.
2400: अनल m. (-लः) 	1 Fire. 	2 A name of Agni or the god of fire. 	3 The name of one of the eight Vasus. 	4 A name of Vasu-deva. 	5 The proper name of a Muni. 	6 The proper name of a monkey (in the Rāmāyaṇa). 	7 The fire of the stomach, digestive faculty. 	8 Bile. 	9 The name of several plants, viz. 	a. Plumbago zeylanica (see चित्रक), 	b. Plumbago rosea (see रक्तचित्रक), 	c. Semicarpus anacardium (see भल्लातक). 	10 Wind. 	11 (In astronomy.) The name of the fiftieth year of Bṛhaspati's cycle of sixty years. 	12 (In astronomy.) The name of the third lunar mansion or Kṛttikā(?). 	13 (In arithmetic sometimes used to denote) the numeral three; see अग्नि(9.). E. अन्, in the causative, uṇ. aff. कलच्; (अनल belongs to the वृषादि).
2401: अनलङ्करिष्णु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णुः-ष्णुः-ष्णु) 	1 Not fond of ornaments, dress &c. 	2 Not making show of ornaments, not ornamented. E. अ neg. and अलङ्करिष्णु.
2402: अनलदीपन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Producing appetite, stomachic. See अग्निदीपन. E. अनल and दीपन.
2403: अनलप्रभा Tatpur. f. (-भा) The name of a plant (Halicaca-bum cardiospermum); see ज्योतिष्मती. E. अनल and प्रभा ‘fire-shine’.
2404: अनलप्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या) The wife of Agni. E. अनल and प्रिया.
2405: अनलम् Tatpur. ind. Not enough, insufficient, unequal, un-able. E. अ neg. and अलम्.
2406: अनलवाट Tatpur. m. (-टः) The name of ancient Pattana. E. अनल and वाट.
2407: अनलस Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सः-सा-सम्) 	1 Not indolent or lazy. 	2 Diligent, industrious. E. अ neg. and अलस.
2408: अनलसाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Decrease of digestive faculty, loss of appetite; lit. decay of the stomachic fire. E. अनल 7. and साद.
2409: अनलि m. (-लिः) The name of a tree (Sesbana grandiflora); see अगस्तिद्रु. E. अनल, taddh. aff. इ(?).
2410: अनल्प Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ल्पः-ल्पा-ल्पम्) Not a little, much. E. अ neg. and अल्प.
2411: अनल्पघोष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Making much noise, vociferous. E. अनल्प and घोष.
2412: अनवकाश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) 	1 Having no op-portunity &c.; see अवकाश. 	2 Having no proper place, ir-relevant, unessential; (as words of an instance &c. which have no bearing on the rule to be illustrated, opposed to those words of it which are essential for the purpose). E. अ priv. and अवकाश.
2413: अनवकाशता f. (-ता) or अनवकाशत्व n. (-त्वम्) The being irrelevant or unessential. E. अनवकाश, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2414: अनवग्रह Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Not to be obstructed or impeded, resistless. E. अ priv. and अवग्रह.
2415: अनवच्छिन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) 	1 Not cut, not separated, uninterrupted. 	2 Unbounded. 	3 Immoderate, ex-cessive. 	4 (In Nyāya phil.) Undiscriminated. E. अ neg. and अवच्छिन्न.
2416: अनवच्छिन्नहास Karmadh. m. (-सः) Uninterrupted or excessive laughter. See अतिहास. E. अनवच्छिन्न and हास.
2417: अनवतप्त Tatpur. m. (-प्तः) (In Buddhist mythology and legends.) 	1 The name of a serpent-king. 	2 The name of a renowned lake where the disciples of Śākyamuni held several of their meetings; probably the same as Rāvaṇa-hrada. E. अ neg. and अवतप्त.
2418: अनवत्. See the E. of the following.
2419: अनवत्त्व n. (-त्त्वम्) The being endowed with life, the pro-perty or quality of what is living. E. अनवत् (endowed with life, breathing, living, from अन III., taddh. aff. मतुप्, but occurring only as the thematic form of this word), taddh. aff. त्व; used in a vaidik commentary, to explain one meaning of the word असुरत्व.
2420: अनवद्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) 	1 Blameless, irre-proachable. 	2 Unobjectionable, allowable. II. f. (-द्या) The proper name of an Apsaras, the daugh-ter of Prādhā.
2421: अनवद्यरूप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Of faultless form, beautiful. E. अनवद्य and रूप.
2422: अनवद्याङ्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गी or ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Of fault-less form, beautiful. E. अनवद्य and अङ्ग, fem. ङीष् or टाप्.
2423: अनवधान I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Inadvertence, inattention, carelessness. See also अनवधानता and अनवहितत्व. E. अ neg. and अवधान. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Inattentive, careless. E. अ priv. and अवधान.
2424: अनवधानता f. (-ता) Inadvertence, inattention, carelessness. E. अनवधान II., taddh. aff. तल्.
2425: अनवधि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धिः-धिः-धि) Illimited, infinite. E. अ priv. and अवधि.
2426: अनवधृष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) Not to be hurt or overcome, invincible, uninjurable. E. अ neg. and अवधृष्य.
2427: अनवन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Affording no help or protection. E. अ priv. and अवन.
2428: अनवनामितवैजयन्त Bahuvr. m. (-न्तः) The name of a Buddhist future universe; one in which Ānanda is to reappear under the name of Sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍita. E. अनवनामित and वैजयन्त, literally: with banners unprostrate i. e. always victorious(?).
2429: अनवपृग्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्णः-ग्णा-ग्णम्) (ved.) Not mixed, not kept together (an epithet of the lustre of the sun which is not kept together, on a limited space, but shed over the world). E. अ neg. and अवपृग्ण.
2430: अनवब्रव Bahuvr. m. (-वः) (ved.) One whose words are not thrown away, whose commands are not idle or given in vain, who commands respect. E. अ priv. and अवब्रव.
2431: अनवभ्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-भ्रः-भ्रा-भ्रम्) (ved.) Having suffered no loss or diminution, undiminished. E. अ priv. and अवभ्र. See the following.
2432: अनवभ्रराधस् Bahuvr. m. (-धाः) (ved.) With undiminished riches, in the fulness of wealth; esp. in the plural, as an epithet of the Maruts, the riches of which consist, according to the commentators, in the clarified butter &c. they re-ceive in the sacrifice. E. अनवभ्र and राधस्.
2433: अनवम Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Not low, high, il-lustrious. E. अ neg. and अवम.
2434: अनवमर्शम् Tatpur. ind. Without touching. E. अ neg. and अवमर्शम्.
2435: अनवर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Not inferior, not less. 	2 Excellent, superior. E. अ neg. and अवर.
2436: अनवरत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Uninterrupted, con-tinual, eternal.--अनवरतम् used adv., continually, eter-nally. E. अ neg. and अवरत.
2437: अनवरथ Bahuvr.(?) m. (-थः) The name of a prince, descend-ant from Kroṣṭṛ, the son of Madhu and father of Kuru-vatsa; his grandson is Anuratha. E. अ priv. and अवरथ(?).
2438: अनवरार्ध्य m. f. n. (-र्ध्यः-र्ध्या-र्ध्यम्) Chief, principal, best. E. अ neg. and अवरार्ध (forming a Tatpur.), taddh. aff. यत्.
2439: अनवलम्ब Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-म्बः-म्बा-म्बम्) Without support, dependance &c.; see अवलम्ब. E. अ priv. and अवलम्ब.
2440: अनवलोभन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) One of the संस्कार q. v., a purificatory rite observed in the third month after concep-tion. E. अ neg. and अवलोभन.
2441: अनवस Bahuvr. m. (-सः) (ved.) Without food while travelling. (See अवस.) E. अ priv. and अवस.
2442: अनवसर I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) 	1 Want of leisure or opportunity. 	2 Unseasonableness, inopportuneness. E. अ neg. and अवसर. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Having no leisure, occupied, busy. 	2 Unseasonable, inopportune. E. अ priv. and अवसर.
2443: अनवसान Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) 	1 Without conclusion, endless. 	2 Free from death. E. अ priv. and अवसान.
2444: अनवसित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not terminated &c. See अवसित. II. f. (-ता) The name of a metre regulated by number and quantity, a species of the class called Triṣṭubh (q. v.); it con-sists of a stanza of four lines with the following eleven feet in each line: ˘˘˘˘¯¯¯˘˘¯¯. E. अ neg. and अवसित.
2445: अनवस्कर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Freed from dirt, cleansed. E. अ priv. and अवस्कर.
2446: अनवस्थ I. Tatpur. f. (-स्था) 	1 An unsettled state, want of fixedness, unsteadiness, uncertainty. 	2 Incontinence, dis-soluteness. 	3 Indeterminateness, unboundedness; esp. in the Nyāya philosophy: an endless series (of causes and effects), the regressus in infinitum; e. g. in arguing that the lamp is the cause which reveals the existence of a jar, the eye  the cause which reveals that of the lamp, and so on. E. अ neg. and अवस्था. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्) 	1 Not fixed, not per-manent, unstable, not lasting. E. अ priv. and अवस्था.
2447: अनवस्थान I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) 	1 Instability, want of fixed-ness, unsteadiness. 	2 Incontinence, misconduct. E. अ neg. and अवस्थान. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Unsteady, mutable, va-riable, not lasting. 2. m. (-नः) Wind. E. अ priv. and अवस्थान.
2448: अनवस्थायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Unstable, transitory. E. अ neg. and अवस्थायिन्.
2449: अनवस्थित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unfixed, unstable, unsteady, inconstant, uncertain. 	2 Loose, abandoned, vio-lating moral and legal restraint. E. अ neg. and अवस्थित.
2450: अनवस्थितचित्त Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Unsteady-minded. E. अनवस्थित and चित्त.
2451: अनवस्थितता f. (-ता) or अनवस्थितत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as the following. E. अनवस्थित, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2452: अनवस्थिति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) 	1 Unsteadiness, instability. 	2 Misconduct, incontinence, dissoluteness.
2453: अनवहित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Inattentive, careless. E. अ neg. and अवहित.
2454: अनवहितत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as अनवधान q. v. E. अनव-हित, taddh. aff. त्व.
2455: अनवह्वर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) (ved.) Not crooked, straight, upright, honest. E. अ neg. and अवह्वर.
2456: अनवाच् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्) Not dumb, eloquent. E. अ neg. and अवाच्.
2457: अनवाञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ङ्-ची-क्) Not downlooked, look-ing upwards or in front of. E. अ neg. and अवाञ्च्.
2458: अनवानम् Tatpur. ind. Without breathing, in one breath, with-out interruption. E. अ neg. and अवानम् (अन् with अव, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
2459: अनवानता f. (-ता) Close contiguity, uninterruptedness. E. अनवान (अनवानम् with elision of the म् of the kṛt aff. णमुल्), taddh. aff. तल्.
2460: अनवाप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Not obtained, not received. E. अ neg. and अवाप्त.
2461: अनवाप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) Not obtaining, not receiving, not getting. E. अ neg. and अवाप्ति.
2462: अनवायम् Bahuvr. ind. (ved.) Without interruption, continually. E. अ priv. and अवाय.
2463: अनविथ्य(?) Tatpur. m. f. n. (-थ्यः-थ्या-थ्यम्) Not fit for or suited to a sheep. E. अ neg. and अविथ्य.
2464: अनवेक्ष I. Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) Want of attention, want of re-gard, regardlessness. E. अ neg. and अवेक्षा. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्) Taking no regard, regardless.--अनवेक्षम् used also as adv.; without paying attention or taking regard. E. अ priv. and अवेक्षा; अनवेक्षम् may be however also a Tatpur. from अ neg. and अवेक्षम् (ईक्ष् with अव, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
2465: अनव्रत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not destitute of meritorious acts of devotion; especially. II. m. (-तः) A Jaina devotee who only partially con-forms to the rules of his order. E. अ neg. and अव्रत.
2466: अनशन I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A fast, fasting. In law, fasting of a creditor or of a Brahman employed by him to enforce payment of a debt, the debtor incurring the guilt of Brahma-nicide, if the person should die of inanition. E. अ neg. and अशन. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) One who fasts. E. अ priv. and अशन.
2467: अनशनता f. (-ता) Fasting. E. अनशन II., taddh. aff. तल्.
2468: अनशनाय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not hungry. E. अ priv. and अशनाया.
2469: अनशित Tatpur. n. (-तम्) Fasting; esp. in composition with अशित; e. g. अशितेनानशितेन जीवति he lives now eating now fasting. E. अ neg. and अशित.
2470: अनश्नत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्नन्-श्नती-श्नत्) Not eating, not enjoying. E. अ neg. and अश्नत्.
2471: अनश्नन्त्साङ्गमन Tatpur. m. (-नः) (ved.) The name of the sacrificial fire in the Sabhā, so called because it is ap-proached early in the morning before breakfast. E. अनश्नत् and साङ्गमन ‘the fire approached by those who have not yet eaten any thing’.
2472: अनश्रु Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-श्रुः-श्रुः-श्रु) Without tears, not shedding tears. E. अ priv. and अश्रु.
2473: अनश्व Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-श्वः-श्वा-श्वम्) Without a horse or horses. E. अ priv. and अश्व.
2474: अनश्वदा Tatpur. m. (-दाः) (ved.) Not giving horses. E. अ neg. and अश्वदा.
2475: अनश्वन् Tatpur.(?) m. (-श्वा) The proper name of a prince, the son of Vidūratha by Sampriyā and father of Parīkṣit. E. unknown.
2476: अनश्वर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Imperishable, eternal. E. अ neg. and नश्वर.
2477: अनष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not lost, not destroyed. E. अ neg. and नष्ट.
2478: अनस् n. (-नः) 	1 A cart, esp. one made of wood and tied over with cloth. 	2 Boiled rice (cf. अन्न and अन्धस्). 	3 A mother. 	4 Birth. 	5 A living being, an animal. (The final स् of this word is changed sometimes to र् or ड्; see अनर्विश्, अनडुह्.--Avyayībhāva compounds, or according to others, also other compounds, the latter part of which is अनस्, assume the samāsānta aff. टच्, e. g. उपानसम्, महानस (qq. vv.). E. अन्, uṇ. aff. असुन्.
2479: अनसूय I. Tatpur. f. (-या) Want of detractiveness, the not lowering maliciously other's merits, good qualities &c. E. अ neg. and असूया. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Free from detractive-ness, not lowering maliciously other's merits, good qualities &c. 2. f. (-या) A proper name of 	1 a daughter of Daksha, the wife of Atri (q. v.) and mother of Durvāsas, 	2 a friend of Śakuntalā (in the drama Śak.). E. अ priv. and असूया.
2480: अनसूयक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) The same as अनसूय II. 1. E. अनसूय II. 1., samāsānta aff. कप्.
2481: अनसूयु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-युः-युः-यु) Free from detractiveness, not lowering maliciously other's merits, good qualities &c. E. अ neg. and असूयु.
2482: अनसूरि Tatpur. m. (-रिः) Not unwise, wise, not unintelli-gent. E. अ neg. and असूरि.
2483: अनस्तमित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not set (as the sun). 	2 Not ceasing, not perishing, imperishable. E. अ neg. and अस्तमित.
2484: अनस्थ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्) (ved.) Boneless. E. अ priv. and अस्थि, samāsānta aff. अ(?).
2485: अनस्थि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्थिः-स्थिः-स्थि) Boneless. (For the declension of this word see अस्थि.) E. अ priv. and अस्थि.
2486: अनस्थिक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Boneless. E. अनस्थि, taddh. aff. कप्.
2487: अनस्थिमत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्) Boneless. E. अ neg. and अस्थिमत्.
2488: अनस्वत् m. f. n. (-स्वान्-स्वती-स्वत्) Having a cart, with a cart. E. अनस्, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
2489: अनहङ्कार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) 	1 Absence of the sense of self. 	2 Absence of the pride of individuality, humility. E. अ neg. and अहङ्कार. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Free from the pride of individuality, not proud, humble.
2490: अनहङ्कारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि). The same as अनहङ्कार II. E. अ neg. and अहङ्कारिन्.
2491: अनहङ्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not having the pride of individuality, not proud, humble. E. अ neg. and अहङ्कृत.
2492: अनहङ्कृति I. Tatpur. f. (-तिः). The same as अनहङ्कार I. E. अ neg. and अहङ्कृति. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तिः-तिः-ति). The same as अन-हङ्कार II. E. अ priv. and अहङ्कृति.
2493: अनहन् Tatpur. n. (-हः) No-day, a bad day, an unlucky day. (For the declension of this word see अहन्.) E. अ deter. and अहन्.
2494: अना ind. (ved.) Certainly, indeed. (A commentator of the Amarakosha considers this particle as a synonyme of the negative न; his opinion rests, however, only on an arti-ficial interpretation of the word अनावृष्टि (q. v.) and is refuted by others who explain it as derived, not from अना and वृष्टि, but from अ neg. and आवृष्टि.) E. unknown; probably an obsolete third case of the pronominal theme अ (q. v.).
2495: अनाकार Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Shapeless, without form. E. अ priv. and आकार.
2496: अनाकारित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not demanded, not exacted. E. अ neg. and आकारित.
2497: अनाकाल Tatpur. m. (-लः) 	1 Unfit or improper time. 	2 Hard time, as famine &c. See the following word. E. अ neg. and आकाल.
2498: अनाकालभृत Tatpur. m. (-तः) (In law.) One of the fifteen kinds of slaves (see दास): a man who has become a slave voluntarily, for the sake of sustenance at a season of fa-mine. (The less correct reading of this word is अन्नाकाल-भृत.) E. अनाकाल and भृत, scil. दास.
2499: अनाकाश I. Tatpur. m. n. (-शः-शम्) No-æther, any thing different from æther or atmosphere. E. अ neg. and आकाश. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Having no æther, destitute of the properties of æther. E. अ priv. and आकाश.
2500: अनाकुल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) 	1 Unperplexed, col-lected, composed. 	2 Not contradicting one's self, consistent with one's self. E. अ neg. and आकुल.
2501: अनाकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unrestrained; (according to the explanation of a vaidik commentator). E. अ neg. and आकृत.
2502: अनाक्रान्त Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) The reverse of आक्रान्त q. v. II. f. (-न्ता) A sort of prickly nightshade (Solanum jacquini Wild.). See अग्निदमनी and कण्टकारिका. E. अ neg. and आक्रान्त.
2503: अनाग I. Bahuvr. m. (-गः) (ved.) Without fault or sin. E. an abbreviated form of अनागस्. II. Tatpur.(?) f. (-गा) The name of a river; (the read-ing of this word, however, is doubtful). E. uncertain.
2504: अनागत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not arrived, not approached. 	2 Not acquired, not learnt, not obtained. 	3 Un-known, undistinguished. 	4 Not yet come, future. II. n. (-तम्) The future time. E. अ neg. and आगत.
2505: अनागतवत् m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Full with future events, much engaged with what will come (as thoughts &c.). E. अनागत, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
2506: अनागतविधातृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) One who makes his dispositions for the future, forecasting, cautious. E. अनागत and विधातृ.
2507: अनागताबाध Karmadh. m. (-धः) Future pain or illness. E. अनागत and आबाध.
2508: अनागतार्तवा Bahuvr. f. (-वा) A young girl, one not arrived at puberty; according to a commentary, a girl eight years old (the same as गौरी q. v.). E. अनागत and आर्तव.
2509: अनागतावेक्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Looking or referring to what is to come or follows (e. g. in a book &c.). E. अनागत and अवेक्षण.
2510: अनागम I. Tatpur. m. (-मः) 	1 Non-arrival. 	2 Non-acquisition. E. अ neg. and आगम. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) 	1 Not arrived, not present. 	2 (In law.) Without legal acquisition, without title deeds, from time immemorial (used of estates, privi-leges &c.). See also निरागम. E. अ priv. and आगम.
2511: अनागमोपभोग Karmadh. m. (-गः) The use or enjoyment of estates &c. without legal acquisition, without title deeds, from time immemorial. See also निरागमोपभोग. E. अनागम and उपभोग.
2512: अनागम्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्यः-म्या-म्यम्) 	1 Unapproachable, inaccessible. 	2 Unobtainable. E. अ neg. and आगम्य.
2513: अनागस् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-गाः-गाः-गः) 	1 Free from fault or sin, pious, virtuous. 	2 Removing fault or sin, conferring happiness. E. अ priv. and आगस्. Comp. अनाग.
2514: अनागामिन् Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) 	1 Not arriv-ing, not coming. 	2 Not future. II. m. (-मी) The third of the four orders of the Bud-dhists, generally termed Āryās; (see besides श्रोतआपन्न, सकृदागामिन् and अर्हत्): literally, one who does not return, but it means one who has only to pass through forty thousand kalpas and then is freed from transmigration. E. अ neg. and आगामिन्.
2515: अनागामुक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Not arriving or coming frequently, not disposed to come habitually. E. अ neg. and आगामुक.
2516: अनागास्त्व n. (-त्वम्) (ved.) Exemption from fault or sin, sinlessness. E. अनागस्, taddh. aff. त्व.
2517: अनाचरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Improper or immoral conduct. E. अ neg. and आचरण.
2518: अनाचार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) Impropriety, misconduct, vio-lation of moral or civil laws. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Ill behaved, indecent. immoral.
2519: अनाचारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Ill behaved, in-decent, immoral. E. अ neg. and आचारिन्.
2520: अनाचार्यभोगीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not fit to be eaten or enjoyed by a spiritual teacher. E. अ neg. and आचार्यभोगीन.
2521: अनाज्ञप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Not ordered, not commanded. E. अ neg. and आज्ञप्त.
2522: अनाज्ञप्तकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Doing what is not ordered, acting without order. E. अनाज्ञप्त and कारिन्.
2523: अनाज्ञात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not known, un-heard of. (This word may form, as a term of praise, the first part of Karmadh. compounds e. g. अनाज्ञाताध्यापक.) E. अ neg. and आज्ञात.
2524: अनाढ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ढ्यः-ढ्या-ढ्यम्) Not rich, poor. E. अ neg. and आढ्य.
2525: अनाढ्यम्भविष्णु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णुः-ष्णुः-ष्णु) Not becoming rich or wealthy. E. अ neg. and आढ्यम्भविष्णु.
2526: अनातत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not strung (as a bow). (According to a vaidik commentary also: not placed on a bow, as an arrow; this latter meaning, however, seems doubtful.) E. अ neg. and आतत.
2527: अनातप Tatpur. m. (-पः) 	1 Coolness. 	2 Shade, shadow. E. अ neg. and आतप.
2528: अनातुर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Free from sickness or disease, well, vigorous. E. अ neg. and आतुर.
2529: अनात्मक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Void of substance or reality (as the phenomena of this world, according to the Bauddha doctrine). E. अ priv. and आत्मन्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
2530: अनात्मन् I. Tatpur. m. (-त्मा) 	1 No-soul, other than spirit or soul. 	2 Not self, other. E. अ neg. and आत्मन्. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्मा-त्मा-त्म) Without spirit or soul. E. अ priv. and आत्मन्.
2531: अनात्मनीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not suitable, not fit for one's self. E. अ neg. and आत्मनीन.
2532: अनात्मप्रत्यवेक्षा Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) In Buddhist doctrine, one of the 108 धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.): the reflection that there is no soul or self. E. अनात्मन् and प्रत्यवेक्षा.
2533: अनात्मवत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Not self pos-sessed, without self-control. E. अ neg. and आत्मवत्.
2534: अनात्म्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्म्यः-त्म्या-त्म्यम्) Impersonal (as Brahman. n.). E. अ neg. and आत्म्य.
2535: अनात्यन्तिक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Not final, not permanent. E. अ neg. and आत्यन्तिक.
2536: अनात्यन्तिकत्व n. (-त्वम्) Absence of finality, reoccurrence (e. g. of pains). E. अनात्यन्तिक, taddh. aff. त्व.
2537: अनाथ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्) 	1 Without a lord or protector (as an orphan, one without a सपिण्ड (q. v.) &c.), without a master. 	2 Helpless, poor. E. अ priv. and नाथ.
2538: अनाथपिण्डद Tatpur. m. (-दः) The name of a celebrated merchant, the owner of the garden Jetavana near Śrāvasti, where the Buddha Sākyamuni used to explain his doctrine to his disciples. He was also called अनाथपिण्डिक. E. अनाथ and पिण्ड-द ‘giving food to the poor’.
2539: अनाथपिण्डिक m. (-कः) The same as the preceding. E. अनाथ-पिण्डिन्, taddh. aff. कन्.
2540: अनाथसभा Tatpur. f. (-भा) A poor-house. E. अनाथ and सभा.
2541: अनादर I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) Disrespect, contempt. E. अ neg. and आदर. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) (According to the com-mentary of an Upanishad.) Not bewildered, not agitated (an epithet of आत्मन् or the soul; but perhaps also: ‘not zealous, not making any effort, calm, quiet’). E. अ priv. and आदर.
2542: अनादरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Not having regard, treating with disrespect or contempt. E. अ neg. and आदरण.
2543: अनादरिन् m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Wanting in respect or re-gard, disrespectful, disregardful. E. अनादर, taddh. aff. इनि.
2544: अनादि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दिः-दिः-दि) Without any beginning, unborn, uncreate, eternal. E. अ priv. and आदि.
2545: अनादिता f. (-ता) or अनादित्व n. (-त्वम्) Exemption from commencement, eternity. E. अनादि, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2546: अनादिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Who or what does not sound. E. अ neg. and नादिन्.
2547: अनादिनिधन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without beginning and termination, eternal. E. अ priv. and आदि-निधन (Dwandwa).
2548: अनादिमत् m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्). The same as अनादि. E. अनादि, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
2549: अनादिमत्त्व n. (-त्त्वम्) The being without any beginning, the being eternal. E. अनादिमत्, taddh. aff. त्व.
2550: अनादिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) 	1 Not assigned, not appointed, not fixed. 	2 Not commanded, not directed. 	3 Not allowed. E. अ neg. and आदिष्ट.
2551: अनादृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not respected. 	2 Dis-respected, disregarded, despised. E. अ neg. and आदृत.
2552: अनादेय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) 	1 Not to be taken or received, unacceptable. 	2 Not admissible, inadmissible (as a law suit, a plaint). E. अ neg. and आदेय.
2553: अनाद्य m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) I. Tatpur. Not to be eaten, not edible. E. अ neg. and आद्य. II. Bahuvr. Without a beginning, unborn, uncreate, eternal. E. अ priv. and आद्य.
2554: अनाद्यनन्त Dwandwa m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Without a be-ginning and end, eternal. E. अनादि and अनन्त.
2555: अनाद्यन्त Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Without a be-ginning and end, eternal. II. m. (-न्तः) A name of Śiva. E. अ priv. and आदि-अन्त (Dwandwa).
2556: अनाधृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) (ved.) Not overcome, not vanquished, unconquered. E. अ neg. and आधृष्ट.
2557: अनाधृष्टि Bahuvr. m. (-ष्टिः) 	1 The proper name of 	a. a prince, the son of Śura by Bhojyā, or according to others by Māriṣā, and brother of Vasudeva; his wife is Aśmakī and his son Ninartaśatru or according to another reading, Nirvṛttiśatru; 	b. a son of Ugrasena and chief of the Yā-davas. 	2 A name or epithet of Ṛcheyu, the son of Rau-drāśva. E. अ priv. and आधृष्टि, ‘suffering no defeat, in-vincible’.
2558: अनाधृष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) (ved.) Unconquerable, indomitable. E. अ neg. and आधृष्य.
2559: अनानत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Not bent, not depressed, unimpaired, superior. II. m. (-तः) The name of a Ṛṣi, the son of Paru-chhepa and author of a vaidik hymn. E. अ neg. and आनत.
2560: अनानुकृत्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) (ved.) Not to be done again, unparalleled. E. अ neg. and अनुकृत्य, the first syllable of the latter part of the compound being made long, or perhaps अन neg. and अनुकृत्य.
2561: अनानुद Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) (ved.) 	1 Having no follower, unaided, alone. 	2 Unsurpassed in liberality (lit. without any one who could give after, i. e. in a similar manner). Both meanings of this word, as given according to the comm., seem doubtful; it occurs as an epithet of Indra and Brihaspati. E. अ priv. and अनुद, the first syllable of the latter part of the compound being lengthened, or per-haps अन priv. and अनुद.
2562: अनानुदिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) (ved.) Unasked. E. अ neg. and अनुदिष्ट, the first syllable of the latter part of the compound being made long, or perhaps अन neg. and अनुदिष्ट.
2563: अनानुभूति Tatpur. f. (-तिः; occurs only in the plur. -तयः) (ved.) Inattentiveness, neglect; esp. personified: those who are neglectful in holy acts or worship (sc. प्रजाः). Cf. अनाभू. E. अ neg. and अनुभूति, the अ of the latter part of the com-pound being made long, or perhaps, अन neg. and अनुभूति.
2564: अनापद् Tatpur. f. (-त्) Absence of calamity or misfortune. E. अ neg. and आपद्.
2565: अनापन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Unobtained, unattained. E. अ neg. and आपन्न.
2566: अनापान Bahuvr. m. (-नः) The proper name of a prince; according to one authority, the son of Anga, a descendant of Anu. E. अ priv. and आपान.
2567: अनापि Bahuvr. m. (-पिः) (ved.) Without relations, without equals(?); an epithet of Indra. E. अ priv. and आपि, re-lation (equal?).
2568: अनापूयित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not infected with stench or putrefaction. E. अ neg. and आपूयित.
2569: अनाप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) 	1 Not obtained, not gained. 	2 Not having obtained, not having attained. 	3 Un-skilful, unapt. E. अ neg. and आप्त.
2570: अनाप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) Not obtaining, not attaining. E. अ neg. and आप्ति.
2571: अनाप्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्यः-प्या-प्यम्) Not obtainable. E. अ neg. and आप्य.
2572: अनाबाध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Without obstruction or vexation, unobstructed, unmolested. See also निराबाध. E. अ priv. and आबाधा.
2573: अनाभयिन् Tatpur. m. (-यी) (ved.) Fearless; an epithet of Indra. E. अ neg. and आभयिन्(?).
2574: अनाभू Tatpur. m. (-भूः, esp. in the plur. -भुवः) (ved.) One who is neglectful in worship or holy acts. Cf. अनानुभूति. E. अ neg. and आभू.
2575: अनामक Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) 	1 Nameless. 	2 Hav-ing a bad name. II. m. (-कः) An intercalary month. See मलमास. III. n. (-कम्) Piles or hœmorrhoids. E. अ priv. or deter. and नामन्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
2576: अनामन् Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-मा-मा-म) 	1 Nameless. 	2 Hav-ing a bad name. II. f. (-मा) The ring finger. See अनामिका. E. अ priv. and नामन्, ‘because the head of Brahmā having being cut off with this finger, it has become unworthy of a name’.
2577: अनामय Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) 	1 Free from dis-ease or sickness, healthy. 	2 Not producing disease. II. m. (-यः) A name of Śiva. III. n. (-यम्) 	1 Health. 	2 A medicament or drug(?). E. अ priv. and आमय.
2578: अनामयत् Tatpur. n. (-यत्) (ved.) Health. E. अ neg. and आमयत्, lit.: absence of what makes or allows to be sick.
2579: अनामयित्नु m. f. n. (-त्नुः-त्नुः-त्नु) (ved.) Freeing from disease. E. अनामय् (denom. from अनामय), uṇ. aff. इत्नुच्.
2580: अनामिका Bahuvr. f. (-का) The ring finger. See अनामन्. E. अ priv. and नामन्, samāsānta aff. कप् (the insertion of इ before the aff. is irregular).
2581: अनामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) (ved.) Unbending. E. अ neg. and नामिन्.
2582: अनामिष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Without flesh, with-out enjoyment, bootless, profitless &c. See आमिष. E. अ priv. and आमिष.
2583: अनामृण Bahuvr. m. (-णः) (ved.) Free from foes or such as can do injury; an epithet of Indra. E. अ priv. and आमृण.
2584: अनामृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) No where perishable, everlasting. E. अ neg. and आमृत.
2585: अनायक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Without a leader, without a ruler or chief. E. अ priv. and नायक.
2586: अनायत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unchecked, un-restrained. 	2 Close, continuous, unseparated. 	3 Unextended, having no length. E. अ neg. and आयत.
2587: अनायतन I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) No-altar, no-abode. E. अ neg. and आयतन. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Having no abode, no altar. E. अ priv. and आयतन.
2588: अनायतनवत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) 	1 Having no abode. 	2 Having no altar. E. अ neg. and आयतनवत्.
2589: अनायत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Independent, uncon-trolled. E. अ neg. and आयत्त.
2590: अनायत्तवृत्ति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) Having an in-dependent subsistence or livelihood. E. अनायत्त and वृत्ति.
2591: अनायत्तवृत्तिता f. (-ता) Independence, self subsistence. E. अनायत्तवृत्ति, taddh. aff. तल्.
2592: अनायसाग्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्रः-ग्रा-ग्रम्) Having no iron point (as an arrow). E. अ neg. and आयसाग्र.
2593: अनायास I. Tatpur. m. (-सः) 	1 Exemption from pain or dif-ficulty, facility, ease. 	2 Absence of exertion, idleness, neglect. E. अ neg. and आयास. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-सः-सा-सम्) Easy, not difficult. E. अ priv. and आयास.
2594: अनायासकृत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Done easily, readily, without effort. II. n. (-तम्) (In medicine.) An infusion made by simply putting the plant into water without any other preparations and extracting in such a manner its juice or essence; f. i. myrobalan (त्रिफला)--infusions &c. E. अनायास and कृत.
2595: अनायुषा Bahuvr. f. (-षा) A proper name: one of the daughters of Daksha and wives of Kāśyapa, the mother of Bala and Vṛtra. See अनायुस्. E. अ priv. and आयुस्, fem. aff. टाप्; (the formation is irregular).
2596: अनायुष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) Not giving long life, destructive of life, fatal. E. अ neg. and आयुष्य.
2597: अनायुस् Bahuvr. f. (-युः) A proper name: the same as अना-युषा. E. अ priv. and आयुस्.
2598: अनारत Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Continual, eternal. अनारतम् continually, eternally. E. अ priv. and आरत.
2599: अनारभ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भ्यः-भ्या-भ्यम्) What cannot or aught not to be begun or attempted. E. अ neg. and आरभ्य.
2600: अनारभ्यवाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) An injunction (concerning sa-crifices or vaidik rites) not connected with the books or chapters which treat authoritatively on sacrifices &c. in the regular order. See आरभ्यवाद and the following. E. अ neg. and आरभ्यवाद.
2601: अनारभ्याधीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not read in con-nexion with chapters or books treating authoritatively on vaidik rites or sacrifices; said of passages, esp. in the Brāhmaṇas, which treat on rites, sacrifices &c. not to be connected with other passages with which they may happen to be found together, the injunctions of the latter not be-ing applicable to those of the former. A ceremonial, for instance, taught in an anārabhyādhīta, would not be con-sidered as the essential part of another ceremonial, treated in passages, called ārabhyādhīta, which may precede or follow it, nor share in the general rules concerning these; and it is, therefore, always the object of special rules which define its position amongst the other parts of the ritual and its applicability. E. अ neg. and आरभ्याधीत.
2602: अनारम्बण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) (ved.) Without support, unsupported. See अनालम्बन. E. अ priv. and आरम्बण.
2603: अनारम्भ I. Tatpur. m. (-म्भः) Non-commencement, not at-tempting or undertaking. E. अ neg. and आरम्भ. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-म्भः-म्भा-म्भम्) Without beginning or commencement. E. अ priv. and आरम्भ.
2604: अनारम्भण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) (ved. according to the comm.) Without support, unsupported (see अना-लम्बन); but it may mean also: without a point of touch, not palpable, as æther, darkness. E. अ priv. and आरम्भण.
2605: अनारोग्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ग्यः-ग्या-ग्यम्) Unhealthy, not salubrious, unwholesome. II. n. (-ग्यम्) Want of health, sickness. E. अ neg. and आरोग्य.
2606: अनारोग्यकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Causing sickness, unwholesome. E. अनारोग्य and कर, fem. ङीप्.
2607: अनार्जव Tatpur. n. (-वम्) 	1 Crookedness, moral or physical. 	2 Disease. E. अ neg. and आर्जव.
2608: अनार्तव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वी-वम्) Not seasonable, as plants &c. E. अ neg. and आर्तव.
2609: अनार्त्विजीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not fit for a priest, not fit to be a priest. E. अ neg. and आर्त्विजीन.
2610: अनार्य I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Not respectable, not venerable, unworthy, inferior, bad, vile. 2. m. (-र्यः) Other than an Ārya, a barbarian, a Sūdra, a Mlechchha, a Kirāta &c. E. अ neg. and आर्य. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Having no Āryas, inhabited by Mlechchhas &c. as a country. E. अ priv. and आर्य.
2611: अनार्यक Bahuvr. n. (-कम्) Agallochum or aloe wood (Aquila agallocha). See also अनार्यज. E. अनार्य II., samāsānta aff. कप्.
2612: अनार्यकर्मिन् m. (-र्मी) One doing the work of a Sūdra or a non-Ārya. E. अनार्य-कर्म, taddh. aff. इनि.
2613: अनार्यज Tatpur. n. (-जम्). The same as अनार्यक q. v. E. अनार्य and ज ‘produced in the country of the Mlechchhas or barbarians’.
2614: अनार्यता f. (-ता) or अनार्यत्व n. (-त्वम्) Vileness, unworthi-ness, baseness. E. अनार्य, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2615: अनायतिक्त Tatpur. m. (-क्तः) A medicinal plant, a kind of gentian (Gentiana cherayta, Rox.) See also किराततिक्त. E. अनार्य I. 2. and तिक्त.
2616: अनार्ष Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्षः-र्षी-र्षम्) 	1 Not relating or be-longing to a Ṛṣi (to his name &c.). 	2 Not relating to the vaidik hymns (considered as the inspirations of the Ṛṣis). E. अ neg. and आर्ष.
2617: अनार्षेय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-यी-यम्) Not relating or be-longing to a Ṛṣi. E. अ neg. and आर्षेय.
2618: अनालम्ब I. Tatpur. m. (-म्बः) 	1 Want of support. 	2 Despon-dency, heart-brokenness. E. अ neg. and आलम्ब. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-म्बः-म्बा-म्बम्) Without support or stay, unsupported. E. अ priv. and आलम्ब.
2619: अनालम्बन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) 	1 Without stay or support, unsupported. 	2 Despondent, heart-broken. E. अ priv. and आलम्बन.
2620: अनालम्बनता f. (-ता) 	1 Unsupportedness. 	2 Despondency, heart-brokenness. E. अनालम्बन, taddh. aff. तल्.
2621: अनालम्बी Tatpur. f. (-म्बी) The Vīṇā or lute of Śiva. E. अ neg. and आलम्बी.
2622: अनालम्बुका Tatpur. f. (-का). See the following.
2623: अनालम्भुका Tatpur. f. (-का) A woman during menstruation. This word occurs only in ritual works and is sometimes, though less correctly written अनालम्बुका. E. अ neg. and आलम्भुका.
2624: अनालाप I. Tatpur. m. (-पः) Taciturnity, silence. E. अ neg. and आलाप. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Silent, taciturn. E. अ priv. and आलाप.
2625: अनालोचित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unseen, unbe-held. 	2 Unweighed, unconsidered, rash, imprudent. E. अ neg. and आलोचित.
2626: अनाविद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Not pierced, not wounded, not hurt. E. अ neg. and आविद्ध.
2627: अनाविल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Clear, clean, pure. E. अ neg. and आविल.
2628: अनावृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Uncovered, unhidden. 	2 Open, uninclosed (as a field &c.). E. अ neg. and आवृत.
2629: अनावृत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) 	1 Not turned round. 	2 Not retreating. 	3 Not approached, not visited. E. अ neg. and आवृत्त.
2630: अनावृत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Not-returning, literally and me-taphorically (as after death into this world). E. अ neg. and आवृत्ति.
2631: अनावृष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) Drought. E. अ neg. and आ-वृष्टि (explained with समन्ताद्वृष्टि). See also under अना.
2632: अनावेदित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not made known, not announced. E. अ neg. and आवेदित.
2633: अनाश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) I. Without hope, hope-less. E. अ priv. and आशा. II. Not dead, living. E. अ priv. and नाश. The latter meaning is artificial.
2634: अनाशक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) Fasting. E. अ neg. and आशक.
2635: अनाशकनिवृत्त Tatpur. m. (-त्तः) One who desists from fast-ing (as a Sannyāsin who returns to his home &c.). E. अनाशक and निवृत्त.
2636: अनाशकायन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The penitence of fasting. E. अनाशक and अयन.
2637: अनाशस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) Not excellent, not praiseworthy; (according to a vaidik commentary). E. अ neg. and आशस्त.
2638: अनाशिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शी-शिनी-शि) Not perishing, not being lost. E. अ neg. and नाशिन्.
2639: अनाशु m. f. n. (-शुः-शुः-शु) I. Tatpur. Not quick, slow. E. अ neg. and आशु. II. Bahuvr. (ved.) Without destruction, indestructible, unchecked (as horses going extremely fast). This meaning seems doubtful. E. अ priv. and नाशु(?).
2640: अनाश्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्यः-श्या-श्यम्) Indestructible. E. अ neg. and नाश्य.
2641: अनाश्रमवास Tatpur. m. (-सः). See अनाश्रमेवास. E. अ neg. and आश्रमवास.
2642: अनाश्रमिन् Tatpur. m. (-मी) One not belonging to one of the āśramas (q. v.) or religious orders. E. अ neg. and आश्रमिन्.
2643: अनाश्रमेवास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Not staying in or belonging to one of the āśramas (q. v.) or religious orders. E. अ neg. and आश्रमवास.
2644: अनाश्रय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Without an asylum or refuge, unprotected. E. अ priv. and आश्रय.
2645: अनाश्रित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not connected with, not resorting to, esp. not belonging to one of the āśramas (q. v.) or religious orders. 	2 (In philosophy.) Not inherent in, not requiring any thing else, self-dependent, absolute; as in the Sāṅkhya philosophy, pradhāna or matter, which is complete or absolute in itself, unlike the produced prin-ciples mahat, ahamkāra &c., which are आश्रित relative or resorting to one another. E. अ neg. and आश्रित.
2646: अनाश्वस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्वान्-शुषी-श्वः) Not having eaten, fasting. E. अ neg. and आश्वस् (from अश् to eat).
2647: अनाष्ट्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ष्ट्रः-ष्ट्रा-ष्ट्रम्) (ved.) Free from ene-mies, free from mischievous beings. E. अ priv. and नाष्ट्र.
2648: अनासिक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Noseless. E. अ priv. and नासिका.
2649: अनास्था Tatpur. f. (-स्था) 	1 Want of fixity or condition. 	2 Disregard, want of consideration. E. अ neg. and आस्था.
2650: अनास्थान Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a fixed site, without a basis or foundation. E. अ priv. and आस्थान.
2651: अनाहत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unhurt, unbeaten, unwounded. 	2 Unwashed, new (as cloth). 	3 (In music.) Not beat or struck, not produced in the ordinary way (as a sound). See अनाहतनाद. II. n. (-तम्) 	1 A new garment (see आहत). 	2 The fourth of the six mystical Chakras or circles of the body. E. अ neg. and आहत.
2652: अनाहतनाद Karmadh. m. (-तः) A sound not produced in the ordinary manner; the mysterious sound (om) which is heard in consequence of religious meditation and which is said ‘not to give pleasure, but eternal bliss’; unlike the आहत-नाद (q. v.) or the real musical sound. E. अनाहत and नाद.
2653: अनाहार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) 	1 Abstinence, starvation. 	2 Non-seizure. E. अ neg. and आहार. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not taking food. E. अ priv. and आहार.
2654: अनाहिताग्नि Tatpur. m. (-ग्निः) A householder who has not performed the ceremony of the अग्न्याधान q. v. E. अ neg. and आहिताग्नि.
2655: अनाहिताग्निता f. (-ता) or अनाहिताग्नित्व n. (-त्वम्) The con-dition of an अनाहिताग्नि q. v. E. The preceding, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2656: अनाहुति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) 	1 Not-sacrificing. 	2 A bad or im-proper sacrificing. E. अ neg. or deter. and आहुति.
2657: अनाहूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Uncalled, unbidden. E. अ neg. and आहूत.
2658: अनिकेत Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Without a house. E. अ priv. and निकेत.
2659: अनिकेतन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a house. E. अ priv. and निकेतन.
2660: अनिक्षिप्तधूर Tatpur. m. (-रः) The proper name of a Bodhi-sattva or Bauddha deified saint. E. अ neg. and निक्षिप्तधूर(?).
2661: अनिक्षु Tatpur. m. (-क्षुः) A sort of long grass or reed (Saccharum spontaneum). E. अ comp. and इक्षु sugar-cane. Cf. इक्षुतुल्या.
2662: अनिगीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) 	1 Not swallowed. 	2 (In rhetoric.) Not to be supplied, not being the object of an ellipsis. E. अ neg. and निगीर्ण.
2663: अनिग्रह I. Tatpur. m. (-हः) 	1 Want of restraint &c. See निग्रह. 	2 (In Nyāya phil.) No-failure in argument, not perceiving one's self having failed in argument. E. अ neg. and निग्रह. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Unrestrained, uncon-fined. E. अ priv. and निग्रह.
2664: अनिग्रहस्थान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) (In Nyāya phil.) No-failure in argument. E. अ neg. and निग्रहस्थान.
2665: अनिघातेषु Bahuvr. m. (-षुः) Probably a proper name or sur-name implying blame; lit. one whose arrows do no harm. E. अ priv. and निघात-इषु.
2667: अनिच्छ I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-च्छः-च्छा-च्छम्) Undesirous, in-different, disliking. E. अ priv. and इच्छा. II. Tatpur. f. (-च्छा) Absence of wish or desire, indif-ference, dislike. E. अ neg. and इच्छा.
2668: अनित्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) 	1 Transient, not ever-lasting (as the body, or in the Sāṅkhya philosophy the discrete principles mahat, ahaṅkāra &c. or in the Nyāya the sound &c. 	2 Occasional, not peremptory, not obligatory as a rule &c. (see also काम्य; as in the Jyotiṣṭoma the six samsthās: अत्यग्निष्टोम, उक्थ्य, षोडशिन्, अतिरात्र, अप्तोर्याम and वाजपेय &c.). 	3 Not necessary, not immutable. See अनित्यसमास. 	4 Unstable, inconstant. 	5 Unusual, irregular. (अनित्यम् not always.) E. अ neg. and नित्य.
2669: अनित्यकर्मन् Karmadh. n. (-र्म) An act of worship which is not peremptory, but voluntary and occasional. See काम्य-कर्मन्. E. अनित्य and कर्मन्.
2670: अनित्यक्रिया Karmadh. f. (-या). The same as the preceding. E. अनित्य and क्रिया.
2671: अनित्यता f. (-ता) or अनित्यत्व n. (-त्वम्) 	1 Impermanence, transient existence. 	2 The being occasional, not peremptory. 	3 The being not necessary. 	4 Unstableness, inconstance. 	5 Unusual occurrence. See the meanings of अनित्य. E. अनित्य. taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2672: अनित्यदत्त Tatpur. m. (-त्तः) (In law.) A son given away by his natural parents temporarily or for a term. The adoption of such a son is performed without the homas or burnt offerings re-quired at the adoption of a nityadatta (q. v.). Also अनित्यदत्तक and अनित्यदत्रिम. E. अनित्य and दत्त, temporarily given, scil. पुत्र.
2673: अनित्यदत्तक m. (-कः) (In law.) The same as अनित्यदत्त q. v. E. The preceding, taddh. aff. कन्.
2674: अनित्यदत्रिम Tatpur. m. (-मः) (In law.) The same as अनि-त्यदत्त q. v. E. अनित्य and दत्रिम.
2675: अनित्यप्रत्यवेक्षा Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) In Buddhist doctrine, one of the 108 धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.): the reflection that (every thing) is transitory. E. अनित्य and प्रत्यवेक्षा.
2676: अनित्यभाव Tatpur. m. (-वः) The state or condition of what is transient or perishable, perishableness. E. अनित्य (in the sense of the genitive) and भाव.
2677: अनित्यसम Tatpur. m. f. (-मः-मा) (In the Nyāya philosophy.) Wrongly generalizing the predicament of perishableness i. e. a sophism on perishableness; viz. arguing perishableness from the reason that every thing is perishable because it shares in some qualities with other things which are pe-rishable. E. अनित्य and सम (in the sense of जाति, sophism); the masc. form of this word is explained according to some, by the ellipsis of प्रतिषेध or contradiction, as a Sūtra in the Nyāya treating on a sophism is always followed by another containing the refutation; or, according to others, by the ellipsis of विकल्प (in the sense of विविधः कल्पः i. e. प्रकारः or variousness), there being various sophisms, viz. twenty-four; or according to others, by the ellipsis of प्रयोग i. e. a (logical) proceeding which likens or produces the plausibility of perishableness; or the word is taken as a Bahuvr. with the ellipsis of प्रयोग i. e. a logical proceeding in which perishableness is likened (viz. made plausible).--As a feminine, °समा is taken in the sense of जाति, sophism.
2678: अनित्यसमप्रकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) The chapter in the Nyāya philosophy which treats on the sophism अनित्यसम q. v. E. अनित्यसम and प्रकरण.
2679: अनित्यसमास Karmadh. m. (-सः) (In grammar.) A compound which may be dissolved into its constituent parts without under-going a material change of sense; e. g. राजपुरुषः, which may be dissolved into राज्ञः पुरुषः. The converse of नित्यसमास q. v.
2680: अनिद्र I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-द्रः-द्रा-द्रम्) Sleepless, awake. E. अ priv. and निद्रा. II. Tatpur. f. (-द्रा) Want of sleep. E. अ neg. and निद्रा.
2682: अनिधृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not defeated, not overcome. Cf. अनिभृष्ट. E. अ neg. and निधृष्ट.
2683: अनिध्म Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ध्मः-ध्मा-ध्मम्) Without fuel. E. अ priv. and इध्म.
2684: अनिन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a master, in-dependent. E. अ priv. and इन.
2685: अनिन्दित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Irreproachable, blame-less, virtuous, good. E. अ neg. and निन्दित.
2686: अनिन्द्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्द्यः-न्द्या-न्द्यम्) Irreproachable, blameless. E. अ neg. and निन्द्य.
2687: अनिन्द्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-न्द्रः-न्द्रा-न्द्रम्) 	1 Deprived of Indra. 	2 (ved.) Not paying regard to Indra, not holding Indra in esteem. E. अ priv. and इन्द्र.
2688: अनिन्द्रिय Tatpur. n. (-यम्). The same as अन्तःकरण q. v. E. अ neg. and इन्द्रिय, ‘no-indriya (q. v.), different from the indriyas’.
2689: अनिपद्यमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not falling down, not dejected, untiring. (ved.) E. अ neg. and निपद्यमान.
2690: अनिपात Tatpur. m. (-तः) Not dying, remaining alive. E. अ neg. and निपात.
2691: अनिपुण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Unskilled, unlearned, not conversant. Comp. आनैपुण्य. E. अ neg. and निपुण.
2692: अनिबद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Not attached, not bound, not connected, incoherent. E. अ neg. and निबद्ध.
2693: अनिबद्धप्रलापिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पी-पिनी-पि) Talking in-coherently, talking without regard to the subject in question. E. अनिबद्ध and प्रलापिन्.
2694: अनिबाध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Unconfined, un-restricted, extended. E. अ priv. and निबाध.
2695: अनिभृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not modest, bold. 	2 Not lonely, not private. E. अ neg. and निभृत.
2696: अनिभृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) (ved.) Not defeated, not overcome, unhurt. E. अ neg. and निभृष्ट.
2697: अनिभृष्टतविषि Bahuvr. m. (-षिः) (ved.) Of unhurt power, of unabated strength. E. अनिभृष्ट and तविषी.
2698: अनिभ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भ्यः-भ्या-भ्यम्) Not wealthy, not opulent. E. अ neg. and इभ्य.
2699: अनिमन्त्रित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Uninvited, uncalled. E. अ neg. and निमन्त्रित.
2700: अनिमन्त्रितभोजिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जी-जिनी-जि) Eating without having being invited. E. अनिमन्त्रित and भोजिन्.
2701: अनिमान Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Measureless, im-mense, boundless. E. अ priv. and निमान.
2702: अनिमित्त I. Tatpur. n. (-त्तम्) No cause, want of cause. E. अ neg. and निमित्त. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Having no cause or motive. (अनिमित्तम् from no cause, without a cause.) E. अ priv. and निमित्त.
2703: अनिमित्ततस् ind. From no cause, without a cause. E. अनि-मित्त (Tatpur.), taddh. aff. तसिल्.
2704: अनिमित्तलिङ्गनाश Karmadh. m. (-शः) (In medicine.) A dis-ease of the pupil of the eye, when the whole crystalline lens is affected; it is described as being produced ‘by the sight of the divine Ṛṣis, the Gandharvas, the great Ser-pents and luminous bodies’ and causing the entire loss of vision. See also लिङ्गनाश and सनिमित्तलिङ्गनाश. E. अनि-मित्त and लिङ्गनाश.
2705: अनिमिष् Tatpur. f. (only in the acc. -षम् and instrum. -षा) (ved.) 	1 The not twinkling. 	2 Attentiveness, watchfulness. 	3 Uninterruptedness. अनिमिषम् and अनिमिषा 	1 Attentively, watchfully. 	2 Uninterruptedly, continually. E. अ neg. and निमिष्.
2706: अनिमिष Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) 	1 Not twinkling, having the eyes fixed. 	2 Attentive, watchful. II. m. (-षः) 	1 A god. 	2 A fish. See also अनिमेष. E. अ priv. and निमिष. III. Tatpur. m. (-षः). The same as अनिमिष्. E. अ neg. and निमिष्.
2707: अनिमिषम् Tatpur. (ved.) See अनिमिष् and अनिमेषम्.
2709: अनिमिषाक्ष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षी-क्षम्) One whose eyes are fixed (as in disease). E. अनिमिष and अक्षि, samāsānta aff. षच्.
2710: अनिमिषाचार्य Tatpur. m. (-र्यः) A name of Vṛhaspati. E. अनिमिष and आचार्य, ‘the preceptor of the gods’.
2711: अनिमिषीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Relating to the gods. E. अनिमिष, taddh. aff. छ.
2712: अनिमेष I. Tatpur. m. (-षः) The not-twinkling. E. अ neg. and निमेष. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Not twinkling. 2. m. (-षः) 	1 A god. 	2 A fish. E. अ priv. and निमेष.
2713: अनिमेषम् Tatpur. ind. (ved.) 	1 Without twinkling. 	2 Atten-tively, watchfully, without interruption. See also अनिमिषम्. E. अ and निमेषम् (from मिष् with नि, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
2714: अनियत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not restrained, not fastened. 	2 Not necessarily connected. 	3 Not inevitable, not certain, not always occurring. 	4 Not positive, not de-finite, undefined, undetermined. (The अनियता धर्माः or ‘undetermined rules’ of the Buddhists, are the topic of one of the chapters of their Phātimokkha, and treat on transgressions that involve exclusion, suspension and pe-nance, but not permanent exclusion, of a Bauddha priest.) E. अ neg. and नियत.
2715: अनियतपुंस्का Tatpur. f. (-स्का) An unsteady or unchaste woman. E. अ neg. and नियत-पुम् (Bahuvr. samāsānta aff. कप्).
2716: अनियतवृत्ति Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) One who has no fixed profession or livelihood. E. अ neg. and नियत-वृत्ति.
2717: अनियताङ्क Karmadh. m. (-ङ्कः) (In Arithmetic.) An inde-terminate digit. E. अनियत and अङ्क.
2718: अनियतात्मन् Tatpur. m. (-त्मा) Not exercising self-control, not subduing one's mind. E. अ neg. and नियत-आत्मन्.
2719: अनियम 1. Tatpur. m. (-मः) 	1 Absence of a restriction or fixed rule. 	2 Absence of moral or religious obligation. 	3 In-decorous or improper conduct. E. अ neg. and नियम. 2. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Without restriction, undertermined, undefined, unprovided for, by any rule or law. E. अ priv. and नियम.
2720: अनियुक्त Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Not authorised, not called, not appointed &c. See नियुक्त. 2. m. (-क्तः) (In Law.) A Brāhmaṇa who attends a court without having been appointed a member of it, whose vote is therefore not binding, and who is at liberty to attend the court meetings and to debate in them, or not. (See, on the contrary, सभासद्.)
2721: अनिर (ved.) I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Without food, without an offering (of clarified butter). E. अ priv. and इरा. II. Tatpur. f. (-रा) Want of food, famine, calamity, distress. E. अ neg. and इरा.
2722: अनिराकरिष्णु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णुः-ष्णुः-ष्णु) 	1 Not disposed to or in the habit of throwing obstacles in the way, of being obstructive. 	2 Not in the habit of disdaining, of dis-pising. E. अ neg. and निराकरिष्णु.
2723: अनिराकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unob-structed. E. अ neg. and निराकृत.
2724: अनिरुक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) 	1 Not spoken out, not declared. 	2 Not explained, not defined (e. g. the di-vinity, if spoken of in general terms, or Brahma (n.) that is without qualities, or an invocation, not containing the special name of the god addressed, one addressed to the gods in general &c.). 	3 Obscure, incomprehensible, literally and metaphorically; e. g. Prajāpati, Brahman (n.) or a hymn uttered inaudibly, so as not being comprehensible to the by-standers. E. अ neg. and निरुक्त.
2725: अनिरुक्तगान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) One of the modes of chanting the hymns of the Sāmaveda. See गान. E. अनिरुक्त and गान.
2726: अनिरुद्ध Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) 	1 Unobstructed, unrestrained. 	2 Self-willed, ungovernable, headstrong. 	3 Move-able, unsteady(?). 2. m. (-द्धः) 	1 The name of the son of Pradyumna or Kāmadeva by Śubhāṅgī or, according to others, Kaku-dvatī, the daughter of Rukmin; his wife is Uṣā, the daughter of Vāna, or, according to others, Subhadrā, the granddaughter of Rukmin, and his son Vajra.--The Vaiṣṇava sect, called Pāñcharātra or Bhāgavatas, con-sider him as an incarnation or part of Viṣṇu and identify him with Ahaṅkāra, self-consciousness.--	2 A name of Śiva. 	3 The name of a celebrated Bauddha Arhat and con-temporary of Śākyamuni. 	4 The name of a member of the Vṛṣṇi tribe, the descendants of Vṛṣṇi. See also आनिरुद्ध and आनिरुद्धायनि. 	5 A spy(?). 3. n. (-द्धम्) A rope for fastening cattle. E. अ neg. and निरुद्ध. (It is doubtful whether the meaning 1. 3. (move-able) or the meaning 2. 4. (spy) is the correct one, the translation being founded on the word चर, given as one of the meanings of अनिरुद्ध, but without any further in-dication as to the gender. From the place, however, चर occupies in the explanation of some of the native dictio-naries, the meaning ‘spy’ is likely to be preferable to the meaning ‘moveable’.)
2727: अनिरुद्धपथ Bahuvr. n. (-थम्) Atmosphere, æther. E. अनिरुद्ध and पथिन्, samāsānta aff. अ; lit. having an unobstructed path.
2728: अनिरुद्धभाविनी Tatpur. f. (-नी) The wife of Aniruddha, Uṣā (q. v.). E. अनिरुद्ध and भाविनी.
2729: अनिर्जित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unsubdued, uncon-quered. E. अ neg. and निर्जित.
2730: अनिर्णय Tatpur. m. (-यः) Uncertainty. E. अ neg. and निर्णय.
2731: अनिर्णीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unascertained, un-determined. E. अ neg. and निर्णीत.
2732: अनिर्दश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Not out of, i. e. within, the ten days of impurity which follow after a case of birth or death. अनिर्दशम् also used adverbially. See the following. E. अ neg. and निर्दश; scil. अहन्.
2733: अनिर्दशाह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्). The same as the preceding. E. अ neg. and निर्दशाह.
2734: अनिर्दिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not defined or de-termined by a rule. E. अ neg. and निर्दिष्ट.
2735: अनिर्देश Tatpur. m. (-शः) 	1 Absence of rule or direction. 	2 A bad or imperfect direction, a rule not conveying exactly the bearing or sense it is intended to have. E. अ neg. or deter. and निर्देश.
2736: अनिर्धारित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unascertained, un-determined, undefined. E. अ neg. and निर्धारित.
2737: अनिर्मल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Unclean, dirty. E. अ neg. and निर्मल.
2738: अनिर्माल्या Tatpur. f. (-ल्या) A plant (Trigonella corniculata or Medicago esculenta, Rox.). Also निर्माल्या, लङ्क, पिका, पृक्का, पिशुना, and ranging amongst the महौषध. E. अ neg. and निर्माल्य, according to a commentary ‘because no garland can be made of it’.
2739: अनिर्लोचित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not considered, not reflected. E. अ neg. and निर्लोचित.
2740: अनिर्वचनीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not explainable, indescribable. E. अ neg. and निर्वचनीय.
2741: अनिर्वाच्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-च्यः-च्या-च्यम्) Not explainable, indescribable. E. अ neg. and निर्वाच्य.
2742: अनिर्वाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) 	1 Want of completion. 	2 Want of logical connexion (in a sentence &c.). 	3 Want of means of subsistence. E. अ neg. and निर्वाह.
2743: अनिर्वृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unaccomplished, un-terminated. 	2 Unhappy, discontented, ill at ease. E. अ neg. and निर्वृत.
2744: अनिर्वृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) 	1 Incompleteness, want of com-pletion. 	2 Discontent, unhappiness. 	3 Poverty. E. अ neg. and निर्वृति.
2745: अनिर्वेद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Undauntedness, hopefulness, self-confidence. E. अ neg. and निर्वेद.
2746: अनिल m. (-लः) 	1 Wind, viz. 	a. (in its usual acceptation) the motion of air; 	b. the deity of wind; 	c. one of the eight Maruts, and in this sense distinct from मारुत, वायु &c. (see मरुत्); 	d. one of the eight Vasus (see वसु); 	e. (in the plural अनिलाः) a class of the Gaṇadevatās, comprising forty-nine Anilas; 	f. (in medicine) one of the three Rasas or temperamental elements of the body (see रस), subdi-vided into प्राण, उदान, समान, व्यान and अपान; in this sense used synonymously with मारुत, वात, वायु, समीरण and other words meaning wind; 	g. (in the terminology of the Upanishads) the exterior wind or the surrounding air, in distinction from वायु or प्राण, the vital air of the body. 	2 A proper name of 	a. a son of Tansu and father of Du-shwanta; 	b. a Rākṣasa; 	c. a Ṛṣi, author of a vaidik hymn; 	d. (in the mythology of the Jainas) the seventeenth Arhat of the past Utsarpiṇī. 	3 (In arithmetic, sometimes used to denote) the numeral 49 (there being forty-nine Anilas). 	4 A mystic denomination of the letter य. E. अन्, uṇ. aff. इलच्.
2747: अनिलकुमार Tatpur. m. pl. (-राः) (In the mythology of the Jainas.) One of the ten kinds of Bhavanapatis (q. v.) or Bhavanādhīśas (q. v.), the first of the four classes of Jaina divinities. E. अनिल and कुमार.
2748: अनिलघ्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-घ्नः-घ्नी-घ्नम्) Removing disorders from wind (see अनिल 1. f.), as a medicine &c. Also वातघ्न, वायुघ्न &c. E. अनिल and घ्न.
2749: अनिलघ्नक m. (-कः) A large tree (Terminalia belerica). See also विभीतक. E. अनिलघ्न, taddh. aff. कन्.
2750: अनिलपर्याय Tatpur. m. (-यः) (In Medicine.) An inflammation affecting the whole eye, described as produced from the vitiated Rasa wind (see अनिल 1. f.) ‘which pervades the eye-lids, eye and eyebrows and makes them diseased one after the other’. The less correct reading of this word is अनिलपयय. See also मारुतपर्याय and वातपर्याय. E. अनिल and पर्याय.
2751: अनिलप्रकृति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तिः-तिः-ति) Of airy or windy nature; an epithet of the planet Saturn. E. अनिल and प्रकृति.
2752: अनिलम्भसमाधि Karmadh. f. (-धिः) A fanciful name of a Buddhistic samādhi or profound meditation. E. अनिलम्भ and समाधि, meaning perhaps ‘a meditation that sur-passes all impediments or limits, one which nothing can resist’.
2753: अनिलयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) No-resting place, no-support (an epithet of the neuter Brahman, in an Upanishad, be-cause it is devoid of qualities, impersonal &c.). E. अ neg. and निलयन.
2754: अनिलव्याधि Tatpur. f. (-धिः) (In Medicine.) Derangement of the Rasa wind (see अनिल 1. f.), produced, according to the native theory, by the continued use of dry, cold or light articles of food, taken in unusually small quantities &c. and causing, according to some authorities, eighty varieties of nervous diseases. See also अनिलामय and वातव्याधि. E. अनिल and व्याधि.
2755: अनिलसख Tatpur. m. (-खः) A name of Fire. Cf. अग्निसख. E. अनिल and सखि, samāsānta aff. टच्, ‘the friend of Wind’.
2756: अनिलहन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हा-घ्नी-ह) The same as अनिलघ्न q. v. E. अनिल and हन्.
2757: अनिलहृत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्-त्-त्) The same as अनिलघ्न q. v. E. अनिल and हृत्.
2758: अनिलात्मज Tatpur. m. (-जः) 	1 A name of Hanumat. 	2 A name of Bhīma. See also वायुपुत्र and similar synonymes. E. अनिल and आत्मज.
2759: अनिलान्तक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The name of a plant. See इङ्गुदी or अङ्गारपुष्प. E. अनिल and अन्तक, in the same sense as अनिलघ्न.
2760: अनिलापह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) The same as अनिलघ्न q. v. E. अनिल and अपह.
2761: अनिलामय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The same as अनिलव्याधि q. v. E. अनिल and आमय.
2762: अनिलाशिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शी-शिनी-शि) Feeding on the wind, fasting. E. अनिल and आशिन्.
2763: अनिवर्तित्व n. (-त्वम्) 	1 The not returning. 	2 The not turning back, not running away, not flying. E. अनिवर्तिन्, taddh. aff. त्व.
2764: अनिवर्तिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्ती-र्तिनी-र्ति) 	1 Not coming back, not returning. 	2 Not turning back, not flying.
2765: अनिवारित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unim-peded, unopposed, unforbidden. E. अ neg. and निवारित.
2766: अनिवार्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Not to be prevented or forbidden, necessary, unavoidable. E. अ neg. and निवार्य.
2767: अनिविशमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not reposing, not resting, restless. (ved.) E. अ neg. and निविशमान.
2768: अनिवृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unimpeded, unopposed. E. अ neg. and निवृत.
2769: अनिवेदित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not told, not mentioned, not pointed out. E. अ neg. and निवेदित.
2770: अनिवेदितविज्ञात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Known without having been told or pointed out. E. अनिवेदित and विज्ञात.
2771: अनिवेशन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a resting place, without an abode, restless. E. अ priv. and निवेशन.
2772: अनिश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Continual, incessant. अनिशम् used adv. continually, without interruption. E. अ priv. and निशा, according to some, implying here merely the period of time, according to others, the want of occu-pation or rest i. e. literally ‘without a night’ or ‘without rest’.
2773: अनिशित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Restless, incessant(?). E. अनिशि (a denom. from अनिश), kṛt aff. क्त(?). (Mean-ing and etymology of this word are doubtful. According to the native commentaries it would be a Tatpur. compounded of अ neg. and निशित, sharpened, sharp, and would mean either: 	1 not sharp, not injurious, or: 	2 not difficult, easy, or 	3 not slender, not little; but these explanations, when applied to the passages to which they refer, seem artificial.
2774: अनिशितसर्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्गः-र्गा-र्गम्) (ved.) Of con-tinual effusion, continually flowing (an epithet of the wa-ters)(?). (This meaning is doubtful; according to the comm. it would be: of strong or abundant effusion. See the pre-ceding.) E. अनिशित and सर्ग.
2775: अनिषङ्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Without a quiver. (According to the vaidik comm.: not connected with or impeded by, scil. the Rākṣasas; this interpretation seems artificial.) E. अ priv. and निषङ्ग.
2776: अनिषिद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Not prohibited, not forbidden. E. अ neg. and निषिद्ध.
2777: अनिषु Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षुः-षुः-षु) Having no arrow or hav-ing bad arrows. E. अ priv. and इषु.
2778: अनिषेद्ध्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-द्ध्रः-द्ध्रा-द्ध्रम्) (ved.) Without im-pediment, unchecked, unimpeded. E. अ priv. and निषेद्ध्र.
2779: अनिष्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not completed, not ac-complished, not perfect. E. अ neg. and निष्कृत.
2780: अनिष्ट Tatpur. I. 1. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) 	1 Unwished, un-desirable, bad, wrong. 	2 Bad, evil. 	3 Unlucky. 2. n. (-ष्टम्) 	1 Bad luck, evil occurrence, misfortune. 	2 Evil deed, crime. 3. f. (-ष्टा) The name of a plant (Sida alba). See नाग-वला. E. अ neg. and इष्ट (इष्, kṛt aff. क्त). II. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) 	1 Not sacrificed. 	2 Not honoured with a sacrifice (as a god). E. अ neg. and इष्ट (यज्, kṛt aff. क्त).
2781: अनिष्टदुष्टधी Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धीः-धीः-धि) Of a bad and wicked disposition or mind. (Another and apparently more correct reading of this word is अरिष्टदुष्टधी q. v.) E. अनिष्ट-दुष्ट (Dwandwa) and धी.
2782: अनिष्टप्रसङ्ग Tatpur. m. (-ङ्गः) Connexion or association with what is undesirable, incongruous or wrong connexion, as that of a Yogin with worldly objects; or (in Nyāya) that of an inference with wrong premises, the former tending to prove the absurdity of the argument advanced; or (in gram-matical literature) connecting one rule with an other rule which has no relation to it. E. अनिष्ट and प्रसङ्ग.
2783: अनिष्टफल Karmadh. n. (-लम्) Evil consequence, evil result. E. अनिष्ट and फल.
2784: अनिष्टशङ्का Tatpur. f. (-ङ्का) Apprehension of an unpleasant or unlucky occurrence, apprehension of danger; (in rhetoric one of the व्यभिचारिभाव (q. v.) of the rasa वत्सल (q. v.). E. अनिष्ट and शङ्का.
2785: अनिष्टहेतु Tatpur. m. (-तुः) An evil omen. E. अनिष्ट and हेतु.
2786: अनिष्टापादन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) 1. Obtaining or getting what is not desirable. See प्राप्तिसम. E. अनिष्ट and आपादन. 2. Not obtaining what is desirable. See अप्राप्तिसम. E. अ neg. and इष्ट-आपादन.
2787: अनिष्टाप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) The same as the preceding. E. 1. अनिष्ट and आप्ति, 2. अ neg. and इष्ट-आप्ति.
2788: अनिष्टाशंसिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सी-सिनी-सि) Boding ill or evil. E. अनिष्ट and आशंसिन्.
2789: अनिष्टिन् Tatpur. m. (-ष्टी) One who has not performed a sacrifice. E. अ neg. and इष्टिन्.
2790: अनिष्टृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Not hurt, not injured. E. अ neg. and निष्टृत.
2791: अनिष्टोत्प्रेक्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Apprehension of an unpleasant or unlucky occurrence, apprehension of danger, fear. E. अनिष्ट and उत्प्रेक्षण.
2792: अनिष्ठुर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Not contumelious. 	2 Not harsh. E. अ neg. and निष्ठुर.
2793: अनिष्णात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unskilful, ignorant. E. अ neg. and निष्णात.
2794: अनिष्पत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Non-completion, non-termination. E. अ neg. and निष्पत्ति.
2795: अनिष्पत्रम् Tatpur. ind. (Wounding) so as not to make the arrow come out on the other side of the body, i. e. not too violently. E. अ neg. and निष्पत्र.
2796: अनिष्पन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Not accomplished, incomplete, imperfect. E. अ neg. and निष्पन्न.
2797: अनिसर्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्गः-र्गा-र्गम्) Unnatural, unnaturally elated or depressed. E. अ priv. and निसर्ग.
2798: अनिस्तब्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ब्धः-ब्धा-ब्धम्) 	1 Not paralyzed, not overpowered. 	2 Not stopped, not fixed. E. अ neg. and निस्तब्ध.
2799: अनिस्तीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) 	1 Not got over. 	2 (In law.) Not refuted, not answered (as a plaint, a charge). See the following. E. अ neg. and निस्तीर्ण.
2800: अनिस्तीर्णाभियोग Bahuvr. m. (-गः) (In law.) A defendant who has not or not yet refuted the charge brought against him. E. अनिस्तीर्ण and अभियोग.
2801: अनीक m. n. (-कः-कम्) 	1 The face (ved.). 	2 The fore part, front, the principal or conspicuous part (ved.). 	3 The point (e. g. of an arrow) (ved.). 	4 Multitude, assemblage, quan-tity (ved.). 	5 An army, a host, forces (according to some, also: part of an army). 	6 War, combat. E. अन्, to breathe (in 1. 2. 3.) and to go (in 4. 5. 6.), uṇ. aff. ईकन्, the radical being कित्.
2802: अनीकवत् m. (-वान्) (ved.) Having or occupying the pro-minent or principal place, principal, superior, first, an epithet of Agni, used chiefly when the god receives the first offerings in certain sacrifices, his name then also oc-curring as the first in the list of the gods invoked. E. अनीक, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
2803: अनीकविदारण Tatpur. m. (-णः) A proper name: a brother of Jayadratha. E. अनीक and विदारण ‘destroyer of hosts’.
2804: अनीकस्थ Tatpur. m. (-स्थः) 	1 A warrior, a combattant. 	2 A royal body guard. 	3 A trainer of an elephant, an elephant driver. 	4 A large military drum. 	5 A mark, a sign, a signal. 	6 (According to one authority: अश्वल q. v.) E. अनीक and स्थ.
2805: अनीकिनी f. (-नी) 	1 An army, a host, forces. 	2 A certain force; three chamūs or one-tenth of an Akṣauhiṇī, con-taining two thousand, one hundred and eighty-seven ele-phants, and as many cars, six thousand, five hundred and sixty-one horses, and ten thousand, nine hundred and thirty-five foot. E. अनीक, taddh. aff. इनि.
2806: अनीक्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Not seeing, not looking at (e. g. the rising or the setting sun, as one of the प्रजापतिव्रत q. v.). E. अ neg. and ईक्षण.
2807: अनीच Tatpur. m. f. n. (-चः-चा-चम्) 	1 Not low, respectable, decent. 	2 (In grammar.) Not pronounced with the low or anudātta accent (as a syllable). E. अ neg. and नीच.
2808: अनीचानुवर्तिन् Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्ती-र्तिनी-र्ति) Not keeping low or improper company. 2. m. (-र्ती) A faithful lover or husband. E. अ neg. and नीच-अनुवर्तिन्.
2809: अनीचिदर्शिन् Tatpur. m. (-र्शी) The name of a Bauddha saint. E. अनीचि(?) and दर्शिन्. (The reading of this word is doubtful, and the correct form is probably अवीचिदर्शिन्; from अवीचि the last of the eight fiery hells of the Bud-dhists and दर्शिन्, ‘seeing’; as an Arhat, who has made himself conversant with the whole doctrine of Sākyamuni, is promised to penetrate with his sight all the worlds, ‘from the highest summit of existence, down to the great hell Avīchi’.)
2810: अनीड I. Tatpur. m. (-नीडः) (ved.) Not nesting, not rest-ing, restless; an epithet of Agni. Also written अनीळ. E. अ neg. and नीड. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-डः-डा-डम्) Having no nest or repose; metaphorically applied to the highest divinity which is without an abode i. e. without a body. E. अ priv. and नीड.
2811: अनीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) I. 	1 Impropriety, immorality. 	2 Im-policy, ill conduct. E. अ neg. and नीति. II. Freedom from calamities of season, as excessive rain &c. E. अ neg. and ईति.
2812: अनीतिज्ञ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ज्ञः-ज्ञा-ज्ञम्) 	1 Indiscreet, im-moral. 	2 Impolitic. E. अ neg. and नीतिज्ञ.
2813: अनीतिविद् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्-त्-त्) The same as the pre-ceding. E. अ neg. and नीतिविद्.
2814: अनीदृश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शी-शम्) Unlike, dissimilar. E. अ neg. and ईदृश.
2815: अनीप्सित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not desirable. E. अ neg. and ईप्सित.
2816: अनीश I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Not ruling, not being master over, without power, powerless, unable. 2. f. (-शा) (In the Upanishads.) Want of power, im-potence, insufficiency.
