E. अ neg. and 1. ईश, 2. ईशा. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Without a lord or superior. And see अनीश्वर II. 2. m. (-शः) 	1 A name of Viṣṇu. 	2 A name of Śiva. E. अ priv. and ईश.
2817: अनीशता f. (-ता) or अनीशत्व n. (-त्वम्) The condition or state of not being a master or ruler. E. अनीश I., taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2818: अनीश्वर I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not ruling, not being master over, without power, powerless, unable. E. अ neg. and ईश्वर. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Without a lord or superior. 	2 Unchecked, uncontrolled. 	3 Not belonging to the supreme deity. 	4 Not acknowledging a supreme deity, atheistic. E. अ priv. and ईश्वर.
2819: अनीश्वरता f. (-ता) or अनीश्वरत्व n. (-त्वम्) 	1 Want of power, impotence, insufficiency. 	2 The being without a lord. 	3 The being unchecked. 	4 Atheism. E. 1. अनीश्वर I.; 2. 3. 4. अनी-श्वर II., taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2820: अनीश्वरवादिन् Tatpur. m. (-दी) An atheist, one who denies a supreme ruler of the universe. E. अनीश्वर and वादिन्.
2821: अनीह I. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Without a desire, indifferent. 2. m. (-हः) The proper name of a king of Ayodhyā, father of Pārijātra; (according to other authorities the same king is called Ahīnagu and is father of Pārijātra or Saha-śrāsva). E. अ priv. and ईहा. II. Tatpur. f. (-हा) 	1 Want of desire, indifference. 	2 Want of energy, apathy. E. अ neg. and ईहा.
2822: अनीहित Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unwished for, dis-agreeable. 2. n. (-तम्) Displeasure. E. अ neg. and ईहित.
2824: I. अनु ind. (see निपात, उपसर्ग, गति, कर्मप्रवचनीय). A particle implying the notion of ‘after’ in its literal and metaphorical acceptations; it is used either as a separable preposition or as a prefix to verbs, but, in the latter ca-pacity, in the Vedas and in archaic passages of the epic literature, also detached from the verb, very much in the same manner as German prepositions when connected with verbs; in the Vedas it is sometimes also used adverbially. With nouns it may form Avyayībh., Tatpur. and Bahuvr. compounds. It means: 1. (as a separable preposition, with a noun following or preceding in the accusative) 	1 After; 	a. in space (literally), 	b. in time, implying successiveness, 	c. in rank or order, im-plying inferiority. 	2 Along, lengthwise (in this sense also with a noun in the genitive). 	3 With, together with (in this meaning, however, only in conventional phrases; e. g. पर्वतमनु or नदीमन्ववसिता सेना ‘the army was (so placed as to be) in communication with a mountain or with a river’. 	4 To the part or share of; e. g. यदत्र मामनु स्यात् ‘what there may fall to my share’. 	5 By (implying dis-tribution); e. g. वृक्षं वृक्षमनु सिञ्चति ‘he throws water tree by tree i. e. he waters every tree. 	6 After, in the sense of to, towards, in the direction of; e. g. वृक्षमनु विद्योतते विद्युत् ‘the lightning flushes after i. e. towards, in the direction of the tree’. 	7 In regard to, in consequence of, on behalf of (only in conventional phrases), e. g. जपमनु प्रावर्षत् ‘it rained in consequence of prayers’ or शाकल्यस्य संहितामनु or अनुडुद्यज्ञमनु प्रावर्षत् ‘it rained in consequence of the hymns of Sākalya (having been recited) or in consequence of an ox having being sacrificed’. 	8 In accordance with, agree-ably to, like, similar. 	9 According to the statement of, e. g. साधुर्देवदत्तो मातरमनु ‘Devadatta is an excellent man, according to what his mother tells’. 2. (as a prefix to verbs, undetached or detached) 	1 After, in space or time, literally and metaphorically, e. g. गम्, सज्ज्, शी &c. with अनु qq. vv. 	2 Similarly, likewise (im-plying imitation); in accordance with, agreeably to, lit. and met., see f. i. कृ, वच्, ज्ञा with अनु &c. 3. (as adverb, in the Vedas) Afterwards. 4. (in composition with nouns) I. (In Avyayībh. com-pounds.) 	1 After, 	a. in space (literally), e. g. अनुरथम्, after, behind the cart; 	b. in order or rank, e. g. अनुज्येष्ठम्, after, next to the eldest. 	2 Along, lengthwise, on, e. g. अनुगङ्गं वाराणसी ‘Benares is situated along, i. e. on the Ganges’. 	3 Near to; e. g. अनुवनमशनिर्गतः ‘it lightens near the forest’. 	4 According to, agreeably to, like; e. g. अनु-क्रमम् ‘according to order, in due order’. 	5 Severally, by; e. g. अनुदिनम् ‘day by day, daily’. II. (In Tatpur. compounds.) 	1 After (in order or rank), subsequent, inferior, secondary; see f. i. अनुकनीयस्, अनु-कल्प, अनुनायिका. 	2 According to, in conformance with, similar, like to; e. g. अनुकूल, अनुलोम, अनुब्राह्मण. 	3 Again; e. g. अनुलाप. III. (In Bahuvr. compounds.) In conformity with, si-milar, like, e. g. अनुगुण, अनुरूप &c. E. unknown; the native etym. अन्, uṇ. aff. उ, is not plausible; अनु is pro-bably connected in origin with आ, towards, in its oldest form आंँ = अंँस्. See s. v. आ and the Preface.
2825: II. अनु m. (-नुः) 	1 (in the Vedas; esp. in the plural अनवः) Man in general; but it seems that this word is in the Vedas the name of a tribe or family, the meaning ‘men’ being an etymological interpretation of the commentaries. 	2 The proper name of a king in the North, the fourth son of Yayāti by Śarmiṣṭā; according to others, a son of Kuru-vaśa or of Kuru. E. अन्, uṇ. aff. उ.
2826: अनुक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Desirous, lustful, libidinous. E. अनु (the particle), taddh. aff. कन्; acc. to others, a Tatpur., E. कम् with अनु, kṛt aff. ड.
2827: अनुकथन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Telling according to (what has been said), report, account. E. कथ् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2828: अनुकनीयस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यान्-यसी-यः) The next youngest, the youngest in succession. Comp. अनुज्येष्ठ. E. अनु and कनीयस्.
2829: अनुकम्पक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The name of a king, who lived, accord. to the Mahābh., in the Kṛta-yuga. E. कम्प्, with अनु, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
2830: अनुकम्पन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Compassion, commiseration. E. कम्प् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2831: अनुकम्पा Tatpur. f. (-म्पा) Compassion, tenderness. E. कम्प् with अनु, kṛt aff. अ, and fem. aff. टाप्.
2832: अनुकम्प्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-प्यः-प्या-प्यम्) Worthy of tender-ness or compassion. II. m. (-म्प्यः) 	1 A courier, an express, a runner. 	2 An ascetic, keeping the vow of rigorous penance. E. कम्प् with अनु, kṛtya aff. ण्यत्.
2833: अनुकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Doing any thing like another, imitating. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
2834: अनुकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) 	1 Making or doing like or in imitation of another, imitating. 	2 Resemblance, similarity. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2835: अनुकर्तृ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्ता-र्त्री-तृ) Imitating. 2. m. (-र्ता) A performer, an actor. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. तृच्.
2836: अनुकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) A subsequent rite or ceremony. E. अनु and कर्मन्. See अनुक्रिया.
2837: अनुकर्ष Tatpur. m. (-र्षः) 	1 Attracting. 	2 (In Grammar.) Including a preceding in a subsequent rule. 	3 Invoking, summoning by incantations. 	4 Deferred performance of a duty: performance at a period posterior to that for which it is prescribed (opp. to अपकर्ष q. v.). 	5 The bottom of a carriage (so called, be-cause it is, as it were, dragged after by the wheel which is under it). E. कृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
2838: अनुकर्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्). The same as अनुकर्ष 1. 2. 3. E. कृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2839: अनुकर्षन् Tatpur. m. (-र्षा) The bottom of a carriage. See अनुकर्ष. E. Probably a further developement of the partic. अनुकर्षत्, from कृष् with अनु, conformably to the general origin of bases in अन्; the native dict. consider it as अनुकर्ष with an additional न्, but अनुकर्ष is more likely the curtailed अनुकर्षन् as most bases in अ probably originate in a fuller form on अस्, अत्, अन्.
2840: अनुकल्प Tatpur. m. (-ल्पः) A secondary or succedaneous in-junction: an injunction of what is to be done, if the ori-ginal injunction cannot be acted upon; f. i. to make offer-ings with nīvāra, if vrīhi--the dravya originally required --cannot be had; but used also in a more general sense with regard to other duties. E. अनु and कल्प.
2841: अनुकाङ्क्षा Tatpur. f. (-ङ्क्षा) Wish, desire after. E. काङ्क्ष् with अनु, kṛt aff. अ and fem. aff. टाप्.
2842: अनुकाम I. Tatpur. 1. m. (-मः) (ved.) Wish, desire. E. कम् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्. 2. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Consistent with one's desire, agreeable, liked. E. अनु and काम. II. Avyayībh. (-मम्) 	1 According to wish or desire. 	2 After (i. e. past) one's wish or desire(?). 	3 Desire by de-sire, every desire(?). E. अनु and काम.
2843: अनुकामकृत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कृत्) (ved.) Fulfilling desire or wish. E. अनुकाम and कृत्.
2844: अनुकामीन m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) 	1 One who goes where he pleases. 	2 One who acts as he pleases. E. अनुकाम, taddh. aff. ख.
2845: अनुकामीनता f. (-ता) 	1 Going according to wish or inclin-ation. 	2 Acting according to wish or inclination. E. अनु-कामीन, taddh. aff. तल्.
2846: अनुकार Tatpur. m. (-रः) 	1 Imitation. 	2 Resemblance. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
2847: अनुकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Imitating (also as an actor). Comp. अनुकर्तृ. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
2848: अनुकार्य Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) 	1 To be imitated. 	2 To be performed (as the character in a play). E. कृ with अनु, kṛtya aff. ण्यत्. 2. n. (-र्यम्) A subsequent duty or business. E. अनु and कार्य.
2849: अनुकालम् Avyayībh. In due time. E. अनु and काल.
2850: अनुकीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) Filled, thronged, crowded. E. कॄ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2851: अनुकीर्तन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Proclaiming, publishing. E. कॄत् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2852: अनुकुञ्चित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Inflected, curved. E. कुञ्च् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त with āgama इट्.
2853: अनुकूल Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) 	1 Conformable to. 	2 Well disposed to, friendly, favourable. 2. m. (-लः) (In Rhetoric.) See अनुकूलनायक. 3. f. (-ला) 	1 The name of a medicinal plant (Croton polyandrum). See दन्ती. 	2 The name of a metre regulated by number and quantity; it belongs to the class, called त्रिष्टुभ् q. v. and consists of a stanza of four lines with the following eleven syllables in each: ¯˘˘¯¯ । ˘˘˘˘¯¯. Also called कुद्मलदन्ती, मौक्तिकमाला and श्री. 4. n. (-लम्) (In Rhetoric.) An alaṅkāra or mode of writing or speaking elegantly, viz. representing an act, unpleasant in itself, as arising out of kindness or affection; e. g. when ‘an ill-humoured mistress embraces her lover and apparently out of excess of love wounds him with her nails’. E. अनु and कूल literally ‘along or according to the bank (of a river)’.
2854: अनुकूलता f. (-ता) and अनुकूलत्व n. (-त्वम्) 	1 Conformity, consistency. 	2 Concord, good will, consent. E. अनुकूल, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
2855: अनुकूलनायक Karmadh. m. (-कः) (In Rhetoric.) One of the forty-eight characters of a hero or principal personage in a poetical composition; he is described as a lover attached only to one mistress and as one of the four varieties (see also दक्षिण, धृष्ट and शठ) of either of the four principal divisions of the नायक (q. v.), viz. of the धीरोदात्त, धी-रोद्धत, धीरललित and धीरप्रशान्त (qq. vv.). The अनुकूल-नायक may again be उत्तम, मध्यम or अधम (qq. vv.). E. अनुकूल and नायक.
2856: अनुकूलि Denom. (अनुकूलयति) To act kindly, to show favour. E. अनुकूल, denom. aff. णिच्.
2857: अनुकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Imitated, made like or done in like manner. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2858: अनुकृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) 	1 Making or doing any thing like or in imitation of another, imitating. 	2 Resemblance, similarity. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
2859: अनुकृत्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्). The same as अनुकार्य. E. कृ with अनु, kṛtya aff. क्यप् and āgama तुक्.
2860: अनुकृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) 	1 Attracted. 	2 (In Gram-mar.) Included in a subsequent rule (as a preceding one). E. कृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2861: अनुक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) 	1 Not spoken, not ex-pressed. 	2 Unheard of, unthought of, extraordinary (esp. in Karmadh. compositions, implying praise, e. g. अनुक्ता-ध्यापक an unheard of i. e. a very excellent teacher). E. अ neg. and उक्त.
2862: अनुक्तनिमित्त I. Tatpur. n. (-त्तम्) 	1 A reason not expressed. 	2 An extraordinary, unthought of reason. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) 	1 Being without an apparent reason. 	2 Having or owing its origin to an extra-ordinary, unthought of reason. See विभावना and विशेषोक्ति. E. अनुक्त and निमित्त.
2863: अनुक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः) 	1 The not speaking, not saying. 	2 The not having been said or mentioned. E. अ neg. and उक्ति.
2864: अनुक्थ Bahuvr. m. (-क्थः) (ved.) Without hymns, not praising (the divinity) in hymns. E. अ priv. and उक्था.
2865: अनुककच Tatpur. m. f. n. (-चः-चा-चम्) Serrated, dentated. E. अनु and क्रकच.
2866: अनुक्रम I. Tatpur. m. (-मः) Order, arrangement, regular and methodical disposal or succession.--अनुक्रमेण and अनु-क्रमात् in the order. E. क्रम् with अनु, kṛt aff. अच्. II. Avyayībh. (-मम्) According to order, in due order. E. अनु and क्रम.
2867: अनुक्रमण Tatpur. 1. n. (-णम्) 	1 Following. 	2 Arranging, dis-posing methodically. 2. f. (-णी) An explanatory table of contents, esp. of vaidik writings. E. क्रम् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्; 2. with fem. aff. ङीप्.
2868: अनुक्रमणिका f. (-का). The same as अनुक्रमणी. E. अनुक्रमणी, taddh. aff. कन् and fem. aff. टाप्.
2869: अनुक्रान्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Done or arranged methodically, passed over &c. in due order. E. क्रम् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2870: अनुक्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या) A subsequent rite or ceremony. See अनुकर्मन्. E. अनु and क्रिया.
2871: अनुक्रोश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Tenderness, compassion. E. क्रुश् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
2872: अनुक्षणम् Avyayībh. Momentarily, perpetually. E. अनु and क्षण.
2873: अनुक्षत्तृ Tatpur. m. (-क्षत्ता) (ved.) 	1 The follower or servant of a charioteer. 	2 The follower or servant of a doorkeeper. E. अनु and क्षत्तृ.
2874: अनुक्षपम् Avyayībh. Night by night, every night. E. अनु and क्षपा.
2875: अनुक्षेत्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) (A modern term.) A charitable allowance made to the native servants of certain temples in Orissa, by the Marathas and continued by the British Government. E. अनु and क्षेत्र.
2876: अनुखञ्ज Tatpur. m. (-ञ्जः) The name of a country (as a king of which Paurava is mentioned). E. अनु and खञ्ज.
2877: अनुख्याति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Reporting, revealing. E. ख्या with अनु, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
2878: अनुख्यातृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) Reporter, revealer. E. ख्या with अनु, kṛt aff. तृच्.
2879: अनुग Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) 	1 Following, lit. and met. 	2 Corresponding with. 2. m. (-गः) 	1 A follower, a companion. 	2 A servant, an attendant. 3. f. (-गा) The proper name of an Apsaras. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. ड.
2880: अनुगङ्गम् Avyayībh. Along the Ganges, on the Ganges. See I. अनु 4. E. अनु and गङ्गा.
2881: अनुगणित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Reckoned over, cal-culated over. E. गण् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त and āgama इट्.
2882: अनुगणितिन् m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) One who has reckoned over, calculated over (with a noun following in the locative). E. अनुगणित, taddh. aff. इनि.
2883: अनुगत Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Following, pursu-ing. 	2 Followed, pursued. 	3 Acquired, obtained, lit. and met. 	4 Gone out, extinguished (as fire). 2. n. (-तम्) (In Music.) The middle measure, neither quick nor slow; the same as घन q. v. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2884: अनुगतार्थ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) Having an obvious meaning, one easily inferred from the etymon (as a word), e. g. the words गर्भाधान, अन्नप्राशन, उदयगिरि &c. E. अनुगत and अर्थ.
2885: अनुगन्तव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be followed (also in a special sense: at funeral obsequies). E. गम् with अनु, kṛtya aff. तव्य or तव्यत्.
2886: अनुगन्धिका f. (-का) A river of mount Mālyavat. E. अनु-गन्ध, taddh. aff. क(?).
2887: अनुगम Tatpur. m. (-मः) 	1 Following, going or coming after. See also अनुगमन. 	2 (In Philosophy.) The comprehension men-tally of the essence of an object. 	3 The going out, ex-tinction (of fire). E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
2888: अनुगमन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) 	1 Following, going or coming after (also in a special sense: at funeral obsequies). 	2 Following in death, the self-immolation of a widow on the funeral pile. See also अनुमरण. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2889: अनुगवम् Avyayībh. Of a cow's breadth, as wide as is required for a cow (said of a cart). E. अनु and गो, samāsānta aff. अच्.
2890: अनुगवीन m. (-नः) A cowherd. E. अनुगु, taddh. aff. ख.
2891: अनुगादिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Speaking the same as or like another. E. गद् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
2892: अनुगामिन् Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Going behind or after, following. 2. m. (-मी) 	1 A follower, a companion. 	2 A servant, an attendant. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
2893: अनुगामुक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Always following, always connected with. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. उकञ्.
2894: अनुगिरम् Avyayībh. On the mountain (= गिरौ). E. अनु and गिरि, samāsānta aff. टच्.
2895: अनुगीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) The name of a metre regulated by feet and belonging to the class called गणच्छन्दस् or गणवृत्त qq. vv. It consists of a couplet of two verses with twenty-seven syllables in the first, and with thirty-two syllables in the second verse; it is measured by feet, denominated गण or मात्रागण which are equivalent to two long syllables or to four short; its odd feet (the first, third, fifth and seventh) must never be amphibrachys, the sixth foot of the first verse consists of a single short syllable and that of the second verse of an Amphibrachys or Proceleusmaticus. The pause is commonly restricted to the close of the third foot. If the long verse precede the short one, the metre is called सुगीति. E. अनु and गीति (another metre).
2896: अनुगु Avyayībh. After the cow or the cows. E. अनु and गो.
2897: अनुगुण I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Of similar qualities, congenial with, corresponding with, suitable to. II. Tatpur. m. (-णः) (In Rhetoric.) An alaṅkāra or mode of writing elegantly, representing the natural properties of a thing as more intense through contact with another thing. III. Avyayībh. (-णम्) According to the quality or natural property (of an object). E. अनु and गुण.
2898: अनुगृहीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Favoured, obliged. E. ग्रह with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त and āgama इट् lengthened.
2899: अनुग्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्रः-ग्रा-ग्रम्) Not violent, calm, gentle, mild. E. अ neg. and उग्र.
2900: अनुग्रह Tatpur. m. (-हः) 	1 Promoting good and preventing ill or (according to another interpretation) promoting good by preventing ill. 	2 The conferring benefits, favour. 	3 Aid, assistance. 	4 Instructing in the mystical verses or incan-tations of the Vedas(?). 	5 See अनुग्रहसर्ग. E. ग्रह् with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
2901: अनुग्रहण Tatpur. n. (-णम्). The same as अनुग्रह 1. 2. 3. E. ग्रह् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2902: अनुग्रहसर्ग Tatpur. m. (-र्गः) (In the Sāṅkhya philosophy.) The creation of mental conditions; in some of the Purāṇas it is considered as an eighth creation, in others as a fifth, and subdivided into विपर्यय, अशक्ति, सिद्धि and तुष्टि qq. vv. See also प्रत्ययसर्ग. E. अनुग्रह (perhaps in the sense of ‘feeling’ in general) and सर्ग.
2903: अनुग्रहिन् m. (-ही) One instructed in the mystical verses or incantations of the Vedas(?). E. अनुग्रह, taddh. aff. इनि.
2904: अनुग्रामम् Avyayībh. Village for village, according to or in every village. E. अनु and ग्राम.
2905: अनुग्रासक m. (-कः) A mouthful or a quantity equivalent to a mouthful of boiled rice. E. अनु-ग्रास, taddh. aff. क.
2906: अनुग्राहक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हकः-हिका-हकम्) 	1 Manifesting grace or favour towards; e. g. आदित्यपुरुषो वा चक्षुषोऽनु-ग्राहकः. 	2 A supporter, an assistant (also in evil deeds). E. ग्रह् with अनु, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
2907: अनुग्राहिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ही-हिणी-हि) Gracious, favour-able. E. ग्रह् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
2908: अनुग्राह्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ह्यः-ह्या-ह्यम्) To be treated with graciousness or favour, to be favoured. E. ग्रह् with अनु, kṛtya aff. ण्यत्.
2909: अनुचर Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Going or coming after, following. 2. m. f. (-रः-री) 	1 A follower, a companion. 	2 A ser-vant, an attendant. (The fem. form अनुचरा, if not the latter part of a Bahuvr. compound, is grammatically incorrect. E. चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. अच्; चर being टित् or, according to some, चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. ट.
2910: अनुचारक Tatpur. m. f. (-रकः-रिका) 	1 A follower, a companion. 	2 A servant, an attendant. E. चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
2911: अनुचारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Following, attend-ing. E. चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. घिणुन्.
2912: अनुचित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not proper, not suitable, not convenient, wrong. 	2 Not known, not under-stood. E. अ neg. and उचित.
2913: अनुचितार्थ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) Having an un-known or an unusual meaning (as a word; in rhetoric considered as one of the पददोष q. v.; e. g. if the word पशु, animal, is used in the sense of sacrificial animal, in a poetical passage, while it has this sense only in the ritual literature, or with the intention of implying timidity which it does not imply). E. अनुचित and अर्थ.
2914: अनुचिन्तन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Thinking of, recollecting, recall-ing. E. चिन्त् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2915: अनुचिन्ता Tatpur. f. (-न्ता) Thinking of, recollecting, recall-ing. E. चिन्त् with अनु, kṛt aff. अङ्.
2916: अनुच्चार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Non-utterance, omission (of a word). E. अ neg. and उच्चार.
2917: अनुच्छाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) A cloth or garment, that hangs down; different from पर्यास, a cloth that is thrown round q. v., from नीवि q. v. &c. (ved.). E. छद् with अनु (along, scil. the body), kṛt aff. घञ्.
2918: अनुच्छित्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Non-destruction, indestructibility, eternity. E. अ neg. and उच्छित्ति.
2919: अनुच्छित्तिधर्मन् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्मा-र्मा-र्म) Having the property of eternity, of indestructibility (an epithet of आत्मन् in the Upan.). E. अनुच्छित्ति and धर्मन्.
2920: अनुच्छिन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Not cut off, not destroyed. E. अ neg. and उच्छिन्न.
2921: अनुच्छिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not rejected, pure. E. अ neg. and उच्छिष्ट.
2922: अनुच्छेद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Non-destruction, indestructibility, eternity. E. अ neg. and उच्छेद.
2923: अनुच्छेद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) 	1 Not divisible. 	2 In-destructible, permanent. E. अ neg. and उच्छेद्य.
2924: अनुज Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Born after or later. 2. m. (-जः) A younger brother. 3. f. (-जा) 	1 A younger sister. 	2 The name of a me-dicinal plant. See त्रायमाणा. 4. n. (-जम्) A small herbaceous plant used in medicine and as a perfume. See प्रपौण्डरीक. E. जन् with अनु, kṛt aff. ड.
2925: अनुजनम् Avyayībh. According to people, according to every body. E. अनु and जन.
2926: अनुजन्मन् Bahuvr. m. (-न्मा) A younger brother or younger born. E. अनु and जन्मन्.
2927: अनुजात Tatpur. I. 1. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Born after. Used ac-tively, passively and impersonally; when actively with a noun depending in the accusative; e. g. अनुजातो माणवको माण-विकाम् or अनुजाता माणविका माणवकेन ‘the boy is born after the girl’ or अनुजातं माणवकेन ‘the boy is later born’. 2. m. (-तः) A younger brother. 3. f. (-ता) A younger sister. E. जन् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त. II. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 After teething (as a child; the word is explained so by a commentator of Manu, where it appears as an elliptical expression instead of अनुदन्तजात, the word दन्तजात preceding immediately; this meaning is therefore restricted to the passage alone alluded to (book 5 verse 58) and not generally applicable). 	2 Born like or with similar qualities as (another). E. अनु and जात.
2928: अनुजावर See आनुजावर. (The form आनुयाजावर which occurs in the existing edition of Pāṇini V. 4. 36. v. 5., is wrong.)
2929: अनुजिघृक्षा Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) The desire of conferring favours, of acting kindly. E. ग्रह् in the desid., with अनु, kṛt aff. अ.
2930: अनुजीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) Grown old after, decayed after, or in consequence of, on behalf of. (Used actively, passively and impersonally; when actively with a noun de-pending in the accusative; e. g. अनुजीर्णो वृषलीं चैत्रः or अनुजीर्णा वृषली चैत्रेण; अनुजीर्णं चैत्रेण. Compare the con-struction of अनुजात.) E. जॄ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2931: अनुजीविन् Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-वी-विनी-वि) Living upon, getting a livelihood by or through, dependant. 2. m. (-वी) 	1 A servant, a dependant. 	2 A companion, a follower. (It occurs as the proper name of a crow in a fable.) E. जीव् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
2932: अनुजीविसात् ind. See the following. E. अनुजीविन्, taddh. aff. साति.
2933: अनुजीविसात्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Made subser-vient, become entirely one's own. E. अनुजीविसात् and कृत.
2934: अनुजीव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be lived upon or after, in conformance with. E. जीव् with अनु, kṛtya aff. तव्यत्.
2935: अनुज्ञप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) Ordering, commanding, enjoining. The same as अनुज्ञापन. E. ज्ञप् with अनु (or perhaps better ज्ञा, in the caus., with अनु, with āgama पुक् and the vowel of the radical shortened), kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
2936: अनुज्ञा Tatpur. f. (-ज्ञा) 	1 Assent, permission. 	2 Order, com-mand(?). 	3 (In Rhetoric.) An alaṅkāra or mode of writing elegantly viz. taking a favourable view of another's faults and, as it were, assenting to them. E. ज्ञा with अनु, kṛt aff. अङ्.
2937: अनुज्ञात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Assented to, permitted, allowed, accepted, acknowledged. 	2 Ordered, directed. 	3 Dismissed. 	4 Honoured. E. ज्ञा with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2938: अनुज्ञान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Assenting, permitting. E. ज्ञा with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2939: अनुज्ञापक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पकः-पिका-पकम्) Commanding. E. ज्ञा in the caus., with अनु, with āgama पुक्, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
2940: अनुज्ञापन Tatpur. n. (-नम्). The same as अनुज्ञप्ति. E. ज्ञा in the caus., with अनु, with āgama पुक्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2941: अनुज्ञाप्रार्थना Tatpur. f. (-ना) Asking permission. E. अनुज्ञा and प्रार्थना.
2942: अनुज्ञैषणा Tatpur. f. (-णा) Asking permission. E. अनुज्ञा and एषणा.
2943: अनुज्येष्ठ I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्ठः-ष्ठा-ष्ठम्) Following the eldest, the next eldest, eldest but one. II. Avyayībh. (-ष्ठम्) 	1 After the eldest. 	2 According to seniority. E. अनु and ज्येष्ठ.
2945: अनुतप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Filled with regret or re-pentance, repentant, remorseful. E. तप् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2946: अनुतर Tatpur. m. (-रः) Fare, freight. E. तॄ with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
2947: अनुतर्ष Tatpur. m. (-र्षः) 	1 Thirst. 	2 Wish, desire. 	3 A drinking vessel, one used to drink spirituous liquors from. 	4 Spi-rituous liquor. See अनुतर्षण. E. तृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
2948: अनुतर्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) 	1 A vessel (according to some, of crystal), from which spirituous liquor is drunk. 	2 Serving up or distributing liquor. (Some authorities admit only the first, some only the second meaning; neither both together. A later compilation makes this word a synonyme of अनुतर्ष also in its other meanings.) E. तृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2949: अनुताप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Repentance. E. तप् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
2950: अनुतापन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Making remorseful or penitent, afflicting. E. तप् with अनु, in the caus., kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2951: अनुतापिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पी-पिनी-पि) Penitent, regretting. E. अनुताप, taddh. aff. इनि.
2952: अनुतिलम् Avyayībh. According or like a seed of sesamum; (probably used in the same manner as तिलतुल्य in negative phrases answering ‘a single grain, a pin's head, an iota, a whit &c.’). E. अनु and तिल.
2953: अनुतूलि Denom. (अनुतूलयति). E. तूल, denom. aff. णिच्, with अनु. See under तूलि.
2954: अनुत्कर्ष Tatpur. m. (-र्षः) Want of excellence or superiority, inferiority. E. अ neg. and उत्कर्ष.
2955: अनुत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Not thrown, not over-powered, invincible (ved.). E. अ neg. and नुत्त. (According to others: not wetted, not moistened. E. अ neg. and उत्त; this interpretation, however, seems erroneous.)
2956: अनुत्तम m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) I. Tatpur. Very best, chief, principal. E. अ compar. or expl. and उत्तम, or perhaps a compound framed after the analogy of अनुत्तर. II. Bahuvr. (In grammar.) Without the first person, used in any but the first person, i. e. in the second or third person (viz. a verb). E. अ priv. and उत्तम.
2957: अनुत्तमन्यु Bahuvr. m. (-न्युः) (ved.) Of invincible wrath, an epithet of Indra. E. अनुत्त and मन्यु.
2958: अनुत्तमाम्भस् Tatpur. n. (-म्भः) A technical term in the Sāṅkhya philosophy denoting one of the five sorts of external ac-quiescence or indifference (see तुष्टि), viz. that condition of mind in which a man abstains from sensual enjoyments on the ground that there is no repose for the senses when at-tachment to sensual pleasures prevails. Some call this in-difference नारीक; compare also अम्भस्, सलिल, ओघ, वृष्टि, सुतमस्, पार, सुनेत्र, सुपार, अपार, पारापार, उत्तमाम्भस् and the following. E. अ neg. and उत्तमाम्भस्(?).
2959: अनुत्तमाम्भसिक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) A technical term in the Sāṅkhya philosophy denoting one of the five sorts of ex-ternal acquiescence or indifference (see तुष्टि), viz. that con-dition of mind in which a man abstains from sensual enjoy-ments on the ground that it is sinful to injure created things, enjoyment however being impossible without doing so. Some call this indifference उत्तमाम्भस्. Compare the preceding and the terms named there. E. अनुत्तम and आम्भसिक(?).
2960: अनुत्तर I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Low, nether. 	2 South, southern. 	3 Low, inferior, vile. 2. n. (-रम्) 	1 No-answer. 	2 A bad or evasive reply and held therefore to be no-answer (e. g. of the defendant, in a law-suit). E. अ neg. and उत्तर. II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) 	1 Best, excellent, supreme, chief, principal (literally: than which there is no higher or better). 	2 Fixed, firm. 	3 Unable to answer or to give a proper answer. 2. m. pl. (-राः) In Jaina mythology, one of the two divisions (see also ग्रैवेयक) of the gods called कल्पातीत (q. v.) which are one of the two divisions (see also कल्पभव) of the gods called वैमानिक (q. v.); the अनुत्तराः comprise five classes. See विजय, वैजयन्त, जयन्त, अपराजित and सर्वार्थसिद्धि. See also अनुत्तरोपपातिक. E. अ priv. and उत्तर.
2961: अनुत्तरयोगतन्त्र Tatpur. n. (-न्त्रम्) The name of the last of the four Bauddha Tantras, the Tantra of the supreme Yoga. (The other three are called क्रियातन्त्र, आचारतन्त्र and यो-गतन्त्र qq. vv.) E. अनुत्तर-योग and तन्त्र.
2962: अनुत्तरोपपातिक m. pl. (-काः) Apparently the same as अनुत्तर m. pl.: the name of the Jaina gods so called. According to a commentary it would mean literally ‘those who have the highest origin i. e. who are born in the five Vimānas’ from which the five classes of the अनुत्तराः derive their appellations. E. अनुत्तरोपपातिन् (अनुत्तर and उपपात, taddh. aff. इनि), taddh. aff. कन्(?).
2963: अनुत्तरोपपातिकदशा Bahuvr. f. pl. (-शाः) The name of the ninth of the twelve sacred writings of the Jainas: that treating on the अनुत्तरोपपातिकाः (q. v.). E. अनुत्तरोपपा-तिक and दशा (acc. to a comm. in the sense of अध्ययन); but more probably अनुत्त° and दशन्, samāsānta aff. डच्, like आसन्नदश &c.
2964: अनुत्पत्ति I. Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) The not taking origin or birth, the not being produced, the not arising (as in philosophy, e. g. of all knowledge at once, or of Prakṛti &c.). See also अनुत्पत्तिसम. E. अ neg. and उत्पत्ति. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) Having no origin or birth, not being produced. E. अ priv. and उत्पत्ति.
2965: अनुत्पत्तिक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) (In Bauddha li-terature.) Having no origin or birth, not or not yet being produced. (The fem. -की belongs to Bauddha writings; in the classic language, it would be -का.) See the following. E. अनुत्पत्ति II., samāsānta aff. कप्.
2966: अनुत्पत्तिकधर्मक्षान्ति Tatpur. f. (-न्तिः) (In Bauddha literature.) Enduring conditions which have not yet taken place i. e. reconciling one's mind to the conditions of a future life; one of the hundred-eight धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.) or means to comprehend the doctrine of Śākyamuni; ‘it leads to the reception of revelations’ i. e. it enables an enquirer to get possessed of the mysteries of the Bauddha doctrine. E. अनुत्पत्तिक-धर्म and क्षान्ति.
2967: अनुत्पत्तिसम Tatpur. m. f. (-मः-मा) (In the Nyāya philosophy.) The sophism of the impossibility of origin or birth; viz. arguing that a thing cannot take origin, because a thing exists in consequence of an immaterial cause; as the latter, however, does not exist before the material cause and the instance proving the existence of such material cause, and as the material cause again depends upon what exists, and the instance upon the material cause, the thing itself can never come into existence: or origin in general is impossible. E. अनुत्पत्ति and सम. (With respect to the gender of this word and the ellipsis required to explain it, see the E. of अनित्यसम.)
2968: अनुत्पन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Not born, not pro-duced &c. See उत्पन्न. E. अ neg. and उत्पन्न.
2969: अनुत्पाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) The not taking origin or birth, the not arising. E. अ neg. and उत्पाद.
2970: अनुत्पादक्षान्ति Tatpur. f. (-न्तिः) (In Bauddha literature.) En-during non-birth i. e. reconciling one's mind to not being born again; one of the hundred-eight धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.) or means to comprehend the doctrine of Śākyamuni; it is conducive to a clear apprehension of all that may impede (sc. the attainment of this desirable end). E. अनुत्पाद and क्षान्ति.
2971: अनुत्पादन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Not producing, not bringing forth. E. अ neg. and उत्पादन.
2972: अनुत्पाद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) Not producible, eternal (e. g. प्रकृति or पुरुष in the Sāṅkhya philosophy). E. अ neg. and उत्पाद्य.
2973: अनुत्साह I. Tatpur. m. (-हः) Want of effort or energy, in difference, unconcernedness. E. अ neg. and उत्साह. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Without energy, in-different, unconcerned. E. अ priv. and उत्साह.
2974: अनुत्सुक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Not strongly attached to, not longing for &c. See उत्सुक. E. अ neg. and उत्सुक.
2975: अनुद Tatpur. m. (-दः) (ved.) 1. A companion, a follower. E. दो with अनु, kṛt aff. क. Comp. अनुदेयी. 2. Giving like, liberal in a similar manner. E. दा with अनु, kṛt aff. क. In both meanings only in composition with अ priv. See अनानुद.
2976: अनुदक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Without water, water-less. E. अ priv. and उदक.
2977: अनुदत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Given back, returned. Also अनूत्त q. v. E. दा with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
2978: अनुदर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Thin, lank. E. अ priv. and उदर.
2979: अनुदर्शन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Looking after, considering. E. दृश् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
2980: अनुदर्शिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्शी-र्शिनी-र्शि) Looking after, con-sidering, foreseeing. E. दृश् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
2981: अनुदात्त Tatpur. (In Grammar.) 1. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Not elevated, not being pronounced with the accent called उदात्त (q. v.) or स्वरित (q. v.) (as the syllable of a word). 2. m. (-त्तः) The not elevated accent, the accent (see स्वर and वाह्यप्रयत्न) which is neither उदात्त (q. v.) nor स्वरित (q. v.) and which by the depression of the voice, it requires, prepares, as it were, for the greater effort in the pronunciation of the syllables accented with the उदात्त or स्वरित. This depression being the greatest when the syl-lable having the अनुदात्त accent, is immediately followed by a syllable accented with the उदात्त or स्वरित, the अनु-दात्त is called in this case अनुदात्ततर ‘a very anudātta’. The mode of marking the अनुदात्त, is restricted, as is also the case with the other two accents, to the vaidik Sanhitās (Sanhitā-Pāṭhas) and Brāhmaṇas, and varies according to the different Vedas. In the Sanhitā, Pada and the Brāhmaṇas of the Ṛgveda, in the Sanhitā and Pada of the Yajur- and Sanhitā of the Atharvaveda the Anudātta is marked with a horizontal line under the syllable so accented (thus becoming comparable also in graphic value to the sign of the Virāma, the horizontal line representing as it were the repose in accentua-tion); in the Brāhmaṇas of the White Yajurveda, it is not marked at all; and in the Sanhitā of the Sāmaveda the anu-dātta syllable when anudāttatara before an udātta, or before a svarita syllable bearing the figures २ or ३, is marked with the figure ३ over it, except when it is preceded in the be-ginning of a verse by other anudātta syllables, in which case only the first anudātta syllable bears the figure ३, while the following anudātta syllables are left unmarked. If the anudāttatara is followed by a svarita syllable bearing the sign २र, the syllable so accented is marked with ३क. In the Pada-text of the Sāmaveda the sign ३ denotes the anudāttatara before an udātta, if the latter occupies the second syllable from the beginning, or the syllable before an anudāttatara, if the latter is followed by a svarita, or lastly the anudātta accentuation of a syllable so marked and of all the syllables following it until an udātta or svarita syllable comes; the sign ३क or क denotes the anudāttatara immediately followed by a svarita. Compare also the terms नीच, निहत, न्यस्त, न्यस्ततर, नियत, निघात, न्यास, नियम and the radd. हन् with नि and यम् with नि.--In the native lists of radicals, the Dhātupāthas, certain radicals have the anudātta accent as an इत् (q. v.) or अनुबन्ध (q. v.) connected with them i. e. as a technical sign for certain rules they are subject to with respect to derivation &c. See also अनु-दात्तेत् and अनुदात्तोपदेश. E. अ neg. and अनुदात्त.
2982: अनुदात्ततर m. (-रः) The अनुदात्त accent (or स्वर) or a syl-lable so accented when immediately preceding a syllable having the उदात्त or स्वरित accent. See under अनुदात्त. E. अनुदात्त, taddh. aff. तरप्.
2983: अनुदात्तत्व n. (-त्वम्) The having or being the accent अनुदात्त. E. अनुदात्त, taddh. aff. त्व.
2984: अनुदात्तस्वरित Karmadh. See नीचस्वरित. E. अनुदात्त and स्वरित.
2985: अनुदात्तादि Bahuvr. n. (-दि) (In Grammar.) A nominal base which is अनुदात्त (q. v.) in the first syllable. E. अनुदात्त and आदि; scil. प्रातिपदिक.
2986: अनुदात्तेत् Bahuvr. m. (-त्) (In Grammar.) A radical having in the Dhātupāṭha or the native list of radicals, the अनु-दात्त accent as अनुबन्ध i. e. as a technical sign for certain rules of derivation &c. See the Appendix. E. अनुदात्त and इत् (the technical denomination of अनुबन्ध); scil. धातु.
2987: अनुदात्तोदय Bahuvr. n. (-यम्) (In Grammar.) A syllable fol-lowed by an अनुदात्त (q. v.) syllable. E. अनुदात्त and उदय; scil. अक्षर.
2988: अनुदात्तोपदेश Bahuvr. m. (-शः). The same as अनुदात्तेत्. See s. v. उपदेश. E. अनुदात्त and उपदेश; scil. धातु.
2989: अनुदार I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not liberal, not generous, niggardly, mean. E. अ neg. and उदार. II. Bahuvr. m. (-रः) Adhered to or followed by a wife. E. अनु and दार.
2990: अनुदित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) I. Unrisen. II. Unsaid, unuttered. E. अ neg. and उदित.
2991: अनुदिनम् Avyayībh. Daily, every day. E. अनु and दिन.
2992: अनुदिवसम् Avyayībh. Daily, every day. E. अनु and दिवस.
2993: अनुदिशम् Avyayībh. In every quarter, in every direction. E. अनु and दिश्, samāsānta aff. टच्.
2994: अनुदृष्टि Bahuvr.(?) f. (-ष्टिः) The proper name of the mother or ancestress of आनुदृष्टिनेय. E. अनु and दृष्टि ‘having her eyes after i. e. provident’.
2995: अनुदेय Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) To be given back, to be returned. (ved.) 2. f. (-यी) (ved.) 	1 Restitution, restoration(?). 	2 A female friend or companion. Comp. अनुद. E. दा with अनु, kṛtya aff. यत्.
2996: अनुदेश Tatpur. m. (-शः) 	1 (In Grammar.) A rule or injunction relating to a preceding rule or injunction, to an उद्देश q. v. If there are several उद्देशाः followed by an equal number of अनुदेशाः, the first अनुदेशः is to be connected with the first उद्देश, the second अनुदेशः with the second उद्देशः and so on. 	2 Order, injunction in general. E. दिश् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
2997: अनुदेशिन् m. f. n. (-शी-शिनी-शि) (In Grammar.) Being the ob-ject of an अनुदेश (q. v.) in distinction from उद्देशिन् (q. v.) the object of an उद्देश (q. v.); ‘समानां समसंख्यानां समपरि-पठितानामुद्देशिनामनुदेशिनां च यथाक्रममुद्देशिभिः सहानुदे-शिनः संबध्यन्ते।’. E. अनुदेश, taddh. aff. इनि.
2998: अनुद्धृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not taken out, not taken away &c. See उद्धृत. (If in ritual books said of the Āhavanīya (q. v.) fire, it means that this fire is not yet taken from the Gārhapatya (q. v.) where it is kept.) E. अ neg. and उद्धृत.
2999: अनुद्धृताभ्यस्तमय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The setting of the sun, while the Āhavanīya (q. v.) fire is not yet removed from the Gārhapatya (q. v.) where it is kept. E. अनुद्धृत (in the sense of the locative) and अभ्यस्तमय.
3000: अनुद्भट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-टः-टा-टम्) Not exalted, lowly-minded, not lofty. E. अ neg. and उद्भट.
3001: अनुद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) What must or ought not to be said, unspeakable, unutterable. Compare अवद्य. (The reading अनूद्य in the actual edition of Pāṇ. III. 1. 101. is to be corrected to अनुद्य.) E. अ neg. and उद्य.
3002: अनुद्योग Tatpur. m. (-गः) Absence of exertion or effort, laziness. E. अ neg. and उद्योग.
3003: अनुद्रष्टव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be recognised, to be seen, visible. E. दृश् with अनु, kṛt aff. तव्य.
3004: अनुद्रुत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Followed, pursued. E. द्रु with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त. II. n. (-तम्) A measure of time in music, half a Druta, or one-fourth of a Mātrā or time taken to articulate a short vowel. E. अनु and द्रुत ‘an inferior or minor Druta’.
3005: अनुद्वाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Celibacy. E. अ neg. and उद्वाह.
3006: अनुद्विग्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्नः-ग्ना-ग्नम्) Easy, free from ap-prehension or perplexity. E. अन् neg. and उद्विग्न.
3007: अनुद्वेग I. Tatpur. m. (-गः) Freedom from anxiety, the not being discomposed. E. अ neg. and उद्वेग. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) Free from anxiety. E. अ priv. and उद्वेग.
3008: अनुद्वेगकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Not causing fear, not terrifying sc. by its appearance (e. g. as the staff of a man belonging to the three superior castes, or as a judge ought to be). E. अ neg. and उद्वेगकर.
3009: अनुधावन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) I. 	1 Chasing, pursuit, running after. 	2 (fig.) Pursuit of any object, research, investigation, medita-tion. II. Cleansing, purifying. E. धाव् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3010: अनुध्यान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Meditation, religious contempla-tion. E. ध्यै with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3011: अनुध्यायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Meditating, re-flecting. E. ध्यै with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
3012: अनुनय I. Tatpur. m. (-यः) 	1 Salutation, courtesy, shewing respect or adoration to a guest or deity, submission, hu-mility. 	2 Humble supplication, conciliatory entreaty, re-concilement. E. नी with अनु, kṛt aff. अच्. II. Avyayībh. (-यम्) According to propriety, agreeably to what is required, to circumstance; e. g. अब्रवीदनुनयं वचः. E. अनु and नय.
3013: अनुनयप्रतिघप्रहाण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) (In Buddhistic literature.) One of the 108 धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.), (probably) relinquish-ing what is adverse to respectful conduct or humility. E. अनुनय-प्रतिघ and प्रहाण.
3014: अनुनयमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Showing respect or adoration, honouring. E. नी with अनु, kṛt aff. शानच्, and āgama मुक्.
3015: अनुनयामन्त्रण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) An address marked with conciliation, conciliatory address. E. अनुनय and आमन्त्रण.
3016: अनुनयिन् m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Courteous, humble, sub-missive. E. अनुनय, taddh. aff. इनि.
3017: अनुनाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Sound, consequent sound, vibration, echo. E. अनु and नाद.
3018: अनुनादिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Sounding after, echoing; e. g. कलानुनादिन् q. v. E. अनु and नादिन्.
3019: अनुनायिका Tatpur. f. (-का) A secondary or inferior female character in a drama, one subordinate to the नायिका or prin-cipal female character, such as ‘a friend, a female devotee, a slave, a nurse or female artisans’. E. अनु and नायिका.
3020: अनुनाश Tatpur. m. (-शः) The name of a country (? this meaning is doubtful). E. अनु and नाश.
3021: अनुनासिक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) (In Grammar.) Uttered through the nose, nasal (see also रक्त), viz. 	1 A nasal sound in general, it being pronounced through the nose and with the appropriate organ of speech, as ङ् through the nose and the throat, ञ् through the nose and with the palate &c. 	2 (Conditionally) a vowel or य्, व्, ल्; in this case the nasal nature of the sound is indicated by the sign ंँ. (N. B. य्ंँ or व्ंँ represent the value of य् or व् preceded by म्; ल्ंँ that of ल् preceded by म् or न्. In the pause a final vowel may be anunāsika. A short anunāsika vowel, when not occurr-ing in a pause, represents apparently always the value of the same vowel and म् or न्; it must be, in general, the last vowel sound of the former part of a compound or of the word itself, followed by a final sibilant, e. g. संँस्कर्ता instead of सम्स्-कर्ता, पुंँश्चली = पुम्स्-चली, तस्मिंँस्त्वा = तस्मिन्स्-त्वा. Only a few exceptions of this rule are mentioned by the vaidik grammarians, e. g. अमिनन्तंँ एवैः, when अ of न्त is anunāsika, although it does neither stand in a pause nor represent more than its own sound.--A long anunāsika vowel, when not occurring in a pause, may be generally considered as representing the value of its short vowel and an original न्त्स् or of its short vowel and न्त्, provided स् or its substitute has been preserved; e. g. महांँ इन्द्रः = महन्त्स् इन्द्रः, दधन्वांँ यः = दधन्वन्त्स् यः, सर्गांँ इव = सर्गन्त्स् इव or महांँश्चरति = महन्त्स् चरति, दस्यूंँरेकः = दस्युन्त्स् एकः. The material difference that prevails between the anunāsika (ंँ) and the anusvāra (ं) sound, does not appear to have been kept alive beyond the period of the vaidik literature, when an interchange between both was not deemed legiti-mate; according to the grammarians of the classical period, in the latter the anunāsika may be replaced by the anu-svāra. The sign of the anunāsika (ंँ), however, is but seldom met with in the ordinary Mss. referring to the post-vaidik literature; and from the reasons stated, its use in vaidik Mss. is objectionable, when it occurs in words like यशांँसि, धनूंँषि, विश्वेषांँ हितः or in मंँहिष्ठ, वाजंँ सनिषत्, इन्द्रंँ स्तवाम and similar instances in which the long nasal vowel does not represent more than the value of a short vowel and a nasal, or in which the short nasal vowel is not fol-lowed by a final sibilant.) E. अनु and नासिका.
3022: अनुनासिकत्व n. (-त्वम्) The being nasal, nasality. E. अनु-नासिक, taddh. aff. त्व.
3023: अनुनासिकलोप Tatpur. m. (-पः) The dropping or disappear-ance of a nasal. E. अनुनासिक and लोप.
3024: अनुनासिकात्व n. (-त्वम्) The nasality of आ. E. अनुनासिक-आ, taddh. aff. त्व.
3025: अनुनासिकादि Bahuvr. m. (-दिः) A combined consonant be-ginning with a nasal (न् &c.) as न्द् &c. E. अनुनासिक and आदि; scil. संयोग.
3026: अनुनासिकान्त Bahuvr. m. (-न्तः) A radical ending in a nasal; as तन्, गम् &c. E. अनुनासिक and अन्त; scil. धातु.
3027: अनुनासिकोपध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) 	1 Having a nasal penultimate. 	2 Having a preceding syllable pronounced with nasality (as a विवृत्ति or hiatus between सचांँ इन्द्रः &c.). E. अनुनासिक and उपधा.
3028: अनुनिनीषु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-षुः-षुः-षु) Desirous of showing respect, of reconciling, of pleasing. E. नी in the desider., with अनु, kṛt aff. उ.
3029: अनुनिर्देश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Telling, describing &c. (see निर्देश) in accordance with, in the same order as something pre-viously told; e. g. भूयसामुपदिष्टानां क्रियाणामथ कर्मणाम्। क्रमशो योऽनुनिर्देशो यथासंख्यं तदुच्यते. E. अनु and निर्देश.
3030: अनुनिर्वाप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Subsequently pouring out (e. g. clarified butter); a sacrificial rite occurring in several sacri-fices. E. अनु and निर्वाप.
3031: अनुनिर्वाप्या f. (-प्या) A religious ceremony referring to the अनुनिर्वाप. E. अनुनिर्वाप, taddh. aff. यत्.
3032: अनुनीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) The same as अनुनय. E. नी with अनु, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
3033: अनुन्नतगात्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Whose limbs are not too full (one of the eighty secondary signs or अनुव्यञ्जन which characterize a great man according to the Buddhists. E. अ neg. and उन्नतगात्र.
3034: अनुन्मत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Sane, sober, not wild, not mad. E. अ neg. and उन्मत्त.
3035: अनुन्माद Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्). The same as अनुन्मत्त. E. अ priv. and उन्माद.
3036: अनुपकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Not assisting, neglecting, ungrateful. E. अ neg. and उपकारिन्.
3037: अनुपकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unassisted. E. अ neg. and उपकृत.
3038: अनुपक्षित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not destroyed, not perished. E. अ neg. and उपक्षित.
3039: अनुपगीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not praised, not made known. (In a vaidik passage, where this word occurs, it means ‘not praised by others’.) E. अ neg. and उपगीत.
3040: अनुपघातार्जित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (In Law.) Ac-quired without injury (to the father's property). E. अ neg. and उपघात-अर्जित.
3041: अनुपघ्नत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्-न्ती-त्) Not doing injury (e. g. पितृद्रव्यम् to the father's property). E. अ neg. and उपघ्नत्.
3043: अनुपजीवनीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) I. Tatpur. Who does not afford means to live upon. E. अ neg. and उपजीवनीय. II. Bahuvr. Who has nothing to live upon. E. अ priv. and उपजीवनीय.
3044: अनुपठित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Recited. E. पठ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
3045: अनुपठितिन् m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) Having recited, with a noun in the locative, e. g. अनुपठिती वेदे ‘having recited the Veda. E. अनुपठित, taddh. aff. इनि.
3046: अनुपतन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) 	1 Falling on or upon. 	2 Following. 	3 (In Arithmetic.) Proportion. E. पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3047: अनुपति Avyayībh. After the husband. E. अनु and पति.
3048: अनुपतित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Fallen, descended. 	2 Followed. E. पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
3049: अनुपथ I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्) Following the road. II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्) Having favourable roads (a vaidik epithet of the Maruts). E. अनु and पथिन्, samāsānta aff. अ. III. Avyayībh. (-थम्) Along the road. E. अनु and पथिन्, samāsānta aff. टच्.
3050: अनुपद् Tatpur. f. (-द्) Food (according to a vaidik comm. ‘because it is daily searched for). E. पद् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्विप्.
3051: अनुपद I. Bahuvr. m. (-दः) A proper name (explained by a comm. अनुगतं पदमस्य); his descendants are called अनुपदाः or आनुपदयः. II. Tatpur. n. (-दम्) A burden, a word or passage repeated. III. Avyayībh. (-दम्) 	1 Upon the foot, after, immediately after, with a noun in the genitive case. 	2 Step by step. 	3 Word for word. E. अनु and पद.
3052: अनुपदसूत्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) The name of a work which in-terprets the Shaḍvinśabrāhmaṇa word for word. E. अनुपद (III.) and सूत्र.
3053: अनुपदस्वत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्वान्-स्वती-स्वत्) (ved.) Probably: not diminishing, not decaying. E. अ neg. and उपदस्वत्.
3054: अनुपदिन् m. (-दी) A searcher, an inquirer, one who follows or seeks for, with a noun in the genit., e. g. मृगस्यानुपदी, अनुपद्युष्ट्राणाम्. E. अनुपद (III.), taddh. aff. इनि.
3055: अनुपदीना f. (-ना) A boot, a buskin. E. अनुपद (III.), taddh. aff. ख.
3056: अनुपदृष्टिन् m. (-ष्टी) A proper name. E. अ-उपदृष्ट, taddh. aff. इनि(?).
3057: अनुपदेष्टृ Tatpur. m. (-ष्टा) One who does not advise or in-struct; e. g. हितानुपदेष्टा कुत्सितः सखा. E. अ neg. and उपदेष्टृ.
3058: अनुपध Bahuvr. m. (-धः) Not preceded by a letter (liter. having no penultimate; as a sibilant or ह् which may be doubled if they are followed by a consonant and not pre-ceded by a letter; e. g. श्श्चोतन्त्यभितः, ह्ह्वयाम्यग्निम्). E. अ priv. and उपधा; scil. ऊष्मन्.
3059: अनुपनाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) (In Buddhistic doctrine.) One of the 108 धर्मालोकमुख q. v.; (perhaps) want of attachment(?). E. अ neg. and उपनाह.
3060: अनुपन्यस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) Not laid down, not established, not clearly shown. E. अ neg. and उपन्यस्त.
3061: अनुपन्यास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Failure of proof or determination, the not establishing satisfactorily. E. अ neg. and उपन्यास.
3062: अनुपपत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) 	1 The not taking place, failing to be, failure. 	2 The not being applied or applicable (as a rule in grammar &c.). 	3 The not being conclusive (as an argument &c. brought to support a doctrine). 	4 Absence of the means of subsistence(?). E. अ neg. and उपपत्ति.
3063: अनुपपन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) 	1 Uneffected, unac-complished. 	2 Not applicable, not relevant. 	3 Inconclusive (as an argument). 	4 Undemonstrated, unsubstantiated. 	5 Not having means of subsistence(?). E. अ neg. and उपपन्न.
3064: अनुपपादक Bahuvr. m. pl. (-काः) (In the Buddhistic doctrine of Nepal) a class of Buddhas which is of non-material ori-gin, also called ध्यानिबुद्धाः ‘the Buddhas of contemplation’; in contradistinction from the मानुषिबुद्धाः or the seven Bud-dhas of human origin, the last of which is Śākyamuni. E. अ priv. and उपपादक lit. ‘without a parent’.
3065: अनुपप्लव Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Free from misfortune, not distressed. E. अ priv. and उपप्लव.
3066: अनुपप्लुत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्). The same as the pre-ceding. E. अ neg. and उपप्लुत.
3067: अनुपबाध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) (ved.) Not obstructed, not injured. E. अ priv. and उपबाधा.
3068: अनुपम Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Incomparable, ex-cellent, best. II. f. (-मा) The female elephant of the south-west (as the wife of the elephant Kumuda) or according to others, of the north-east (as the wife of the elephant Supratīka). E. अ priv. and उपमा.
3069: अनुपममति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) The proper name of a con-temporary of Śākyamuni, one of those to whom the Buddha expounded his doctrine. E. अनुपम and मति ‘of incom-parable intellect’.
3070: अनुपमर्दन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Not refuting a charge. E. अ neg. and उपमर्दन.
3071: अनुपमित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Incomparable. E. अ neg. and उपमित.
3072: अनुपमेय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Incomparable. E. अ neg. and उपमेय.
3073: अनुपयुक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Useless, unsuitable, unserviceable. E. अ neg. and उपयुक्त (as according to a law book, ‘vaidik writings to fools’).
3074: अनुपयोग Tatpur. m. (-गः) Unserviceableness, uselessness. E. अ neg. and उपयोग.
3075: अनुपरत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not stopped, not ceased. E. अ neg. and उपरत.
3076: अनुपरिधि Avyayībh. Along or near the परिधि q. v. E. अनु and परिधि.
3077: अनुपलक्षित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Unseen, unper-ceived. 	2 Unmarked, undiscriminated. E. अ neg. and उपलक्षित.
3078: अनुपलब्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ब्धः-ब्धा-ब्धम्) 	1 Unobtained. 	2 Unperceived, imperceptible. E. अ neg. and उपलब्ध.
3079: अनुपलब्धत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as अनुपलम्भ q. v. E. अनु-पलब्ध, taddh. aff. त्व.
3080: अनुपलब्धि Tatpur. m. (-ब्धिः) Not perceiving, non-perception, non-recognition (esp. used in the Sūtras of various philos. systems and the writings relating to them. See also अनु-पलम्भ and अनुपलब्धिसम). E. अ neg. and उपलब्धि.
3081: अनुपलब्धिसम Tatpur. m. f. (-मः-मा) (In the Nyāya philo-sophy.) A sophism on non-perception; viz. arguing: ‘be-cause the non-perception of an object cannot be perceived, therefore the non-perception of the object does not exist and consequently the non-existence of the object cannot exist i. e. the object itself must exist’. This sophism is at-tributed by the Nyāya e. g. to those who maintain the eter-nity of sound on the ground that ‘the non-perception of sound antecedently to pronunciation’--the reason alleged by the Nyāya for its non-eternity--may be refuted in the manner explained. E. अनुपलब्धि and सम (m. scil. प्रतिषेध or विकल्प or प्रयोग; f. scil. जाति; comp. for the meaning of these words the E. of अनित्यसम).
3082: अनुपलभ्यमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not being per-ceived, not being seen. E. अ neg. and उपलभ्यमान.
3083: अनुपलम्भ Tatpur. m. (-म्भः) The not being perceived, ascer-tained, or the not being perceptible, ascertainable; e. g. तदनुपलब्धेरनुपलम्भादावरणोपलब्धिः ‘the perception of a covering is from the non-perception there of not being percep-tible’. See अनुपलब्धि and अनुपलब्धिसम. E. अ neg. and उपलम्भ.
3084: अनुपवीतिन् Tatpur. m. (-ती) One who does not wear the cord of his caste. E. अ neg. and उपवीतिन्.
3085: अनुपशय Tatpur. m. (-यः) (In Medicine.) Any aggravating thing or circumstance that increases the disease. E. अ neg. and उपशय.
3086: अनुपशान्त Tatpur. 1. m. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Not calm, not tranquil. 2. m. (-न्तः) The name of a Bauddha mendicant. E. अ neg. and उपशान्त.
3087: अनुपश्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्यः-श्या-श्यम्) Looking after, con-sidering attentively. See प्रत्ययानुपश्य. E. दृश् with अनु, kṛt aff. श.
3088: अनुपसंहारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) (In philosophy.) Non-exclusive, purely affirmative, as an argument of all-comprehensiveness whose subject does not exclude any thing; as such an argument would lead to a conclusion of a purely formal kind, i. e. to no real conclusion, अनुपसंहारिन् is the characteristic of one of the modes of हेत्वाभास (q. v.) or ‘semblance of argument’; compare also अनैकान्तिक. E. अ neg. and उपसंहारिन्.
3089: अनुपसर्ग I. Tatpur. m. (-र्गः) (In Grammar.) A particle which (or when it) is not an उपसर्ग (q. v.), for instance अन्तर् in com-pounds like अन्तर्वण, or अभि, परि in formations like अभि-सावकीयति, परिसावकीयति, when अभि and परि do not quali-fy the radical सु but the denom. सावकीयति. E. अ neg. and उपसर्ग. II. Bahuvr. m. (-र्गः) 	1 Without an उपसर्ग q. v. (as a radical). 	2 Without obstruction, free from impediment; an epithet of ईश्वर. E. अ priv. and उपसर्ग.
3090: अनुपसर्गत्व n. (-त्वम्) The not being an उपसर्ग q. v. (see the preceding). E. अनुपसर्ग (I.), taddh. aff. त्व.
3091: अनुपस्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not vitiated, not blamed, blameless (e. g. the law of Manu). 	2 Not orna-mented, unfinished; e. g. राजतमनुपस्कृतम् a silver vessel not enchased. E. अ neg. and उपस्कृत.
3092: अनुपस्थान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Absence. E. अ neg. and उपस्थान.
3093: अनुपस्थापन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Not bringing near, not having ready or at hand. E. अ neg. and उपस्थापन.
3094: अनुपस्थापयत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यन्-यन्ती-यत्) Not offering, not having ready or at hand (e. g. money). E. अ neg. and उपस्थापयत्.
3095: अनुपस्थापित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not ready, not at hand, not offered or produced. E. अ neg. and उपस्थापित.
3096: अनुपस्थायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Absent, distant. E. अ neg. and उपस्थायिन्.
3097: अनुपस्थित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not approached &c. 	2 Not ready, not fresh in memory. 	3 Sunk into oblivion (as a science &c.). II. n. (-तम्) (In Grammar.) A word which is not उपस्थित (q. v.) i. e. which is not the word इति as it occurs in the writings referring to the recitation of the vaidik hymns. E. अ neg. and उपस्थित.
3098: अनुपस्थिति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Absence. E. अ neg. and उपस्थिति.
3099: अनुपहत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not injured, not impaired, not obstructed. 	2 Not polluted, not vitiated, not made impure. E. अ neg. and उपहत.
3100: अनुपहतक्रुष्ट Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Who has (in his aspect) nothing that indicates injury or anger (one of the eighty secondary signs (or अनुव्यञ्जन) which characterize a great man, acc to the Buddhists. E. अ priv. and उपहत-क्रुष्ट.
3101: अनुपहूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not summoned, not invoked. 	2 Not summoned in a loud voice, invoked in a low voice. E. अ 1. neg. 2. deter. and उपहूत.
3102: अनुपाकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not prepared or made fit for sacrificial purposes (as a victim before the muttering of prayers over it, or as the प्रातरनुवाक before the com-pletion of the ceremonies required for it &c.). E. अ neg. and उपाकृत.
3103: अनुपाकृतमांस Karmadh. n. (-सम्) Flesh of an animal which has not been made fit for sacrificial purposes by the recital of vaidik hymns, flesh of an animal which has not been killed at a sacrifice. (A Brahmaṇa is forbidden to eat such flesh.) E. अनुपाकृत and मांस.
3104: अनुपाख्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ख्यः-ख्या-ख्यम्) Not clearly per-ceptible. E. अ neg. and उपाख्य.
3105: अनुपात Tatpur. m. (-तः) 	1 Falling subsequently upon, alight-ing or descending upon in succession. 	2 Following. 	3 (In arithmetic.) Proportion, the rule of three. E. अनु and पात or पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. ण.
3106: अनुपातक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) A heinous offence, one similar to the four great crimes (महापातक) which are: 	a. Causing the death of a Brāhmaṇa (directly or indirectly). 	b. Drink-ing spirits. 	c. Stealing (acc. to the comm. ‘gold from a Brāhmaṇa’). 	d. Committing incest with the wife of a father, natural or spiritual. The अनुपातक mentioned by Manu are the following: 1. False boasting of superiority (as pretending to be a Brāhmaṇa or conversant with the four Vedas, if one is not); 2. Malignant report, before a king, of crimes (comm.: punishable by death)--omitted by Yājnavalkya--; 3. Falsely accusing a spiritual preceptor; 4. Forgetting the Veda; 5. Showing contempt of the Veda (comm.: by resorting to heretical writings); 6. Giving false evidence (omitted by Yājnav.); 7. Killing a friend (comm.: not a Brāhmaṇa, this case being the first महापातक); 8. (Knowingly) eating things prohibited (i. e. food fit only for a Śūdra, as garlick &c.) or unfit to be tasted (as excrements &c.); [9. (According to Yājnavalkya) Kissing a woman while in menstruation; 10. (Acc. to Yājn.) Deceitfulness (i. e. saying one thing and doing another)]; 11. Appro-priating a deposit (comm.: not the gold of a Brāhmaṇa (this case being the third महापातक) or acc. to another author. a deposit not of gold, if it belongs to a Brāhmaṇa); 12--17. Stealing a man, a horse, silver, a piece of land, a diamond or a gem [acc. to Yājnavalkya, 12--17. a horse, a gem, a man, a woman, a piece of land, and a cow]; 18--22. Sexual intercourse with one's own sister, with little girls before they have attained to puberty, with women of the lowest tribe (comm.: a Chāṇdālī), with the wives of a friend or of a son [to which Yājnavalkya adds: 23--30. with a woman of the same gotra or family, the sister of a father or mother, the wife of a maternal uncle, the wife of one's father, the daughter or wife of a spiritual teacher or one's own daughter; Nārada adds moreover: 31--40. with a mother in law, the wife of a paternal uncle or of a pupil, the friend of a sister, one who comes for protection, the wife of one who carries on the government of the country--comm.: if he is not a Kshatriya--, a nurse, a female mendicant, a female devotee and a woman of the Brāhmaṇa class.]--Similar to the first Mahāpātaka are the Anupātakas, acc. to Manu, 1--3, acc. to Yājnavalkya, 3--5 and 7. Similar to the second Mahāpātaka are the Anup., acc. to Manu, 4--8; acc. to Yājnav., 1. 8. 9. 10. Similar to the third Mahāp. are the Anup., acc. to Manu and Yājnav., 11--17. Similar to the fourth Mahāp. are, according to Manu, the Anupāt. 18--22, acc. to Yājnav. (and Nārada, Yama &c.), 18-40. E. अनु and पातक.
3107: अनुपातम् Tatpur. ind. Following, going after, having fol-lowed or gone after (used in phrases implying reiteration; for the construction comp. s. v. अनुप्रपातम्); e. g. लतानु-पातं कुसुमान्यगृह्लात् ‘following creeper for creeper &c.’, क्रीडन्भुजङ्गेन गृहानुपातं कश्चिद्यथा जीवति संशयस्थः &c. ‘like as a snake-catcher who plays with the snake is always in uncertainty whenever he goes house for house &c.’. E. पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. णमुल्.
3108: अनुपातिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) 	1 Following. 	2 Re-sulting from e. g. शब्दज्ञानानुपाती वस्तुशून्यो विकल्पः ‘imagi-nation is (a notion) devoid of reality, resulting from know-ledge conveyed by words’. E. पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
3109: अनुपान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) 	1 (In Medicine.) A fluid vehicle in medicine, drink taken after or with medicine. 	2 (In a pas-sage of the Chhānd. Upan.) Drink which is near or stands close by. E. अनु and पान.
3110: अनुपानत्क Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्कः-त्का-त्कम्) Without shoes. E. अ priv. and उपानह्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
3111: अनुपानीय I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) To be drunk after. E. पा with अनु, kṛtya aff. अनीयर्. 2. n. (-यम्) Drink which is near (see अनुपान). E. अनु and पानीय. II. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) What is used as a vehicle (in medicine). E. अनुपान, taddh. aff. छ.
3112: अनुपालन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Preserving, guarding; e. g. वि-द्यानुपालन keeping to science, studying. E. पा, in the caus., with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3113: अनुपालयत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्-न्ती-त्) 	1 Preserving, taking care of; e. g. अभिवर्षति योऽनुपालयन्विधिवीजानि विवेक-वारिणा &c. 	2 (Accord. to a comm.) Neglecting, disregard-ing; e. g. अनुपालयतामुदेष्यतीं प्रभुशक्तिं द्विषतामनीहया। अ-पयान्त्यचिरान्महीभुजां जननिर्वादभयादिव श्रियः (the comm. referring अनुपालयताम् = उपेक्षमाणानाम् not to द्विषताम् but to महीभुजाम्). E. पा, in the caus., with अनु, kṛt aff. शतृ.
3114: अनुपालिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ली-लिनी-लि) Preserving, cherishing, guarding; e. g. विद्यानुपालिन्. E. पा, in the caus., with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
3115: अनुपालु Tatpur. n. (-लु) The name of a plant (wild Calladium escul.). It is doubtful whether the word is genuine Sanskrit. E. unknown.
3116: अनुपावृत्त Tatpur. m. pl. (-त्ताः) The name of a people. E. अ neg. and उपावृत्त.
3117: अनुपार्श्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्श्वः-र्श्वा-र्श्वम्) Lateral. E. अनु and पार्श्व.
3118: अनुपुरुष Tatpur. m. (-षः) 	1 The man spoken of before, the said man. 	2 A man who follows, a follower. E. अनु and पुरुष.
3119: अनुपुष्प Bahuvr.(?) m. (-ष्पः) A kind of read (Saccharum sara). See also शर. E. अनु and पुष्प.
3120: अनुपूर्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्वः-र्वा-र्वम्) 	1 Following what pre-cedes, successive. 	2 Orderly, in regular or proper order; अनुपूर्वम् used adv., in regular or proper order, successively. Comp. अनुपूर्वशस्.
3121: अनुपूर्वकेश Bahuvr. m. (-शः) Whose hairs are grown in per-fect order; one of the eighty secondary signs or अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. which indicate the ‘great man’, accord. to the Bud-dhists. E. अनुपूर्व and केश.
3122: अनुपूर्वगात्र Bahuvr. m. (-त्रः) Whose limbs are regular or symmetrical; one of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (compare the preceding), accord. to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and गात्र.
3123: अनुपूर्वज Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Born of parents in the regular sequence of the castes. Comp. अनुलोमज. E. अनुपूर्व and ज.
3124: अनुपूर्वत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as आनुपूर्व्य q. v. E. अनुपूर्व, taddh. aff. त्व.
3125: अनुपूर्वदंष्ट्र Bahuvr. m. (-ष्ट्रः) Whose (large?) teeth are grown in a regular manner or symmetrically; one of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (compare अनुपूर्वकेश); accord. to the Bud-dhists. E. अनुपूर्व and दंष्ट्रा.
3126: अनुपूर्वनाभि Bahuvr. m. (-भिः) Whose navel is regular (acc. to an interpretation, whose navel turns to the right); one of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (comp. the preced.); accord. to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and नाभि.
3127: अनुपूर्वपाणिलेख Bahuvr. m. (-खः) Whose lines of the hands are regular (acc. to an interpretation: extended); one of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (comp. the two preced.), accord. to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and पाणि-लेखा.
3128: अनुपूर्वभ्रू Bahuvr. m. (-भ्रूः) Whose eye-brows are regular (acc. to an interpret.: well shaped or with hairs in the proper order); one of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (comp. the three preced.); accord. to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and भ्रू.
3129: अनुपूर्ववत्सा Bahuvr. f. (-त्सा) A cow which bears one calf after an other, an excellent cow. E. अनुपूर्व and वत्स.
3130: अनुपूर्वशस् ind. In regular order or succession, from the first, from above downwards; also followed by a noun in the genitive. E. अनुपूर्व, taddh. aff. शस्.
3131: अनुपूर्वाङ्गुलि Bahuvr. m. (-लिः) Whose fingers are grown in a regular or graceful manner; one of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (comp. अनुपूर्वकेश); according to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and अङ्गुलि.
3132: अनुपेत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Not endowed with &c. 	2 Not invested with the characteristic (caste-)string. E. अ neg. and उपेत.
3133: अनुपोषण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Not fasting. E. अ neg. and उपोषण.
3134: अनुप्तशस्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्यः-स्या-स्यम्) Fallow (meadow-ground &c.). E. अ neg. and उप्तशस्य.
3135: अनुप्त्रिम Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Not produced by sow-ing, grown wild. E. अ neg. and उप्त्रिम.
3136: अनुप्रदान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Giving, gift, donation. E. दा with प्र and अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3137: अनुप्रपातम् Tatpur. ind. Following, going after, having fol-lowed or gone after. (Used in phrases which imply re-iteration; either in composition with a noun in the sense of an accusative, or when not compounded with a noun, following the noun which then is repeated, or repeated itself after the noun, which then is not repeated; e. g. गेहानुप्र-पातमास्ते or गेहं गेहमनुप्रपातमास्ते or गेहमनुप्रपातमनुप्रपात-मास्ते ‘having gone house by house he sits down’. Com-pare अनुपातम्. E. अनु and प्रपातम् (पत् with प्र, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
3138: अनुप्रपादम् Tatpur. ind. The same as the preceding and used in the same manner, e. g. गेहानुप्रपादम् &c. See the pre-ceding. E. पद् with प्र and अनु, kṛt aff. णमुल्.
3139: अनुप्रमाण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Of proportionate length (as a surgical instrument). E. अनु and प्रमाण.
3140: अनुप्रयुज्यमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Added afterwards, joined subsequently (as a word). E. अनु and प्रयुज्यमान.
3141: अनुप्रयोक्तव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be added afterwards or subsequently (as a word). E. अनु and प्रयोक्तव्य.
3142: अनुप्रयोग Tatpur. m. (-गः) Adding or joining afterwards, a subsequent addition (as of a word). E. अनु and प्रयोग.
3143: अनुप्ररोह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Growing or budding in conformity with. E. अनु and प्ररोह.
3144: अनुप्रवचन Tatpur. n. (-नम्). Probably the same as अनुवचन q. v. E. अनु and प्रवचन.
3145: अनुप्रवचनीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Referring to, having for its object the अनुप्रवचन. E. अनुप्रवचन, taddh. aff. छ.
3146: अनुप्रवेश Tatpur. m. (-शः) 	1 Returning. 	2 Entering. See अनु-प्रवेशम्. E. अनु and प्रवेश.
3147: अनुप्रवेशन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) 	1 Returning. 	2 Entering E. अनु and प्रवेशन.
3148: अनुप्रवेशनीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Referring to the return or entering, having the return or entering for its object. E. अनुप्रवेशन, taddh. aff. छ.
3149: अनुप्रवेशम् Tatpur. ind. 	1 Returning. 	2 Entering; used like अनुप्रपातम् q. v. E. अनु and प्रवेशम् (विश् with प्र, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
3150: अनुप्रश्न Tatpur. m. (-श्नः) A question referring to what has been said before (e. g. by the spiritual teacher). E. अनु and प्रश्न, or प्रच्छ् with अनु, kṛt aff. नङ्.
3151: अनुप्रसक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः) Connexion with, esp. logical connexion. E. अनु and प्रसक्ति.
3152: अनुप्रसर्पिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्पी-र्पिणी-र्पि) Going after, fol-lowing. E. सृप् with प्र and अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
3153: अनुप्रस्थ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्) Latitudinal. E. अनु and प्रस्थ.
3154: अनुप्रहरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Throwing into. E. हृ with प्र and अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3155: अनुप्राप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) 	1 Obtained, found. 	2 Reached, arrived. E. आप् with प्र and अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
3156: अनुप्रास Tatpur. m. (-सः) (In Rhetoric.) Repetition of similar letters, syllables or words, alliteration or rhyme; an अलं-कार or mode of writing elegantly, so far as the sound is concerned (see शब्दालंकार) with five varieties; see छेकानु-प्रास, वृत्त्यनुप्रास, श्रुत्यनुप्रास, अन्त्यानुप्रास and लाटानुप्रास; see also उद्भटानुप्रास. E. अनु and प्रास or अस् with प्र and अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
3157: अनुप्लव Tatpur. m. f. (-वः-वी) A companion, a follower. E. प्लु with अनु, kṛt aff. अच् and टित्.
3158: अनुबद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Bound to, connected with. E. बन्ध् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
3159: अनुबन्ध Tatpur. I. m. (-न्धः) 	1 Binding, confining. 	2 Connexion, association, attachment; close relation; e. g. पूर्वाभ्यस्तस्मृत्य-नुबन्धः ‘connexion with the memory of things previously acquired’. नीवारादिषु चोदनानुबन्धः ‘the injunction relates to or concerns wild rice &c. (not व्रीहि). 	3 An uninterrupted series, e. g. वैरानुबन्धः a series of hostilities or heroic deeds. 	4 Consequence, result, e. g. पूर्वकृतफलानुबन्धात्तदुत्पत्तिः ‘it (the body) is produced in consequence of the fruits of its former deeds’. 	5 Cause esp. of a crime &c., e. g. अनुबन्धं परिज्ञाय…दण्डं पातयेत् let (the king) having ascertained the cause (comm.: of the offence) inflict punishment; or of an untoward event &c., e. g. विरात्रे चागतं कस्मात्कोऽनु-बन्धश्च तेऽभवत् ‘why hast thou come so late in the night and what was the cause (comm.: of the delay)?’ 	6 Com-mencement, beginning. 	7 A child (this meaning seems doubt-ful, at least as regards its etymol. interpretation; acc. to some it would be qualified as मुख्यानुयायिन् ‘following the chief i. e. the father &c. at the marriage ceremony &c.; the instance given however would not seem to countenance the meaning viz. बालकानुबन्धेन यात्राभङ्गो मा भूत् ‘let the festival not be disturbed by the incumbrance of children’; accord. to others the meaning ‘child’ would imply the tie of af-fection). 	8 (In the system of the native grammarians.) An indicatory letter which is annexed to radicals (धातु), no-minal bases (प्रातिपदिक), affixes (प्रत्यय), particles (निपात), inserted letters (आगम) and substitutes (आदेश), to mark some peculiarity in the accent, inflection or derivation; for instance an indicatory इ denotes that verbs require the in-sertion of a nasal before their final consonant; the anu-bandha may be a vowel (in this case it is अनुनासिक q. v. in the system of Pāṇini) or a consonant. Being a mere technical element it cannot occur in real language. Instances of anubandhas may be gathered from the etymologies in this Dictionary. See also इत्. 	9 Any thing small or little, a part, a small part. 	10 (In Medicine.) A secondary or sym-ptomatic affection, one supervening on the principal disease. 	11 (In Arithmetic.) Junction or union; see भागानुबन्ध. 	12 (In the Vedānta philosophy.) An indispensable element of the study of the Vedānta; it consists of 	a. the अधिकारिन् or the competent person, one who is well versed in the vaidik writings, observes the ceremonies &c., is purified in his heart &c.; 	b. the विषय or the object-matter viz. the identity of the individual soul and Brahman (neuter); 	c. the संबन्ध or the relation viz. between that identity to be proved and the authoritative evidence contained in the Upanishads, and 	d. the प्रयोजन or the purpose viz. the cessation of ignorance and attainment of eternal bliss. II. f. (-न्धी) 	1 Hickup. 	2 Thirst. E. बन्ध् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्, in the fem. with ङीष्.
3160: अनुबन्धन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Connexion, association. E. बन्ध् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3161: अनुबन्धिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्धी-न्धिनी-न्धि) Connected with, followed as by a consequence; e. g. हितानुबन्धिन् having a salutary result, वैरानुबन्धिन् resulting in enmity. E. बन्ध् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
3162: अनुबन्ध्य I. Tatpur. m. f. (-न्ध्यः-न्ध्या) One of the three prin-cipal paśus or sacrificial animals in the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice. (See also अग्नीषोमीयपशु and सवनीयपशु.) It is a cow, and the proceedings with it take place after the Avabhṛtha on the fifth day of the Agniṣṭoma (q. v.). But as the sacrifice of a cow is forbidden in the present or Kali-yuga, a sub-stitute for it is an offering of curds of two-milk-whey.--Also written अनूबन्ध्य. E. बन्ध् with अनु, kṛtya aff. यत्; with the ellipsis of पशु for the masc. and of गो for the feminine. II. m. f. n. (-न्ध्यः-न्ध्या-न्ध्यम्) Principal, primary, what may receive an adjunct, as a root, a disease &c. E. अनुबन्ध, taddh. aff. यत्.
3163: अनुबन्ध्यपशु Karmadh. m. (-शुः) The sacrificial animal called अनुबन्ध्य. See the preceding. E. अनुबन्ध्य and पशु.
3164: अनुबल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) An army which follows, an auxiliary force. E. अनु and बल.
3165: अनुबीध Tatpur. m. (-धः) 	1 Reviving the scent of a faded perfume. 	2 Replacing perfumes removed by bathing &c. 	3 An after-thought. E. अनु and बोध.
3166: अनुबोधन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Recollecting, remembering. E. अनु and बोधन or बुध् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3167: अनुब्राह्मण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) A work similar to those called Brāhmaṇa. E. अनु and ब्राह्मण.
3168: अनुब्राह्मणिन् m. (-णी) One who studies or knows the work Anubrāhmaṇa. E. अनुब्राह्मण, taddh. aff. इनि.
3169: अनुभङ्गम् Avyayībh. According to defeat, fear &c.(?). Com-pare also आनुभङ्ग्य. E. अनु and भङ्ग.
3170: अनुभर्तृ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्ता-र्त्री-तृ) (ved.) Imitating, resembling. (The vaidik passage मरुतोऽनुभर्त्री where the word occurs is marked by the Prātiśākhya on account of the elision of अ after ओ.) E. भृ with अनु (comp. the meaning of हृ with अनु), kṛt aff. तृच्.
3171: अनुभव Tatpur. m. (-वः) Knowledge other than remembrance, apprehension, notion, understanding. The same as अनुभूति q. v.; e. g. पूर्वजन्मजातमरणदुःखानुभव ‘apprehension of the pains of death produced in a previous life’; or अयथार्था-नुभव q. v. E. भू with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
3172: अनुभवसिद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Established by perception, resulting from experience, e. g. कृतिचैतन्ययोः सामानाधिकरण्यमनुभवसिद्धम् ‘the common substratum be-tween action and consciousness is &c.’. E. अनुभव and सिद्ध.
3173: अनुभवसार Tatpur. m. (-रः) The name of a treatise on the merits of worshipping Śiva agreeably to the tenets of the Jangamas. E. अनुभव and सार.
3174: अनुभाव Tatpur. m. (-वः) 	1 Dignity, authority, power (such as results from wealth, a magisterial position &c.). 	2 Cer-tainty, resolution (only in the positive sense of a good re-solution, e. g. महानुभाव q. v.). 	3 (In rhetorical terminology.) ‘A symptom which indicated the feeling (भाव) produced by its appropriate causes’. These causes being naturally various from the character (रस) of a poetical composition, the rhetorical works enumerate the anubhāvas which are the concomitants of the different sorts of rasas; thus the symptoms of the Erotic (शृङ्गार) are according to them, motion of the eye-brows, side-glances &c.; of the Comic (हास्य), blinking with the eye, smiles &c.; of the Pathetic (करुण), cursing one's fate, falling to the ground, crying &c.; of the Terrible (रौद्र), abuse, fierce looks &c.; of the Heroic (वीर), looking for a companion &c.; of the Fearful (भयानक), change of colour, stammering &c.; of the Dis-gustful (बीभत्स), spitting, contracting the mouth, shutting the eyes &c.; of the Wonderful (अद्भुत), wide opening of the eyes &c.; of the Quietistic (शान्त), horripilation (sic) &c.; of the Affectionate (वत्सल), horripilation, joy, tears &c.--Compare भाव and विभाव. E. अनु and भाव, lit. ‘following or connected with condition, feeling &c.’.
3175: अनुभावक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वकः-विका-वकम्) Making intel-ligible. E. भू, in the caus., with अनु, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
3176: अनुभावन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) (In rhetoric.) Representing feel-ings so as to make then the characteristic (शृङ्गार &c. see रस and अनुभाव) of a poetical composition. E. भू, in the caus., with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3177: अनुभाविन् I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-वी-विनी-वि) Perceiving, knowing (e. g. a witness). 2. m. (-वी) (In law.) According to some, the same as सपिण्ड q. v., a near kinsman (i. e. ‘one who feels grief at a death in the family’), according to others, the same as ‘a young son’ (i. e. ‘one who is or comes after’). E. भू with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि. II. m. f. n. (-वी-विनी-वि) Having the symptoms which indicate feeling (see अनुभाव). E. अनुभाव, taddh. aff. इनि.
3178: अनुभाषण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) (In the Nyāya phil.) Repeating an argument proposed for discussion, i. e. taking it up; the contrary (not-repeating it when it has been announced three times besides the first time) being considered as a tacit agreement or avowal of defeat. See अननुभाषण. E. भाष् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
3179: अनुभास Tatpur. m. (-सः) A kind of crow. (Perhaps the word ought to be read अनुभाष when it might suggest the mean-ing of the Pica or Garrulus Argoratensis.) E. भास् (भाष्?) with अनु, kṛt aff. अच्(?).
3180: अनुभू Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भूः-भूः-भु) Perceiving, knowing. E. भू with अनु, kṛt aff. क्विप्.
3181: अनुभूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) 	1 Understood, judged, apprehended. 	2 Perceiving, understanding. 	3 Resulted, fol-lowed as a consequence. E. भू with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
3182: अनुभूति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) (In the Vaiśeṣika phil.) Appre-hension, one of the two essential properties of intellect (बुद्धि); it is four-fold viz. knowledge arising from the senses (see प्रत्यक्ष), inference (see अनुमिति), comparison (see उपमिति) and verbal knowledge (शब्दज). Comp. अनुभव. E. भू with अनु, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
3183: अनुभूतिप्रकाश Tatpur. m. (-शः) The name of a work which paraphrases the Upanishads, by Vidyāraṇyamuni. E. अनु-भूति and प्रकाश.
